Violeta plans to use the requested funds to buy an additional machine for the videogames business hoping thus to increase the number of customers that can visit daily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an additional PC to improve her vidiogames business.

loans.name: Gorxmaz

texts.ru:
Gorxmaz X. 36 let. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey, starshaya dochka kotoroy 12 let ona uchitsya v shkole , dochka 10 let toje uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya tancami, sin 6 let v etom qodu poshel v shkolu. Gorxmaz yavlyayetya IDP personom , on pereselenec iz Kalbadjar, seychas On i yeqo semya projivayut v Absheron regione.

Gorxmaz 7 let tomu nazad nachal zanimatsya etim biznessom perevozki stroy materialov. Etomu biznessu yeqo nauchil dyada kotoriy toje rabotayet v takom biznese. Seychas Gorxmaz nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey mashini chtobi sdelat remont.
texts.en:
Gorxmaz X. is 36 years old. He is married and has 3 children. The oldest daughter, who is 12 years old, goes to school, 10-year-old daughter also goes to school and is learning dance, 6-year-old son started school this year. Gorxmaz is an IDP (internally displaced person). He is a refugee from Kalbadjar and now lives in the Absheron region together with his family. Gorxmaz started the business of transporting construction materials 7 years ago. He learned this business from his uncle, who also works in this business. Now Gorxmaz needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for his vehicle in order to make repairs.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare auto parts

loans.name: Regine

texts.en: Regine is 28 years old. She is married with 3 children whose ages range between 3 and 7 years.  They are not yet in school. Her husband is a businessman. Regine has a shop where she sells sugar, salt, candles, maize flour, rice, soap , Vaseline, etc. She has been in this business for 4 years. The loan will be used to buy more goods to sell and with the profits she will pay school fees for her children and put aside savings. Regine is also famous for selling beer in her neighborhood so in return she gets customers to buy shop commodities as well. She is hoping to open up a big shop in the future selling commodities wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase salt, sugar, candles, rice and maize flour

loans.name: Julia Emperatriz.

texts.es:
Julia Emperatriz M. trabaja desde hace más veinte años como Enfermera Profesional siendo una dama muy alegre y con gran deseos de superar y mejorar las condiciones de vida.

Una de las necesidades que actualmente atraviesa su familia es que las condiciones de la vivienda han estado en malas condiciones y por este motivo es que ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de láminas de zinc para reparar su techo y así seguir adelante superando las condiciones de vida propia y de su familia.
texts.en:
Customer Julia Emperatriz M. M. lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, department of León, in front of the Nica Salud Pharmacy.  She is single and currently works at MINSA Santa Rosa del Peñón as a nurse.  She has been working at this institution for 20 years.

Julia has her own house, which she wants to improve.  The loan is for purchasing zinc sheets for the roof of her house, so that she can improve her resindence.  This will help her to provide for her family's well-being.

loans.use: Zinc for roof of her house

loans.name: John Muriithi

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Olkalou town since 1987. He is 61 years old, married to Monicah Waithera, and they have six children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid his previous loans in good time, and plans to use this loan to plant potatoes on his farm.

In future, John hopes to buy another piece of land and start large-scale farming.

loans.use: To plant potatoes on his farm.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Johanna Estefani Drakett Drakett tiene 35 años de edad con una amplia motivación por la Repostería Caribeña, negocio que  fundo hace 6 años al recibir gran inspiración de su madre.  Invertirá su crédito en la compra de ingredientes necesarios para continuar con la tradición familiar, solicitando un total de ₡500.000(Quinientos mil colones) para expandir su negocio en ámbitos nacionales e internacionales. Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal CrediFácil R. G S.A, una de las 100 empresas asociadas por EDESA.
texts.en:
Johanna Estefani Drakett Drakett is 35 years old and is very enthusiastic about La Repostería Caribeña (The Caribbean Bakery), a business her mother inspired her to start six years ago.  She will use the loan to buy necessary ingredients for continuing with the family tradition.  She is asking for a total of ₡500,000 (five hundred thousand colones) to expand her business on both a national and international level.

Johanna is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal CrediFácil R.G S.A  (EasyCredit Communal Loan Company), one of EDESA's 100 partner associations.

loans.use: Supplies for her bakery

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 50 years old and married with two children, who are 14 and 17 years old.  He runs a general retail store in Musanze market in Rwanda.  He has been in this business for two years and works from 6am until 6pm every day of the week.  

This is David's first loan request on Kiva and his second loan from Vision Finance Company.  He will use this loan to support his business through the purchasing of more products to sell.  He would like to use any extra income to continue to increase his sales in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his market store

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda B. is from the village of Kibatang, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 60 years old. Ermelinda is single and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Ermelinda owns & operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Ermelinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ermelinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ermelinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & thread. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ermelinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & thread

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de cinq femmes mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogames, avec en moyenne 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent dans le village de Cinzana Gare, chef lieu d’une commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’igname, de poissons fumés, de sésame et de pagnes wax. 
Dans le besoin d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Binta  Traoré qui est un des membres du groupe, ayant une très grande renommée dans le ravitaillement de la population de Cinzana Gare en igname, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 7 sacs d’igname à Koutiala auprès des producteurs. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit, parfois à domicile et au marché de Cinzana Gare à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Binta  Traoré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. 
Elle a pour objectif d’entretenir ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de devenir grossiste dans cette activité.
texts.en:
Benkadi Group ("Harmony") is composed of five married women. Most of them live in monogamous households. On average, they are 34 years old and have two children. They live in the village of Cinzana Gare, the county town of a rural municipality in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other through ties of neighborhood and kinship.

The group members trade with yams, smoked fish, sesame and wax pagnes (colorful African cloth). Faced with the need to increase their working capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first solidarity loan.

Mrs Binta Traoré, one of the group members, has an outstanding record of providing yams to the population of Cinzana Gare. She intends to use her loan to buy 7 sacks of yams from producers in Koutiala. She retails the yams from her home or at the market in Cinzana Gare, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.

Mrs Binta Traoré expects to make a monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs which she will reinvest in her business. Her goal is to stay in her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso and thus become a wholesaler in her sector.

loans.use: To buy yams

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana Rosa G. V. tiene 23 años, vive en Unión Libre con su esposo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. DIVINO NIÑO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Ana Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz cacao y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa

Le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa G. V. is 23 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage with her partner in Ventanas, a canton of the Los Ríos province, and she has 2 children.

The V.R.C. Divino Niño (Divine Child Communal Bank) is located in the Estero Lindo precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; it is composed of 12 members who engage in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Ana Rosa engages in agriculture, growing maize, cocoa and rice. She buys her products in the Farma-Agro and sells them in the same place.
The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize and rice by buying supplies and seeds. The loan will help her economically, as thanks to it she will fulfill her needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of owning a house.

She likes watching television.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Raul Alberto

texts.es: Raúl es un hombre que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. El tiene 35 años y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de suplementos alimenticios y dietéticos, el comenzó estos productos los consigue por encargo en Managua donde él los obtiene a un precio accesible para ofrecerlos a sus clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de estos productos, ya que se acerca la temporada de verano. El sueña con hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Raúl is a man with a lot of desire to get ahead. He is 35 years old and has 2 children under his care. His economic activity is the sale of nutritional and dietary suppliments. He gets his products on order in Managua for a reasonable price to offer them to his customers. The motivation for this financing is for the purchase of these products as the summer is approaching. He dreams of making his business grow.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kancerere  Tutungukye Group, Kihihi

texts.en: Owen T. leads the Kancerere Tutungukye Loan Group--Kihihi. He is 24 years old, married and has for the last five years made a living running a retail shop in Omukengoma's trading centre. He works with his wife, and as a team they earn about 100,000 UGX a week in profit. Owen also runs a side business buying and selling coffee, and earned enough money here to open the retail shop where he now sells sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap and and other items. His goal is to expand his retail business and buy land he can use to begin farming.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell from a store

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa empezó a raíz de la separación de su esposo quien se fue de viaje al exterior pese a que le envía dinero mensualmente. Ella opto por poner un negocio y generar su propio ingreso con lo cual gracias  a los créditos hechos en D-miro ha ido creciendo. 

Unas de sus dificultades es la ubicación del negocio ya que ha tenido que dejar solos a sus hijas por lo que incluso ha puesto un negocio pequeño en casa para entretenerlas. Está separada hace años tiene 3 hijos de 24, 17, 12 
Con el préstamo va a comprar productos, papeleria, articulos de bazar. Unas de sus metas si Dios lo permite seguir con la familia unida y crecer con el negocio y trasladarlo a casa para poder tener más tiempo con sus hijas.
texts.en:
Rosa openend her business as a result of her separation from her husband.  He left on a trip abroad, although he does send her money each month.  She has chosen to open a business to generate her own income.  Thanks to the loans granted by D-miro, her business has been growing. 

One of Rosa's difficulties is the location of her business; she has to leave her daughters home alone.  Because of that situation, she has even set up a small business in her home for their amusement.  Rosa has been separated for years.  Her three children are 24, 17 and 12 years old. 
With this loan, she is going to purchase products, stationary and  gift shop items.  Some of her goals, god willing, are to keep her family united, to grow her business and to transfer her business to her home so that she can have more time with her daughters.

loans.use: Stationary and other gift shop items

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
el señor Felipe de Jesus C. tiene 34 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Mayra Funez y tienen tres hijos, viven en la aldea El Rebalce Pespire, Felipe tiene un taller en donde repara llantas de vehiculos
pesados, livianos y motocicletas, tambien vende lubricantes, llantas usadas, hace cambios de aceite y vende gasolina en pocas cantidades,  su negocio esta creciendo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de de llantas, neumaticos, aceite para motor, parchos, pegamento, lija, limas, gasolina. 
nos comento que esta muy contento porque que necesitaba un carro y ya lo compro, en el hace trabajos a 
domicilio de su taller y asi obtiene mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Felipe de Jesus C. is 34 years old and is married to Mayra Funez. They have three children and live in the village of El Rebalse, Pespire. Felipe has an auto shop where he does tire repairs for heavy and light vehicles, as well as for motorcycles. He also sells lubricants, used tires, and small amounts of gasoline, and does oil changes. His business is growing.

He will use the loan for the purchase of rims, tires, motor oil, patches, glue, sandpaper, files, and gasoline.

He mentioned to us that he is very happy because he needed a car and he already bought it. He does at home jobs and works from his shop to earn more.

loans.use: to buy rims, tires, motor oil, patches, glue, sandpaper, files, and gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a griddle.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita K. is from the village of Bugang, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Pacita is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling beverages, canned goods, junk food, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Pacita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods & beverages. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pacita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & beverages

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Cissy has been selling charcoal for one year.  She also has a second business selling fruits and vegetables.  

To help expand her businesses, Cissy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal, fruits and vegetables for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Cissy hopes to generate greater profits and pay for her house rent and food.  In the future, Cissy hopes to expand her business. Cissy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEMBRADORAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lourdes. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio 

La señora Lourdes,  indica que hace siete meses que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de las vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio que consiste en la venta de quesos, que compra de la ciudad de Viacha, desde hace tres años atrás aprendiendo este negocio de su mamá, ella nos cuenta que este negocio lo inicio haciendo ventas ambulantemente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para invertir en su negocio (compra de quesos) los que venderá en las tiendas los días domingos por las tardes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "SEMBRADORAS" is beginning its first term in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Center.   The bank is comprised of 11 members whose board of directors is chaired by Mrs. Lourdes.  The members' business activities vary and include: commerce, production and service.

Mrs. Lourdes says she joined Pro Mujer seven months ago through an invitation from neighbors.  She is in the cheese business and buys her products in the city of Viacha.  For three years now she has been learning the trade from her mother.  She says they began the business by providing a door-to-door service.

The loan involved now is to buy cheese that will be sold in the store on Sunday afternoons.  This provides an income to help support the family.  She has a common-law husband and three children.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, she says it is the training regarding health and credit.

loans.use: To invest in her cheese business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has two children aged five and one. In 2003, Mohamed established his top-up cards for mobile phones business. He began his business because he wanted to increase his income, be self-employed, and get a permanent means of providing a livelihood to his family.

Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about 700,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,500,000 SLL. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy more mobile phones and top-up cards for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more recharge cards and mobile phones

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and one sibling. 

He has 10 years of experience working with mobile phones. He began his career working as an employee in a mobile shop then he opened his own store in 2005. Recently, he hired a full-time employee to assist him with the work. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new mobile phones and prepaid telephone cards. He is sure that both his business sales and income will be increased as a result of the loan. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase new mobile phones and prepaid telephone cards

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high of cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, and jerrycan of paraffin. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, and jerrican of paraffin.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has five children.

Hussein has had a car workshop since 2003 for repairing and dying (painting). He has much experience and a deep understanding of local consumers. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has 2 children. She has received a junior high school education. Sarah sells second-hand cloths in Abura, which she has done for 3 years. Her husband is a driver. 

Sarah uses her income to support her spouse in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosa Del Milagro

texts.es:
Rosa de 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Rosa se dedica desde hace 3 años a la elaboración y venta de pan, actividad que realiza todos los días en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela fija, es conocida en la zona donde vive por el buen producto que ofrece, con los ingresos que perciba podrá solventar sus gastos personales.

Para que su negocio siga creciendo ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles la compra de insumos para la preparación de pan al igual que utensilios, con la finalidad de que la venta de pan no disminuya y al generar ganancias podrá cubrir su crédito otorgado y permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.  Rosa con trabajo y dedicación desea salir adelante para poder más realizar estudios superiores y seguir ayudando a sus padres en los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Rosa, 22, is single and lives with her parents.  The home only has electricity and is located in Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura.  This area is known for its agriculture, livestock farming and artisan craft activity.  

For three years Rosa has been baking and selling bread for a living.  She works every day in her home and has a fixed customer base.  She is very well known in the area because of her good products.  She uses her income to cover personal expenses.  

In order for her business to continue growing she has requested a loan in the amount of 500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.  She will buy supplies for bread-making as well as utensils in order to keep bread sales up.  With the profits she makes she will be able to pay back the loan and improve her lifestyle.  With hard work and dedication Rosa wants to get ahead in order to get a higher education and help her parents cover household expenses.

loans.use: To buy supplies and utensils to make bread.

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en:
Helenita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Helenita is making and selling coconut charcoal. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy coconut shells to make charcoal. 

Helenita has been a member of HSPFI  since 2010. In the future, Helenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells for making charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy passion fruit seeds.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 31 years old with one child who is in school. She is married to a soldier. She has a business selling clothes in the Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Esther requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothes to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her child to go to school and to build a big shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jinny Mae

texts.en: Jinny Mae is a 20-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 2, and 3 months. Jinny Mae's husband owns a vulcanizing shop and car wash. Jinny helps in managing their business. She also runs a small sari-sari store business. She sells items like sugar, vinegar, shampoo and other various products. She requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods. She hopes for her store to grow bigger. She also hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El señor Rene es agricultor nacido en Valle grande, es casado tiene 7 hijos, tiene su parcela  a 20 km de Jorochito, en una comunidad llamada la Planchada, donde vive y trabaja junto  con sus hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura, siembra: maíz, yuca, maní, papa, y camote,  todo lo que el siembra lo comercializa en el mercado, pero también se dedica a la ganadería. El crédito que ha solicitado es para la compra de semillas para siembra de maní y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, es el primer crédito que esta solicitando  con la institución, por lo cual se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rene is a farmer who was born in Valle Grande.  He’s married and has 7 children.  He has his field 20 kilometers from Jorochito in a community called La Planchada where he lives with his children.  He’s a farmer.  He grows corn, manioc, peanuts, potatoes and sweet potatoes.  Everything he grows he sells at a market; he also raises livestock.

The loan he’s requesting is for his peanut crops.  This is the first loan he’s requested from the institution and he is very grateful for the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to grow corn

loans.name: Santos Elena

texts.es:
Santos Elena de 39 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su familia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Santos Elena desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cerdos, ovejas y gallinas), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de más alimento balanceado y sanidad de sus animales, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Santos Elena es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido salir adelante junto con esposo e hijos.
texts.en:
Santos Elena, 39, lives in her own house which lacks basic utilities with her family in the rural part of Tambogrande District which belongs to Piura Department.  This zone is noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts.

Santos Elena has been raising small farm animals (pigs, sheep and chickens) to sell.  Her corrals are in her back yard and they are appropriate and spacious.  She feeds her animals nutritionally balanced feed, grasses and natural grains so that they will reach optimum growth and be able to sell them in the various local markets obtaining good profits to meet family needs.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more nutritionally balanced feed and medicines for her animals.  She will use profits from the sale of her animals to repay the loan and to have a better quality of life.  Santos Elena is a person who has known how to get ahead with her husband and children thanks to much effort and dedication.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balance feed and medicine for her animals.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora  Gabriela   tiene  treinta años de edad  , se dedica a la venta de abarrotes  como son: chiles jalapeños, tomate,cebolla,ajo,pan,aceite,leche,café,azúcar,sal,detergentes,refrescos y sabritas.
Lleva con su negocio desde hace  dos años  gracias a la paciencia de su esposo y a fundación cada día va creciendo más ya que cuando ella está  ocupada  su esposo a tiende la tienda.
Tiene  la cantidad de  tres hijas  Mariana Sarai de catorce años de edad, Jennifer  de siete años de edad y Abril Daniela  de cinco años de edad.
Esta felizmente casada  con el señor  Daniel  de treinta y tres años de edad  quien la apoya en las decisiones que ella tome.
Uno de  sus sueños  es hacer su negocio más grande  donde también venda artículos de papelería  y perfumería.
Lo que más le gusta  de su negocio es  atender a sus clientes  para que  vuelvan a comprarle.
Pidió el préstamo para  comprar más mercancía de abarrotes como  son: aceite, refrescos, galletas, pan y dulces.
Les da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para  salir adelante y  darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 30 years old and works selling groceries like chiles, jalapenos, tomatoes, onions, garlic, bread, oil, milk, coffee, sugar, salt, detergents, drinks, and potato chips. She started her business 2 years ago. Thanks to her husband's patience and to the foundation, each day her business grows more since when she is busy her husband works at the store.  

She has three daughters: Mariana Sarai who is 14 years old, Jennifer who is 7 years old, and Abril Daniela who is 5 years old. She is happily married to Daniel who is 33 years old and who supports her in the decisions she makes. One of her dreams is to have a bigger business where she can also sell perfume and paper products. What she likes most about her business is helping her repeat customers. 

She has asked for a loan to buy more grocery merchandise like oil, drinks, cookies, bread, and candy. She thanks the foundation for the support it has given her to make progress and give a better future to her children.

loans.use: to buy grocery merchandise like oil, drinks, cookies, bread, and candy.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a hardworking businessman.  He is 36 years old. He is married and blessed with two children, who are  in school. For over five years, he has been practicing dairy farming to make a living. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya because he has been able to access loans to boost his business. In the next 5 years, he plans to expand his business. Moses has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mawuwetin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAWUWETIN est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Nouratou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Nouratou est âgée de 33 ans.  Nouratou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Nouratou est mariée à un déclarant en douane du nom de Soulemane. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et  à leur charge. Nouratou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Nouratou vend depuis cinq ans, divers articles en plastiques dans un marché du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Nouratou vend des oignons. Nouratou s’approvisionne dans au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu,  Nouratou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAWUWETIN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The MAWUWETIN group is composed of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the group’s first time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. The representative of the group is Nouratou, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Nouratou is 33 years old. She never attended school. She is married to a customs officer named Soulemane, and they have two dependent children who both go to school. Nouratou lives with her husband and children, and the couple provide together for the family’s needs. 

In order to help with the various household expenses, Nouratou started selling plastic ware in a market of Benin five years ago. She also sells onions as a secondary activity. She buys her stock in Togo. 

Eager to meet her customers’ needs and to increase her sales and revenue, Nouratou is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the MAWUWETIN group.

loans.use: to buy onions and plastic items for resale

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Marilyn has a business selling viands. She earns about 1,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Marilyn has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more ingredients for her viand vending business.

Marilyn has joined PMPC this year 2011. In the future, Marilyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her viands

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Gladys Janneth

texts.es:
Gladys Janneth tiene 22 años de edad es casada tiene 1 hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 1 año de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.

Gladys se dedica a la agricultura. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para tener un terreno propio. Con la ayuda del préstamo mejorará la estabilidad económica de la familia.
El sueño es tener un  nuevo negocio. Los desafíos a los que ha diario se enfrenta es la sequedad o el invierno.
En los tiempos libres le gusta las festividades del día de la madre, año nuevo.
 
Con la ayuda del credito anterior pudço comprar los insumos, semillas, los ingresos han mejorado la relación familiar ha mejorado, la producción ha sido mejor u se pudo cultivar buen producto.
texts.en:
Gladys Janneth is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She lives with her husband and her one-year-old son in Guaranda, in Bolívar Province.

She is a member of the Communal Bank Ventanal which is located in the community of Guantuncoto, Julio Moreno Parish, canton of Guaranda, thirty minutes from the office. The community's inhabitants engage in a variety of activities including crop and livestock farming, animal husbandry (pigs, chickens, sheep), commerce and construction. 

Gladys devotes herself to farming. She makes her purchases and sales in Guaranda. She is seeking the loan in order to have her own plot of land. With the help of the loan her family's economic stability will improve. 

Her dream is to have a new business. The daily challenges she faces are drought or winter. In her free time she enjoys the holidays including Mother's Day and New Year's. 

With the help of the previous loan she was able to purchase supplies and seeds. Her income has improved, family relations have improved, production has gone up and she was was able to produce a good crop.

loans.use: to have her own own plot of land and improve her family's economic stability.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 64 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin. She is married and has five children.
 
Rosalita has a general store that sells a variety of goods. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Rosalita requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional goods such as noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Rosalita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Rosalita hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods such as noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Marie-Léonie Fifamey

texts.fr: Agée de 44ans , Marie-léonie est responsable du groupe de deux personnes. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants et s'est spécialisée dans la vente de légumes, condiments et divers à son domicile. Dans le but de renforcer ses activités, elle a sollicité Finadev pour le renouvellement de son micro crédit afin de pouvoir répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle,accroître son bénéfice ,et participer au mieux être de sa famille.
texts.en: Forty-four-year-old Marie-léonie is the head of a two-person group. She is a married mother of four and sells vegetables, seasonings, and miscellaneous items at her home. In the goal of expanding her business, she is seeking a micro-loan renewal from Finadev in order to be able to respond to the needs of her clientele, increase her profits, and contribute to the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy 3 baskets of tomatoes, 2 baskets of spices, vegetables, and miscellaneous items.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora María Auxiliadora es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es enfermera, además  tiene un taller de serigrafía y vende ropa. Este negocio lo inicio hace 11 años y comercializa en su comunidad y la zona franca.
Ella está casada con don Francisco con el que tiene dos hijos por los cuales trabaja arduamente. Ella invertirá el crédito en ropa íntima, blusas y pantalones
texts.en: María Auxiliadora is a hardworking, enterprising woman who is a Nurse; she also has a silk screening shop and sells clothes.  She started this business eleven years ago and sells at home and in the free zone.  She’s married to Francisco and has two children with him that she works hard for.  She will invest the loan in underwear, blouses and pants.

loans.use: to buy underwear, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Héctor Samuel

texts.es: Héctor Samuel vive con su compañera de vida y sus cinco hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, a la venta de leche y adicional a esto trabaja de jornal sueldo que le ayuda a complementar los gastos del hogar, su principal fuente de ingreso es la agricultura y ya tiene varios años de dedicarse a este rubro, se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor y además obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia en todos las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un servicio inigualable; Héctor es un hombre dedicado a su labor muy honesto y humilde, siempre está buscando el camino de oportunidades que lo lleven a lograr sus sueños, uno de sus más grandes objetivos es aumentar la producción en su cosecha pero necesita de un apoyo de capital para la inversión de insumos por eso le solicita a  INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, herramienta, etc. Héctor Samuel es muy responsable y tiene excelentes referencias de pago, seguro que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, herramienta

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is married with 8 children. He has some elementary training in bicycle repair work. He has a bicycle repair shop in Jairos village established in 2000. Western Kenya is well known for its favorite bicycles known as Boda Boda. His first loan of US$ 91.50 from PEMCI enabled him to start stocking some fast moving spare parts needed for bicycle repair. This proved very successful and he was able to fully repay the loan timely. The second loan of US$ 275 will be used to buy spare parts for his shop in view of increased demand for his services. Bicycle transport plays a very major economic role of transporting people and goods in this part of the country. Driving through Western Kenya one is surprised by the large number of Boda Boda bicycles that decorate the country side. Patrick is playing a very important role of servicing this sector of our economy

loans.use: To Buy Bicycle Spare Parts

location.town: Jairos Amagoro Div, Teso District - Keny

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Mrs. Rose O. is a 45 year old woman who has four children and she has had this business for 6 months. She resides in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She requests a loan of $800 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks for sale

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.en:
I have been selling popular food items in my neighborhood for the past five years. My best customers are my neighbors. With the income from my business I'm able to afford medicine and help my wife with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo este pequeño negocio en donde vengo productos de consumo popular. hace 5 años que me dedico a la venta en colonia. Mis mejores clientes son mis vecinos. Con los ingresos que persibo de esta pulperia me ayuda para mis medicinas y tambien ayudo a mi esposa con otros gastos familiares.

loans.use: Purchase snacks, candy, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario started her business a couple years ago to contribute to the expenses of the household. She sells shoes via catalogue to her friends and neighbors. Maria chose this occupation because it allowed her to stay home and take care of her two kids while working. She has two sons, one on elementary school and the other on kindergarten. Her husband works as a driver for a private company. Thanks to her shoe business Maria and her husband were able to save for the down payment of their home. Maria's husband helps her with sales offering the catalog to his coworkers.
Maria del Rosario is asking for a loan of $550 She will use it to buy new merchandise and to cover outstanding orders. Maria and her family thank you for supporting their efforts to improve their lives.

Spanish

María del Rosario inició su negocio hace dos años atrás para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, ella empezó vendiendo zapatos por catálogo entre sus amistades y vecinos, y se dedicó a este tipo de ventas para no descuidar a sus pequeños hijos que son dos pequeños uno estudiando en la escuela primaria y el otro en el kinder, su esposo trabaja como chofer en una empresa, y parte de las ventas de su negocio lo utilizó para poder dar el enganche de su casa que actualmente la están pagando. Su esposo colabora con ella ofreciendo sus productos entre los compañeros de su empresa, ofreciéndoles crédito por la compra de los mismos.

María del Rosario está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 550 para comprar mercancías y poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y salir adelante mejorando su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
"I need to build another room. It has been very hard due to lack of money but I am working very hard to do it and to extend my house." I would like a loan of $900.00 to build another room.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“Necesito hacer otro cuarto, me ha sido un poco difícil por falta de dinero pero estoy trabajando mucho para lograrlo y ampliar más mi vivienda” Solicito $ 900.00 dlls para hacer otro cuarto.

loans.use: To build a room/Construccón de un cuarto

loans.name: Maryanah

texts.en: Maryanah is 45 years old and is married with two children ages 19 and five. She sells some foods such as noodles, fried snacks, etc., and usually earns $2.50 - $3.50 per day. Her husband Toni is in the Army and usually sends her $7 per week. Maryanah is a member of MBK and needs an IDR 500,000 loan to buy more goods and pay for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Sok, 41, and her husband, Sor Chanthorn, have been married since 1993. They have four children, two sons and two daughters. Sok has been selling Khmer traditional medicine since 2002. Her husband is a Khmer traditional medicine maker. He learned his skill from his master at Kou Len Mountain in Seam Reap Province. All of their children are studying in the local school.

Sok is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $400. She will use this loan to purchase a motorbike for use in her business selling Khmer traditional medicine.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for selling Khmer traditional medicine.

loans.name: Subhani's Group

texts.en: I am Subhani M.. I am a mother of five: two of whom attend school. I belong to a small town Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. Last year, I started a grocery shop with the loans we took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. Currently, I require another loan to buy stock for my store. The other women who need loans with me are: Shazia B. tends a loan to expand their beetle nut shop. Zahida B. needs loan to buy a cow. Sakina B. will also use the loan to buy a cow. Arshad B. requires this loan to expand their milk business. I help these women because I want to have these women an important place in their houses and help them bring incomes to their families.

loans.use: Buy stock for the grocery store

loans.name: Omika

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Omika M. is 51 years old, married and has four children. Her children are between the ages of 16 and 24. She has two other dependents, who were street children. In 2005, Omika established a retail shop business. Omika now requires a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase stock in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of vegetables to replenish a store.

loans.name: Cirila's Group

texts.es:
It has been ten years since Antonia and Cirila are members of the Muchuy Warakaq Communal Bank, which means “abundance” in Quechua. Antonia is married and is 60 years old, Antonia sells meat and cheese, she obtains the products at regional fairs. Besides this activity, Antonia raises cattle in her home town Rancha. Cirila is married, she is 45 years old and has 2 children. Cirila and her husband have a store to fix appliances and sale replacement parts, these products are acquired in the capital city of Lima. Antonia and Cirila need loans of 750 Soles, 1000 Soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of cattle, replacement parts for DVD players and television sets. The dreams of Antonia and Cirila are to roof their house, to have a successful business and see it prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonia y Cirila pertenecen al Banco Comunal Muchuy Warakaq que significa “Abundancia” en quechua hace 10 años.

Antonia es casada y tiene 60 años, Antonia venD. carne y queso D. manera ambulatoria, sus productos lo adquiere en las ferias D. la región. Además Antonia se dedica al engorD. ganado vacuno en su pueblo D. Rancha.

Mientras que Cirila es casada, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Cirila junto a su esposo tienen una tienda para arreglar artefactos y venta D. repuestos, cuyos productos son adquiridos en la ciudad D. Lima.

Antonia y Cirila necesitan préstamos D. 750 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado vacuno, repuestos para DVD y televisores.

Los sueños D. Antonia y Cirila son techar su casa, tener una empresa exitosa y que sus negocios prosperen.

loans.use: Antonia and Cirila need loans of 750 Soles, 1000 Soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of cattle, replacement parts for DVD players and television sets.

loans.name: Juri

texts.es:
Investment of First Loan:

Juri could buy all the necessary agricultural supplies to attend to the demands of her clients. That is to say she could buy everything in time, finishing her crop as expected and marketing all her product.

Development of Business:

The 1 hectare that she possesses has permitted her to have sufficient land to cultivate not only rice but also related products, as for example corn. Ten years of experience vouch for the quality and quantity of her products.

Personal information:

Juri is 24 years old. She is married. She has 1 small son that is too young to go to school. Her dwelling is of mixed construction; cane and wood. One of her aspirations is to give her son a better education and in that way to improve his quality of life.

Use of Second Loan:

With this new loan she will buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to take advantage of the winter season and to save irrigation. The advantage of her location is that it is in the high part of this coastal sector.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=11776

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Inversión de Primer Préstamo:

Juri pudo comprar todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para atender la demanda de sus clientes. Es decir que compro todo a tiempo, terminando su cosecha como el esperaba y comercializando todo su producto.

Desarrollo de Negocio:

Las 1 hectáreas que posee, le han permitido tener terreno suficiente para cultivar no solo arroz sino productos afines como por ejemplo el maíz. 10 años de experiencia avalan la calidad y cantidad de sus productos.

Información Personal :

Juri tiene 24 años. Es unida. Tiene 1 hijo pequeño que aun no estudia. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta caña y madera. Una de sus aspiraciones es darle mejor educación a su hijo y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida.

Uso de Segundo Préstamo:

Con este nuevo préstamo comprara abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, equipo menor, alquiler de maquinarias, contratación de mano de obra, y otros insumos necesarios para aprovechar la época invernal, y ahorrar el riego. La ventaja del sector es que esta en la parte alta de este sector costero.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=11776

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to cultivate a winter crop of rice and corn.

loans.name: Ni Komang Ayu Sumber

texts.id:
Ni Komang Ayu Sumber and her husband and their 3 children live in their own made simple house. For her 2nd term of loan from Dinari, Komang Ayu expanded her business by having 2 crossing piglets (produced from crossing of local and non local breed) and also 2 local piglets. She spent IDR 1 million (around USD 112) for those 4 piglets. Pig feeding cost her IDR 15 thousand per day (around USD 1.7/ day). She can earn a net profit of USD 112 per 3 month period. This money is used to help the family's economic.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Untuk pinjaman periode ke dua, Komang Ayu Sumber Astuti mengembangkan usaha ternak babinya dengan memelihara dua ekor babi untuk penggemukan jenis crossing dan dua ekor jenis babi lokal Bali. Dengan modal Rp.1.000.000.- sedang sebagian modal dipergunakan untuk persiapan membeli pakan ternaknya. Komang Ayu Sumber Astiti total memelihara 4 ekor babi. Biaya per hari yang diperlukan untuk pakan adalah Rp.15.000.- Pemeliharaan, pembersihan kandang dan pemberian pakan dilakukan dua kali dalam sehari. Dari hasil usaha ini Komang Ayu mendapatkan keuntungan Rp. 1.000.000.- dalam tiga bulan. Dengan keuntungan yang diperoleh tersebut, Komang Ayu bisa membantu suaminya, I Made Sugita, untuk menghidupi 3 anaknya yang masih sekolah. Mereka tinggal bersama dirumah yang mereka bangun sendiri, walaupun sangat sederhana.

loans.use: To buy pig feed (Membeli pakan ternak)

loans.name: Thi Xuan

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Xuan (ID number: 020022), is 37 years old. She wants to borrow 125 USD to breed pigs. She is very hard-working. Besides working on the rice field, Mrs. Xuan and her husband also does business on waste metals to increase the income. Her husband is also a hired-worker to make bricks. With the income of 6-7 USD/day, repaying gradually is very convenient for her. She has 4 children who are still going to school.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nghiêm Thị Xuân (MS: 020022), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn, phục vụ nông nghiệp. Chị rất chịu khó ngoài làm ruộng anh chị còn tranh thủ đi chợ sắt để có thu nhập hàng ngày. Còn chồng chị đi làm gạch ngói. Với thu nhập hàng ngày 100.000 VND cũng giúp anh chị tiết kiệm qua hình thức trả góp và phục vụ cho gia đình. Anh chị có 4 con hiên còn đang đi học.

loans.use: breed pigs

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio lives on Arturo Valle Street in the Villa Esperanza area of the city of El Alto [suburb of La Paz]. He lives with his two children, who are 19 and 14 years old. His wife lives and works in the country to take care of their cattle.

Antonio is a welder working with freight vehicles. He rents a workshop where he performs this work.

Antonio will use the loan to purchase materials in bulk to reduce his costs. This is his first loan from IMPRO, which performed an assessment qualifying her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Antonio vive en la calle Arturo Valle de la zona Villa Esperanza en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 19 y 14 años respectivamente, su esposa vive y trabaja en el área rural cuidando su ganado.

Trabaja como soldador de partes de vehículos pesados, tiene un taller en alquiler donde cumple esa función.

El crédito lo destinara para compra de insumos, al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos. Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of welding materials for his business

loans.name: Sulemana

texts.en: Sulemana A. is 61 years old. He is married with four kids who are currently in school. Sulemana is a dealer in bicycle parts who also provides repair services for his customers. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and gives to his customers at retail prices. Goaso, where he lives and works, is a farming community. Sulemana says the sale of bicycle and parts is very lucrative business since most of the farmers ride on bicycle to their farms. He is seeking a loan to procure bicycle parts to better serve his customers. He hopes the loan will enable him to expand his shop and support his children in school. He belongs to the community group called Ebenezer Trust Group. In this group, members agree to provide guarantees to each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To expand stock of bicycle parts

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty O., a 40-year-old trader, is a divorced mother of four children. The children are in school. She is a very resourceful mother. Gifty supports her children through the sale of used clothing and shoes. The market for used clothing in Ghana is significant, as brand-new clothes are very expensive. Therefore selling of used clothing has created opportunities for many Ghanaian women like Gifty. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing and shoes to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her to save more for her children's education and also to rent a store in which to trade. She is member of the group called "Nyame mma" Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Gifty does not sell on group meeting days and her photo was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy tiene 33 años, es soltera y vive con sus dos hijos, Wendi de 8 y Juan de 3. Es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, desde hace 15 años se ha venido  dedicando al negocio de la venta de ropa, y ahora con mucho más empeño, ya que tiene que mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos. Por las mañanas, empieza la venta a las 8, y atiende hasta las 6 o 7 de la noche, haciendo que el ambiente frígido haga que Lucy deba permanecer abrigada todo el tiempo, causándole cierta incomodidad, por otro lado su trabajo le causa gran satisfacción, ya que le gusta utilizar la persuasión y convencer a los clientes de llevar las prendas que les ofrece. Esta madre trabaja con mucho empeño para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos. Con el dinero del préstamo quiere comprar más ropa y más variada para complacer el gusto de sus clientes. Lucy se ve en el futuro con una enorme tienda de ropa de muy buenas marcas.
texts.en:
Lucy is 33 years of age, is single, and lives with her two children Wendi, an 8 year-old and Juan, a 3 year old. She is from the city of Juliaca. For 15 years she has been in the business of selling clothing and she works with much more determination now that she has to support her two small children. In the mornings she starts selling at 8 and works until 6 or 7 at night. The cold environment makes it so that Lucy must stay in her coat all of the time, causing her some discomfort. But, on the other hand, her work greatly satisfies her since she likes to use her powers of persuasion and to convince her clients to wear the clothing she offers them. This mother works with much effort to get her children ahead. With the money from the loan she wants to buy more clothing and more of a variety so that she can satisfy the desires of her clients. Lucy sees herself in the future with a large clothing shop selling very good labels.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine Ahiadzro is a 35-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and has three kids, two of whom attend school. She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku, and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and is served with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is served with hot peppers or soup. She says that prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditures. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood to prepare the meals. She would be grateful for such assistance. She is a member of the community group called The Ark Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken when she was visited.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood for food production.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Juan Alberto P. D. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es acompañado, Don Juan tiene 4 hijos sus edades son las siguientes una varón de 2 años que no estudia, una niña de 3 años que cursa recientemente primer nivel de preescolar, un varón de 5 años que cursa recientemente tercer grado de primaria y su ultimo hijo que tiene la edad de 12 años y cursa recientemente el quinto grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora como cajera de la empresa UNION FENOSA, sus propósitos son de mantener a su familia y darle el beneficio de darle un lugar donde vivir ya que con su negocio es que puede salir adelante, sus sueños son edificar su casa y darle las condiciones necesarias sus deseos son establecer un taller de bicicleta donde ofrezcan el mejor servicio de pintado y la mejor variedad  de accesorio de bicicleta y en un futuro desea ampliar el taller y aumentar su inventario y crecer con su taller.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de taller de bicicleta, la ubicación de su negocio es en el pueblo de malpaisillo, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de es de 10 años, Don Juan inicia este negocio después que termina sus estudios de técnico medio en administración decide buscar una fuente de ingresos  que le ayudara a mantener a su familia y decide instalar un negocio de taller de bicicletas y es así como obtiene este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo es para invertir mas en su negocio y para comprar los repuestos de bicicletas necesarios para que sus clientes obtengan lo que buscan en sus taller.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Alberto P. D. is 36 years old and lives with his partner. He has 4 children: a boy aged 2, a girl aged 3, in pre-school, another boy aged 5, in the first grade, and, the oldest boy, aged 12, in the fifth grade. His partner works as a cashier at the UNION FENOSA. His goals are to support his family, provide them with a home, improve his house, and establish his bicycle shop as offering the best paint jobs and the greatest variety of bicycle accessories. In the future he'd like to expand the shop to augment the inventory and thus grow the business. His business is selling bicycles - his shop is located in the town of Malpaisillo. He's had the shop for 10 years. Juan started this business after graduating with an administration certificate. He was looking for an income to provide for his family and decided to start this bicycle shop. This loan is for capital to invest in an array of parts so that his clients can find whatever they need in his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: In's Group

texts.en:
This loan group is made up of four members, all residents in Chong Kneas Commune, Siem Reap Province. Mrs. In S. has been selected as group leader by the members. She is 54 years old and since 1990 has earned a living by catcH. fish with her 55 year old husband Klok Doeun. In and around Tunle Sap Lake they use nets and traps to catch fish to sell at the market.  They currently earn an income of around US$3 per day. The couple has four children.  Two are single and the other two are married and live away from the family home.  One of their single children assists them in the fisH. business.  Their current living conditions are not good; the house is damaged and too small for them.  They are asking for a loan to buy wood to repair their old house.  

The group has three other members.
Rin H., age 36, sells fishes in the market and requests a loan to enlarge her business.
Roeurn S. is 33 years old and is also a fish catcher. She is applying for a loan to buy more building materials to finish her house.
Dorm S. has been catcH. fish for sale. She is 29 years old and is applying for a loan to purchase additional fisH. tools for her business. (S.'s husband is pictured, because she was not available to have her photo taken.)

loans.use: to buy wood to repair their old house

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: El señor Arturo R. es albañil independiente, profesión a la que se dedica desde hace 15 años, brindándoles a sus clientes la calidad en su trabajo, su esposa la señora Erika labora como empleada domestica de una residencia, personas cercanas a ellos como son sus familiares, amistades y jefes inmediatos especifican que son personas muy responsables y de mucha confianza, el señor Arturo R. esta solicitando este crédito para la construcción de un segundo cuarto de baño ya que su familia ha ido creciendo y requieren de mas espacio.
texts.en:
Mr. Arturo R. is an independent construction worker, and for 15 years he has given quality work to his clients. His wife, Erika, works as a housekeeper. People close to them, such as their family members, friends and immediate supervisors, specify that they are responsible and trustworthy people. Mr. Arturo R. is requesting a loan for the construction of a second bathroom because his family is growing and needs more space.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bathroom construction

loans.name: Rosa Trinidad,

texts.es:
DesD. hace diez años Rosa venD. gaseosas y todo tipo D. golosinas al por menor en el centro D. L. capital.  No cuenta con un puesto propio es por eso que su mercadería L. ubica en una canasta granD. y se pasea por las calles vendiendo como ambulante. Eventualmente, también obtiene un ingreso extra con L. venta D. cosméticos a sus amigos y familiares.
Empezó con su negocio D. ambulante a raíz D. que su hermana anteriormente tenia el mismo trabajo y generaba ingresos considerables D. dinero. 
Ya que tenia cuatro hijos a quienes mantener y no era suficiente con el aporte económico D. su esposo, quien trabaja como electricista independiente, Rosa se animó a seguir los pasos D. su hermana. Más adelante le gustaría abrir una tienda en su casa y  no tener que ir vendiendo por las calles, pues es un trabajo muy pesado y que requiere D. mucho esfuerzo físico.
texts.en:
10 years ago Rosa started selling sodas and all types of snacks in the capital’s centre. She doesn’t have her own location, that’s why she puts her merchandise in a big basket and walks with it around the streets selling her products. Eventually, she also obtains extra income with the sale of cosmetics to her friends and family. She started the food business because her sister also did the same type of work and maD. a considerable amount of money. She had four children to support and it wasn’t enough with the income from her husband, who works as an independent electrician, Rosa decided to follow the steps of her sister. Later on she would like to open a store from her house and not have to sell around the streets, because it’s hard work that requires a lot of physical effort.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Caracato Group

texts.es:
El grupo Caracato estuvo integrado por tres personas, todas se encontraban en la zona de Alto Obrajes y por la misma calle, la Sra. Victoria con su tienda, la Sra. Valentina con la preparación de comida y la Sra. Julia con la venta de mantas, asi trabajaron hasta la secuencia tercera, luego la Sra. Julia se retiro voluntariamente, quedando el grupo solo de dos personas, que hasta la fecha llegan a su novena secuencia.
La Sra. Victoria B. tiene dos hijas y una nieta, ella quedo viuda hace dos años, sus hijas le colaboran con los gastos del hogar, ya que ambas trabajan y estudian, además de la atención de la tienda, ella reparte masitas a los colegios y también salteñas que elabora, por lo que necesita más capital especialmente en esta época de clases, ya que su mercado son los establecimientos educativos de la zona.
En cuanto a la Sra. Valentina, ella trabaja como empleada del hogar en una casa de Obrajes desde hace 25 años, pero desde hace cinco ella radica allí y su actividad económica realiza fines de semana con la preparación de comidas buffet y otros pedidos que tiene por la zona, tiene dos hijos, que estudian en la Universidad, ella corre con todos los gastos de estudio, en cuanto a la alimentación y vivienda tiene costo mínimo por que la familia donde trabaja los consideran como parte de ella.
 Ambas señoras son muy amigas y trabajan bien con el crédito demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The Caracato group was made up of three people. All of them live in the Alto Obrajes area. Señora Victoria has a store, Señora Valentina prepares meals, and Señora Julia recently left the group, leaving it with two people. They are on their ninth loan. Señora Victoria B. has two daughters and a granddaughter. She was widowed two years ago, and her daughters help her with the home's expenses since both of them work and study. Besides attending to her store, she delivers pastries to high schools along with salteñas (a dish like empanadas) that she makes herself. She needs more capital, especially since it's the school year, since her market is near the educational institutions in the area.

Señora Valentina has worked as a domestic employee in a house in Obrajes for 25 years, but five years ago, she settled on her job of making meals on the weekends and other orders that she has from the area. She has two children who study in the university. She pays for all of their educational expenses. In terms of food and housing costs, they are minimal for her because the family she works for considers them part of their family. Both ladies are very friendly and work well with credit, demonstrating responsibility and punctuality with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital and purchase groceries

loans.name: Ngu

texts.en:
Married with five children, T. supports his family by manufacturing cooking pots as well as selling chickens and rabbits in Bamenda. He is planning on using this loan to purchase twenty chickens, animal feed and medication, four rabbits, and oxygen and firewood for welding.

Since July of 2007, T. has been a member of GHAPE, and he recently completed the repayments on his first loan. He is confident that his businesses will continue to do well because he has a lot of experience, his products are in high demand, and he enjoys his work!

By increasing the productivity of his work, T. is helping the ecosystem of small businesses in the community. In addition to selling his intended products to customers, he buys feed from entrepreneurs and then sells the manure from his chickens to farmers for their crops.

On a personal note, T. has faced some of life's difficulties: poverty, lack of education, and the death of his father and first son, but because of this loan and the support of others, he has been able to confront such problems. In fact, he plans to use the profits from the loan to pay for his children's school fees and medical services, buy additional food, clothe his family, and and continue to save money!

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: procuring  chickens, rabbits, chicken feed, oxygen, firewood

loans.name: Turabek

texts.en:
M. Turabek, 44 and married with three children, sells confections such as candies, cookies, pastries, and fruit jelly. In business for three years, Turabek sells the goods from the market in Dushanbe, and the generated income allows him to support his family, for whom he is the sole income earner. Today, he is requesting $800 for the term of 12 months to enlarge the range of goods he carries. Turabek thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan in time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To enlarge the range of goods carried.

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en:
Waheed is 48 years old and married with four children. He sells engine oil and grease retail to his customers.

He is requesting a loan for N40,000 to purchase more engine oil and grease to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil and grease to sell.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en: Generosa R. is from the village of San carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 58 years old, widowed and has eight adult children. Generosa owns and operates a food stall, primarily selling products such as salt, canned goods and vinegar in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Generosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Generosa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Adjimo

texts.fr: Adjimo W. est une femme de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle vend divers articles sous un hangar à Lomé. Adjimo souhaite avec ce crédit louer un magasin et y tenir le commerce d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Adjimo W. is 32-year-old woman, married, and the mother of two. She sells various goods in a covered stall in Lomé. She wishes to use this loan to lease a shop and to run a general store in it.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease a store and to stock it

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la casa de sus familiares. Desde hace más de 5 años tiene una tienda de comestibles que instaló en casa, brinda atención todos los días, generalmente por las mañanas, ya que por las tardes son sus hijos quienes atienden a los clientes. En su tienda se pude encontrar casi todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y a Miriam le gusta su negocio porque disfruta de relacionarse con sus clientes y atenderlos amablemente. Esa actitud es la que ocasiona que sus vecinos acudan con mayor frecuencia a consumir de sus productos.
