Y debido a la rentabilidad de su tienda ha decidido ampliar su gama de productos, ofreciendo otros artículos como útiles de escritorio, de bazar, etc. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una persona perseverante y colaboradora en su  banco comunal, ya que es una de las fundadoras y por lo que renueva su compromiso de seguir adelante en el desarrollo de su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en abarrotes.
texts.en:
Miriam is 29 years old and lives with her husband and children in their relatives' house. For more than five years she has had a grocery store installed in her home which requires her daily attention, generally in the morning because her children serve the customers in the afternoon.

In her store you can find most of the essentials. She likes this business because she enjoys the relationships with her customers and treats them with kindness. This attitude is what makes her neighbors buy from her more frequently. Because of the profitability of her business she has decided to expand her merchandise, offering other useful things like office supplies and other various items. This is the sixth time she has taken out a loan with MFP. She is a persistent and collaborative person; she is one of the founders of her village bank. She is dedicated to the pursuit of the development of her group.

The money will go to the purchase of a larger quantity of grocery items.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Khadidiatou Foulo

texts.fr: Khadidiatou Foulo D. est une mariée de 33 ans, mère d’un enfant. Elle voudrait renforcer son activité de vente de rafraîchissant en cette période de forte chaleur. Son objectif est d’assurer de meilleures conditions de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Khadidiatou Foulo D., age 33, is married and the mother of one child. Her business consists in selling refreshments, and she would like to strengthen it at this time since it is very hot. Her goal is to ensure a better standard of living for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell ice cream and other food products

loans.name: Damdinsuren

texts.en: Damdinsuren T. is a 40-year-old businessman who lives with his wife and two children on the plot of land that he owns in province of Arkhangai . His family lives in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian housing tent or "yurt." In the early 1990's, he started his shoe repair business with the help of his wife and only 20,000 MNT of startup capital. The business has been successful. Now his working capital has increased to 700,000. Because the business is being run in rented space, his goal is to have his own workplace.  He is working hard to help his daughter to get a good education. Damdinsuren is requesting a loan to purchase shoe repair material for his business.

loans.use: To purchase shoe repair material for his business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is a woman who believes that there is always a way to overcome poverty. She is 54 years old and a resident of the town of Tanay in the Rizal Province of the Philippines.  She is happily married to Francisco who is 46 years old and a construction worker. She is the mother of four sons.

She has been reselling vegetables and fruits for 27 years. She has been a busy woman since before her membership in ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, which she joined in 2008 to access rolling capital. Her previous loan was invested in the business. The business runs smoothly and it is the means by which she can pay the school fees for her children. She would like to invest more in this business.

Erlinda is proposing an amount of 10,000 pesos for her 2nd loan to use as additional capital for her business.  It will be used to pay for assorted stocks of vegetables and fruits and also for transportation expenses.  She hopes that as her business grows, she can earn more and save for the future of her children. Also, she dreams of having a service truck someday for the easy transportation of her goods.

loans.use: To purchase assorted stocks of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Rubi" están representadas por Lesly Miriam y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades algunas venden ropa, otras son promotoras D. cosméticos, otras costuran prendas D. vestir y confeccionan trajes. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda, pero las socias saben como salir adelante para obtener mejores ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para invertir en la compra D. telas al por mayor, mercadería acorD. a la época e insumos para elaborar mas y mejores productos. A pesar D. ser su primer ciclo algunas D. las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que saben administrar adecuadamente los fondos que se les otorga y conocen a cabalidad la responsabilidad que se requiere para seguir creciendo con el apoyo D. la Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The members of the Rubi Community Bank are represented by Lesly Miriam and make up a group of 12 members who are dedicated to different professional endeavors. Some sell clothing, others sell cosmetics, others sew clothing and costumes. As in any commercial business, there always exists competition and the demand, but these members know how to succeed to be able to obtain more income to be able to give their families a better quality of life. This loan is for product diversification and for investment in the purchase of wholesale materials according to the time and input to be able to make more and higher quality products. Because of their first cycle, some of the members now have experience in groups for which they know how to adequately administrate the resources that they are awarded and know the full responsibility that is required to continue to grow with the support of the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Guillermina D. and her friends have formed a comittee in their community. The committee of Kuña Pyapy Mbarete is in the fourth cycle of their 17th member, and is a very important Group in the neighborhood to be single and responsible for themselves. They own a savings account of 2,759,322 guaranís. 
The women withdrew a loan of 300,000 to 1,100,000 guaranís to buy merchandise for retail, such as clothes, fruits, drinks, etc. 
Each woman is using the loan to purchase different things. Guillermina D. is using her loan to buy and sell tapioca. Florencia E. is using her loan for domestic goods. Amanda G. is using her loan to buy and sell clothes. Norma Brande is using her loan to buy and sell personal clothes. Inocencia S. is using her loan to buy and sell fruits and vegetables. Dora A. is using her loan to buy teaching supplies. Rosa L. is using her loan to buy and sell grocery items. Alba G. is using her loan for a cafeteria. Epifanía F. is using her loan to buy and sell drinks. Ramona D. is using her loan to buy and sell clothes. Alicia

loans.use: food, clothes, drinks, cleaning products

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Kim Pao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
There are nine members of this village bank. They live in the village of Prey Mul in the province of Takeo. The members have selected Mrs. Sok Kim P. to be the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn her living.

Her husband, Mr. Sreng Seing, is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, and for this reason his wife has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food for her husband's breeding business.

Mrs. Sok Kim P. is 29 years old and is the mother of three children. The eldest attends the local school and the two youngest are as yet too young to work or study.

loans.use: Tto buy more piglets and pig food for her husband's breeding business

loans.name: Mrs. Sokunthea San Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people who live in Koh Kaev Kraom village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan and they will use the loan which they obtain for different purposes. Mrs. Sokunthea S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Sokunthea S. owns a small grocery in the village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries for her business.

Mrs. Sokunthea S.’s husband, Mr. Huon Heat, helps his wife with the current business. Mrs. Sokunthea S. has two children who are both attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her business

loans.name: 10 De Noviembre Ii Group

texts.es:
Salomé P. por primera vez ingresa al grupo 10 de Noviembre a invitación de su tía. Ella vende abarrotes (alimento seco como arroz, fideo, harina, lenteja y otros) inició este negocio ayudando a su madre y ahora se hace cargo del mismo porque su madre falleció, Salomé necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, ella adquiere su mercadería de Santa Cruz y vende en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana con la ayuda de su hermano.
Las demás integrantes del grupo cuentas con diferentes negocios como la costura de ropa, tejido de prendas de vestir, producción de chocolates, elaboración de pan, venta de huevo, aceite condimentos y zapatos. Estas señoras necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
Salomé P. first joined the group "10 de Noviembre" (10th of November) after being invited by her aunt. She sells groceries (dry food like rice, noodles, flour, lentils, and other items). She started out helping her mother with this business and now she is solely in charge because her mother passed away. Salomé needs the loan to buy rice. She purchases her merchandise from Santa Cruz and sells it in different fairs in the city of El Alto everyday from 7 in the morning with the help of her brother. The rest of the members of the group work in different trades like sewing, weaving, the production of chocolates, bread making, selling eggs, oil condiments and shoes. These women need the loan in order to purchase merchandise and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle M. is from the village of Estrella, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is 24 years old. Michelle is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Michelle owns & operates a business venture in the services sector, doing transportation. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community. Michelle earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Michelle joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase some hog feed for her hogs. This will be the first loan taken out by Michelle from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase some hog feed for her hogs

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria A. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Candelaria owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas. She and her husband also have a small farm from which they take some vegetables to sell. Candelaria has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Candelaria joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gulara

texts.en: Gulara A. was born in 1957. She is married and has 3 children. Agayev's family live in the Khachmaz region. She has been in this business for 4 years. She is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy shoes to resell.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Yudith

texts.es:
Yudith, de 22 años, es una muchacha muy trabajadora y persistente, vive en una habitación alquilada y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.
Aunque todavía es muy joven sabe lo que es trabajar durante todo el día para tener el dinero necesario para pagar sus estudios. Ella es dueña de una tienda de licores muy conocida, ya que es una de las principales del distrito donde vive, pero también ofrece bebidas gaseosas y algunas golosinas. Su carisma y la alegría que posee han hecho que sus clientes la prefieran, es por eso que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes. 
Lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que despertarse a altas horas de la noche cuando algún cliente le toca la puerta, ya que la demanda de sus productos es muy buena. 
Para más adelante, espera tener el dinero necesario para implementar una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Yudith con MFP, en sus anteriores créditos no ha tenido problemas de pago. Ella es la socia más alegre de su banco comunal y eso les transmite a todas sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más licores para implementar mejor el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
Yudith, 22, is a hard-working, persistent young woman. She lives in a rented room and what she desires most is to get ahead in life. Although she is still very young, she knows what it is to work all day to have enough money available to pay for her schooling. She owns a very well-known liquor store that is one of the main ones in the district where she lives. She also stocks soft-drinks and some sweets. Her cheerfulness and charisma make her a favorite among customers and what she likes best about her work is taking care of her customers. She has been in this line of work for 3 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be having to get up at all hours of the night to take care of a customer who comes knocking at her door since demand for her products is very good. For later on, she hopes to have enough money to set up a grocery store so that her earnings will improve. This is Yudith's 4th loan with MFP and she has had no repayment problems with her previous loans. She is the most cheerful member of her communal bank and she transmits her good mood to her fellow members. The 1000 new soles requested will be used to buy more liquor to improve her store's stock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy liquor to stock her store.

loans.name: Firmine

texts.fr: S. Firmine est née en 1977 à Agonlin au Bénin. Mariée à HOUNYOVI Justin, un imprimeur, Firmine est mère de deux enfants. Aucun des enfants n’est scolarisé. Il y a environs 10 ans que Firmine s’est installée au quartier Djidjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle y vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Firmine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour se prendre en charge et venir en aide à son mari, Firmine vend divers produits (bombons, biscuits, sardine, lait, savons, pâtes alimentaires, papiers hygiéniques, etc.)à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Firmine s’approvisionne. Firmine a déjà trois ans d’expérience dans l’exercice de son activité et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Firmine voudrait améliorer son niveau d’activité afin de mieux répondre à ses clients et de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Pour y arriver, Firmine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
S. Firmine was born in 1977 in Agonlin in Benin. Married to HOUNYOVI Justin, a printer, Firmine is the mother of two children. Neither of the children is in school. About ten years ago Firmine settled in the Djidjè neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin, where she lives with her children and husband. The couple pays the family's expenses together. Firmine did not go to school. To support herself and help her husband, Firmine sells diverse products (candy, cookies, sardines, milk, soap, pasta, toilet paper, etc.) from her home. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. Firmine has three years' experience in this business and has already received three loans from ALIDé, loans which she has fully repaid. Firmine would like to improve her business standards in order to better respond to her customers and satisfy her family's needs. In order to do that, Firmine is seeking a fourth loan through ALIDé.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products (candy, cookies, sardines, milk, soap, pasta, toilet paper, etc.)

loans.name: Fátima Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Fátima Auxiliadora H. P. es comerciante del barrio Santa Ana, tiene un cafetin que lo administra en una escuela, en el cual ella lo atiende desde las seis de la mañana hasta las doce del día y por las tardes ella realiza compras para el negocio.
Ella solicito financiamiento para surtir su negocio, antes de tener este negocio ella vendía repostería ambulante ya tiene ocho años de ser comerciante por si sola, porque antes ella trabajaba para una panadería y decidio empezar a vender ella sola, tiene cuatro hijos es madre soltera, ella se esfuerza mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios tiene cinco años de ser cliente de nuestra institución y me dijo que con estos créditos ella ha salido adelante con su negocio y su casa la ha acondicionado un poco.
texts.en:
Fátima Auxiliadora H. P. is a merchant in Santa Ana neighborhood; she has a small snack bar in a school. She's open for business from 6am until noon; she spends the afternoons shopping for her business. She asked for funding to stock her snack bar. Prior to having this business, she sold pastries door-to-door. She has been an independent merchant for 8 years because she used to be employed by a bakery and she decided to sell on her own. She's a single mother of four children. She makes the effort to get her children ahead with their schooling. She has been a client of our institution for 5 years and she told me that these loans have made it possible for her business to get ahead and they have made it possible for her to make some home improvements too.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her snack bar:  sweets, cookies, juices, soft-drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Groceries for resale

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es: La Sra. Maria es conviviente tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos viven con su anterior compromiso y dos de ellos con su actual compromiso. Ella cuenta con casa propia de material noble en el distrito de parcona. Ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa como recorredora, tambien tiene una moto taxi el cual lo alquila, su conyugue es vigilante. La  Sra. Maria tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener mas vehiculos.Con el dinero que solicita invertira en capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria lives is in a common law marriage and has four children. Two of them live with their father from a previous relationship and two of them live with her in her current relationship. She has her own home made of concrete in the district of Parcona. She sells clothes as as a street vendor. She also has a motorcycle taxi that she hires out. Her spouse is a security guard. Maria has a lot of dreams and goals. One of them is be able to have more vehicles. She will invest the money she is asking for in working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in working capital

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
el sr. Andres C. U. se dedica  a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia negocio en el cual vende abarrotería, mismo opera bajo el nombre de pulpería "Las Colinas " 
rubro que mas resalta en nuestra sociedad, el es casado tiene 1 hijo que depende de El.
Su negocio lo atiende personalmente y cuando sale a comprar granos basicos se lo atiende su esposa ya que juntos se apoyan mutuamente,  gracias a la buena administracion su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco todos los dias.
Su clientela se siente bien satisfecha y Andres se siente agradecido por el apoyo que varias personas le han dado, el crecimiento de su negocio a sido de gran provecho para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Andres C. U. sells popular consumer products. He has a grocery store, a common line of work in this society, which is named "Las Colinas." He is married and has one dependent child. He attends to his business personally, and when he leaves to buy staple grains his wife attends to the store, since they both support each other. Thanks to good management his business has grown gradually over time. His customers are very satisfied, and Andres feels grateful for the support that various people have given him. The growth of his business has been a great benefit for him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy butter, sugar, soap, toilet paper, coffee, soft drinks, pastas, sauces, chicken, eggs, soups, salt, crackers, corn and wheat flour, margarine, cooking oil, beans and tortillas

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Cette femme  a appris la coiffure, après son apprentissage, elle a ouvert en 2001 son salon de coiffure qu’elle a appelé « M COIFFURE », les produits qu’elle utilise pour faire son activité sont finis, elle souhaite s’approvisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de mèches, défrisants, shampoing, et divers.
Etant célibataire, c’est  avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle subvient à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Akouavi A. is a trained hairdresser. When she had finished her training in 2001, she opened a salon called "M COIFFURE" ("M Hairdressing Salon"). The inventory of products needed for her activity is exhausted and she wants to restock. This is why she came to WAGES and applied for a loan to buy hair extensions, hair straighteners, shampoo and similar items. Akouavi is single and she provides for her needs with the income from this activity.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, hair straighteners, shampoo and similar items

loans.name: Mr. Sophal Uy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 16 people who live in Preak Svay village in Kandal province. They will all use their loans for different purposes in order to improve their businesses in the future. Mr. Sophal U. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. 

Mr. Sophal U. is a father of five children – one is a seamstress in a garment factory, three attend the local public school, and the other is two years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Sarey But, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. Their field is ready for growing. So to improve production, Mr. Sophal U. is seeking a loan to bU. bamboo to grow vegetables. 

All the members are shown in the picture but one of them is partially obscured.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to grow vegetables

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn S. is 38 years old and lives in Thkov village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice. She is also cake seller who earns a small income to support her family. 

In order to increase her income to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Khorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. 

Mrs. Khorn S. is a widow with three children: one drives a car for a salary; one is a security guard; and the youngest child is a year old.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Astrid Aracelly

texts.es: Astrid Aracelly tiene 27 años, su actividad venta de cosméticos y ropa. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues siempre ha buscado como sacar a su familia adelante por lo que ha demostrado que su familia es lo más importante y lo apoyan con su actividad. Se encuentra muy alegre con esta oportunidad que le brindaron pues tiene 2 hijos que mantener y proporcionarle estudios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia como pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, polvos y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Astrid Aracelly is 27 years old, she sells cosmetics and clothing. She has been in this business for more than 4 years. She has continually searched for ways to help her family advance in life. Her family is most important to her and they support her business. She is very happy with this opportunity, it has allowed her 2 children to maintain their studies. The funding that she is seeking will go towards working capital. It will be used to buy supplies such as nail polish, lipstick, powder, and underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 38 años, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva cusqueña, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa. Desde hace varios años se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, es por ello que tiene una tienda, además el haber instalado este negocio fue de mucha ventaja ya que en su localidad nadie ofrece este servicio, hoy le rinde buenas rentas económicas. Generalmente de 6 a p de la mañana es cuando hay más concurrencia de gente, en donde sus hijos la ayudan en la atención de la clientela. Normalmente los productos que vende son de primera necesidad para el hogar, es por ello que se siente contenta y satisfecha por lo que viene realizando. Su punto de venta lo realiza en el primer piso de su propia casa, a un precio módico. Sus planes a futuro es vender al por mayor, ya que ello le generaría mayores ingresos económicos, con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual, además se siente satisfecho con su grupo banco comunal, ya que le otorga buenos beneficios económicos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería, para que pueda abastecer su tienda y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ruth is 38-years-old, divorced, and has two school-aged children. They live in Cusco's beautiful jungle, in the town of Quimbiri, where they have their own house. For several years she has sold essential products in her shop. Establishing this business was much to her advantage because in her town nobody offers this service. Today she has a good economic income. Generally from 6 to 9 in the morning is when her store is the busiest, and her children help her in attending to customers. Normally the products that she sells are essential household items--that's why she feels very pleased and satisfied by the way her business is going. Her store is in on the first floor of her own house, and she sells at a reasonable price. Her plan for the future is to sell wholesale because that would generate more income and improve her family's quality of life. This is her 5th loan with MFP, which is why she's committed to paying in a punctual manner. Furthermore, she feels satisfied with her community bank group because they offer her good economic benefits. With this loan she'll invest in the purchase of merchandise so that she can stock her store and satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Antonio Vicente

texts.es:
Antonio Vicente C. M. is 60 years old. He is married and has a 20 year old son. They live in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Antonio is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Antonio works in agriculture. He cultivates blackberries, corn, beans and peas. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year (after harvest)

Antonio is asking for this loan to purchase fertilizers to fight crop diseases. His dream is to enable his child to study. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest

He likes to work.
texts.en:
Antonio Vicente C. M. is 60 years old. He is married and has a 20 year old son. They live in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar. Antonio is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly. Antonio works in agriculture. He cultivates blackberries, corn, beans and peas. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year (after harvest) Antonio is asking for this loan to purchase fertilizers to fight crop diseases. His dream is to enable his child to study. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest He likes to work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Maryuri Mariuxi

texts.es:
Maryuri Mariuxi B. C., tiene 20 años.  Es soltera y vive con el hijo, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo, Josué.

Maryuri es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Maryuri se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maíz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Peña y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz, maíz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es comprar una casa y poner un negocio en Ventanas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas.

Le gusta escuchar la palabra de Dios.
texts.en:
Maryuri Mariuxi B. C. is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her son in Ventanas, which is in the Los Ríos province. She has one son, Josué. Maryuri is a member of the “Valle Alto” (High Valley) solidarity group, which is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, one and one-half hours from Ventanas. There are 23 members altogether, mainly farmers. This is the second loan they have taken out from Cooperativa San José. Maryuri is a farmer who grows rice, corn and beans. She makes her purchases each month in the city of Ventanas in Fertiza and at the Peña market, and she sells her products at the same place. She is asking for the loan to invest in buying seeds for rice, corn and beans. She thinks the loan is a chance for her to get ahead. Her dreams are to buy a house and set up a business in Ventanas. She faces challenges like pests. She likes to listen to the Word of God.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seeds for rice, corn and beans

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret K. is 59 years old and a widow. She has seven children, none of whom go to school. Margret is currently in the business of selling charcoal from home. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia D. is from the village of Owaon, Dapitan City. She is 51 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a reloading store. The main source of income for the business comes from providing reload services to local community members. Delia is just starting this business.
In 2006, Delia joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to pay her children's tuition fees. Delia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase house materials. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase house materials

loans.name: Nanjiddash

texts.en:
Mr Nanjiddash is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently they don’t own any land and are living on their relatives' land in a ger (traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). His son Bilguun, aged nine, attends a local school and daughter Enkhjin, aged one, stays at home. His wife Nyamerdene looks after the baby.

Mr Nanjiddash has been running a transportation business since 2005. In winter time he carries coal for coal dealers and in other seasons he transports goods between warehouses and markets. Sometimes he works as a delivery man. His normal working day starts at 8am and finishes at 9pm. He is a very hardworking and persistent man.

He is planning to buy a piece of land and to build a house on it. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase a plot of land. He has already made a contract with a salesman to buy the land and now he has to pay the money for the land, according to the terms of the contract.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Policarpio;  El socio tiene 48 años de edad;  él es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; El socio  trabaja vendiendo DVDs en el mercado, este socio compra al por mayor todos los CDs que están en cartelera y los lleva a revender a Urubamba, el socio saca una comisión extra por la venta de los mismos. El solicita el préstamo para comprar CDs al por mayor para la reventa.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Policarpio is a member of the communal bank “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; this bank is located in the Chicon district in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. 

Policarpio is 48-years-old; he lives with his common-law wife and they have 4 children. He works selling DVDs in the market. He buys all the latest CDs wholesale and retails them in Urubamba, taking an extra commission for his sales. He's requesting this loan to buy CDs wholesale and then retail them.

He's very grateful for the loan and he promises to make his payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of CDs to retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married man with two children. He is from Lebanon. He has owned his small vegetable store since 2000, and he has a previous experience of 20 years in this occupation. He sells all types of vegetables according to their availability during the season. He has obtained a first Kiva loan and today he is asking for a new loan of $1200 to increase his store’s inventory and to buy new stands to use to offer his products to the customers. He expects that his business will continue to grow in the coming year. 

It is very common in Lebanon to find small vegetables and fruit shops. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demand. The strong network of community relationships is an important component of life in Lebanon, especially in the smaller towns and villages.

loans.use: increase his store’s inventory and to buy new stands to use to offer his products to the customers

loans.name: Frecia Claribel

texts.es:
Frecia de 54 años, vende productos naturales. Vive con sus dos hijos  en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Su trabajo lo realiza recorriendo las calles y vendiendo sus productos por catalogo. Tiene una estrategia de dar a crédito los productos cuando no tienen sus clientes para cancelar al instante. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 16h00pm.Vende productos naturales Herbalife hechos con Noni, aloe, frutas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería como productos naturales hechos por frutas, noni, aloe para tener más variedad para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener un club de nutricionistas.
texts.en:
Frecia is 54 years old.  She sells natural products.  She lives with her two children in Primavera de Duran (peri-urban area with a deteriorating ecosystem on the outskirts of Guayaquil).

Her business is selling her catalog products door to door.  She has a strategy of providing credit when her customers don't have enough money to pay up front.  She works from 7.00am to 4.00pm.  She sells Herbalife natural products which are made with noni juice, aloe and fruit.

She will use her loan to buy more merchandise such as natural products made with fruits, noni extract and aloe so that she has more variety for her customers.  In the future she would like to own a nutritionists' club.

loans.use: To buy aloe and noni extract

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 63-year-old dairy farmer. He farms in Kiambu District, which is known for its good climate for farming. He has been farming for 20 years. In the future, John hopes to own several cows on his farm. Since he joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, he has improved his financial status. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a dairy cow and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and animal feed

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren B. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her middle son is university student and youngest daughter attends a local secondary school. 

Dolgorsuren operates a vegetable business in her town with help of her husband. They plant and grow vegetables and sell to customers through the local grocery market in their town. They have been engaged this business since 2004 and have built a stable operation. 

After several years of successful business activity, she used her earnings to pay tuition fees of her sons. Her oldest son has completed his university training and her younger son currently attends university. In the future, she hopes for continued success and wants to build a house and cellar in her yard. 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of vegetables from local growers at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of vegetables

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 36 years old, married and blessed with four children, who are all in school. He owns a lorry which he uses for transport. He has employed two people in his business. Since Richard joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business.  He dreams of buying more vehicles in the future. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy tires and insure his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy tires and insure his lorry

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena A. A., tiene 38 años, es soltera con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Maria Magdalena se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa para los hijos.

Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena A. A. is 38 years old, she is single and she lives with her children in Ventanas, a canton of the Los Ríos Province. She has 3 children.

The V.R.C. Valle Alto (Valle Alto Communal Bank) is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; this group engages in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Maria Magdalena engages in agriculture, growing maize and rice. She buys and sells the products in Ventanas and in the Comercial Peña, and she also sells them every day at her house or in the market.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize by buying supplies and seeds. The loan will help her economically, as thanks to it she will fulfill her needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of buying a house for her children.

She likes cooking.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda C. is a married woman who lives in Sandoval, Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a business venture: buying and selling rice grain.  Her husband Erico C., who is 42 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 1 to 12 years old. 

Emelda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emelda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use as additional capital for the rice field so that she could continue to save up for future improvement of her business and more savings. Emelda C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of a rice field

loans.name: Sadat

texts.en:
Sadat is an enterprising mother looking to make a better future for the well being of her two children. That is the basis of her motivation to work every day cultivating crops like wheat, onions and watermelon. She tends to her business with great care and dedication. Her husband and son help her with the business. They sell their products at the local market. 

Sadat is one of the better sellers, but what keeps her back is her limited product range. In order to sell more, she needs to grow more on her land. This is the reason why Sadat is asking for a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She expects that it will help her to increase her business, and above all it will give her the purchasing power to meet the needs of her family. Let's fund this self sacrificing mother's loan request and provide her a ray of hope.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Gustavo De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Gustavo, tiene 53 años de edad, reside en Usulután, vive con su esposa, no tienen hijos y la casa que habitan es propia, su negocio es una tienda, que existe hace 25 años, en el ofrece artículos de primera necesidad.
El solicita un préstamo porque debe abastecer el negocio y no cuenta con los recursos suficientes, su compra será en productos como aceite, arroz, frijoles, detergentes, jabón, este préstamo le ayudara muchísimo para solventar esta situación y mantener en mejores condiciones el negocio.
Su proyección es que a través de las ganancias del negocio, se pueda estabilizar su condición económica para vivir tranquilo con la compañía de su esposa.
texts.en:
Gustavo, age 53, lives with his wife in Usulután.  They do not have children, and they own the house they live in.  His business is a store, which he has had for 25 years.  He sells basic needs items.

He is requesting a loan because he needs to stock the business, and he does not have the resources to do so.  He will buy products like oil, rice, beans, detergent, and soap.  This loan with help him a great deal in order to resolve this situation and to keep his business in better condition.

His plan for the future is to use the income from the business to be able to stabilize his financial condition.  He will do this in order to live peacefully with his wife at his side.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice, beans, detergent, and soap to stock his business

loans.name: Vicenta Fermina

texts.en:
Vicenta is 20 years old and is not married. She has one child who is currently is school, and a partner who is currently working in the United States to help support the family. Vicenta works in clothing manufacturing and has been doing so for the past nine years. She started out in this business operating a sewing machine. 

Vicenta is requesting a loan to purchase more raw materials for her clothing making business. She hopes to one day run a large and successful operation. This loan is Vicenta´s third loan through ASDIR, and the past two loans were paid back in full.

loans.use: to purchase materials for apparel manufacturing business.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
El señor Anastasio tiene 49 años de edad que es dueño de una tienda de abarrotes. Él quiere un préstamo para comprar productos para su tienda como azúcar, frijoles, huevos, aceite, refrescos, jabón, alimentos enlatados, cloro, velas, y mucho más. Decidió abrir esta tienda de abarrotes hace aproximadamente 2 años por que no había ninguna tienda cerca de su comunidad. Ahora, todos sus vecinos se benefician de su tienda ya que no bajan hasta el pueblo por los insumos que ocupan y no tienen caminar grandes distancias. Además, Anastasio vende vacas, caballos y borregos. 
Él no tiene muchos animales para vender pero los ingresos adicionales ayudan a su familia. El esta casado con la señora Bernardina, también apoya a la familia ya que es costurera y ayuda al señor Anastasio en la tienda de abarrotes. Una de sus metas es vender productos de mercería como agujas, hilos, estambres y telas etc. Así mismo el espera ayudar a una de sus hijas a pagar la escuela de su nieto porque ella es madre soltera. Él está agradecido a Dios por su trabajo y su habilidad para proveer para su familia.
texts.en:
Anastacio is 49 years old and owns a grocery store.  He desires a loan to buy products for his store, including rice, beans, eggs, cooking oil, soft drinks, soap, canned goods, bleach, candles, and much more. He decided to open this grocery store approximately 2 years ago because there was no store near his community. Now, all the neighbors benefit from his store because they no longer have to go down to town for their supplies and don't have to walk long distances.

In addition, Anastacio sells cattle, horses and sheep. He doesn't have many animals to sell but the additional income helps his family. Anastacio is married to Bernardina who helps the family by doing seamstress work, and she also helps Anastasio in the grocery store.

One of his goals is to start selling sewing products such as needles, thread, woolen yarn, cloth, etc. Also, he hopes to help one of his daughters pay for his grandchild's schooling, because she is a single mother. He thanks God for his work and his ability to provide for his family.

loans.use: TO BUY INVENTORY FOR HIS GROCERY STORE

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa O. is from the village of Bolok-bolok, Mambajao, Camiguin Province.  She is 43 years old.  Jesusa is single.  To make a living, Jesusa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, candies and biscuits in the local community.  Jesusa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jesusa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesusa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI.  This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  Jesusa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional candies, junk foods and breads.  This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jesusa from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional candies, junk foods and breads

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 46 years old and a single mother of five children aged 14-27. She has no other dependents and her oldest son is a teacher. She lives in her own home with seven others in Karuguuza Uganda. For 20 years Grace has been operating a retail shop. With the proceeds she has been able to build a house and buy land. In the future she hopes her business will improve and grow into a wholesale operation. Grace intends to use the loan to buy sugar, salt and millet flour for sale.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, salt and millet flour for sale.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery  vive en el  barrio Bellavista del municipio D. Malambo y allí tiene un negocio D. fotografía donD. también ofrece servicios D. diseño gráfico. Durante dos años estudió en Bellas Artes la serigrafía  y trabajó durante dos años más en un almacén, luego en otra empresa y finalmente cuando deciD. ser independiente, aplicó el con el dinero D. su liquidación a la compra D. su dos primeras cámaras D. segunda mano  y con ella inició con su mercado más cercano: el D. su familia, amigos y  gradualmente ha logrado ampliar  su área D. acción hacia los municipios D. Soledad y hacia la ciudad D. Barranquilla.  DesD. hace tres años está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, por  recomendación D. su hermano,   cliente D. esta organización desD.  hace 10 años;  con sus créditos  ha logrado mejorar su infraestructura comprando cámaras digitales, material fotográficos y registros fotográficos D. mayor calidad. Su sueño es tener un local  dotado D. todo lo que requiere un estudio que genere impacto en sus clientes, por la tecnología y la belleza D. sus diseños. Con su credikiva comprará un kit D. luces look y un lente para la cámara con el cual mejorará aún más  la calidad D. sus fotografías.
texts.en: Rosmery lives in the community of Bellavista in the municipality of Malambo. She has a photography business there and she also provides graphic design services. She studied liberal arts in silkscreen printing and she worked two more years at a supply store and then at another store before she decided to become independent. She used her severance pay to purchase two second-hand cameras and with them she started with her nearest clientele: her parents and friends. Gradually she has managed to expand her territory, from the municipality of Soledad to the city of Barranquilla. For the past 3 years she has been involved with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and it was following a recommendation by her brother, a client enrolled with the organization for 10 years. With her loans she has managed to improve her infrastructure with the purchase of digital cameras, photographic materials, and better quality film. Her dream is to have a store equipped with all that a studio would need to leave a lasting impression on her clients, for the technology and for the beauty of her designs. Her Kiva loan will be used to purchase a lighting kit and a lens for her camera to improve the quality of her photographs even more .

loans.use: to purchase a lighting kit and a lens for her camera.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 38 years old and married with five children whose ages range between 1 and 16 years. Four of the children are currently attending school. He has been practicing mixed farming in his hometown of Kitale in western Kenya for ten years now. He sells his milk, maize, beans, eggs, and sugarcane to the local market. His primary challenges in this business has been poultry diseases and the high cost of poultry feeds.

Titus has had a good record with Juhudi Kilimo including successfully repaying his sixth loan. He has requested this loan of 40,000 Kes in order to expand his poultry farm. He intends to use this loan to purchase chicken feeds, construct a poultry house, and buy additional stock of chicken. The proceeds from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to have a large poultry farm and be the main supplier of poultry to the local market.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farm.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua, the mother of one child, is married to a fisherman and has been making doughnuts and meat pies in Elmina for the past three years. Efua uses her income to pay the utility bills and other household expenses and will use the loan to purchase flour, sugar, oil, salt and other ingredients. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save towards her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, oil, salt and other ingredients.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with seven children, three of whom attend school while two are underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past eight years, Rukia has operated a business of buying and selling cows and goats for meat  to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge because of the high cost of transportation in her business. Rukia dreams of purchasing more livestock in the future.

With a loan of Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase three cows for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost he business.

loans.use: To purchase three cows for sale.

loans.name: Meoli

texts.en:
Meoli is 38 years old married to Kitango and they are blessed with four children.  He owns a tailoring shop in Enkaroni where he sells clotheing.  He has been doing this for the last three years and gets an income of KES.5,000 per month.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member.  He has got good credit history and he is applying for his second loan of KES.50,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to use to purchase more clothes and fabric for sale.

He will use the extra profit to purchase livestock for his secondary business.  Meoli hopes to become a fashion designer and a prosperous farmer in the future.  He is very hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and fabric for sale

loans.name: Paraiso Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Paraíso  sus integrantes  le pusieron así por que a partir desde  que  fundación realidad les dio el préstamo  se sienten en el  paraíso ya que vivían con  preocupaciones.
Este grupo esta conformado por  once  integrantes  y  tiene  que reunirse cada  catorce días para realizar sus pagos. Tienen un comité  que  lo gobierna.
El representante  del grupo se llama  Benito  tiene  cuarenta ocho años de edad , estudio hasta la segundaria terminada ,y tiene tres hijos  todos  varones mayores de edad ya están casados. El se dedica  a la  compra de leñas y reparación de  camionetas cuenta con servicio automotriz y necesita el préstamo para comprar mas herramientas para arreglar las camionetas por que en ocasiones se atrasa en sus trabajos por falta de material.
Uno de sus sueños es   hacer mas  grande  su negocio ya que cuenta con muchos clientes  y no los quisiere  perder por falta de material ò por falta de tiempo.
  
Los otros  integrantes   se llaman :
Yesica Ivon – se dedica  a la venta de perfumes .
Victoria  Virginia- a la venta de tamales.
Alfonsina – se dedica a la  de totopos.
Fernando – se dedica a la elaboración de postres.
Remedios   Teresita - se dedica a la elaboración de  plásticos.
Antonio- se dedica a la  venta de refrescos.
Adriana – se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Arsenio- se  dedica a la  venta  chiles y semillas.
Daniel- se dedica a la costurera.
Patricia-venta de zapatos


Están muy contentos y agradecidos con fundación por ser de  parte de sus logros para salir adelante y así cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called Paraíso (Paradise). The members gave it this name because they used to be very worried, and since Fundación Realidad gave them the loan they feel like they are in Paradise.

The group has eleven members and must meet every two weeks to make its payments. They have a committee to govern them.

The group representative is named Benito. He is 48 years old, studied through the end of high school, and has three children, all boys who are now grown and married. He sells firewood and repairs trucks. He depends on his automotive service and needs the loan to buy more tools for fixing trucks because on occasion he falls behind in his work for lack of materials. One of his dreams is to make his business larger since he has many customers and does not want to lose them due to lack of materials or lack of time.

The other members are: 
Yesica Ivon -- she sells perfumes.
Victoria Virginia- tamale sales.
Alfonsina- she sells totopos [translator's note: a regional food similar to tortilla chips].
Fernando- he sells desserts.
Remedios Teresita- she sells plastic items.
Antonio- he sells soft drinks.
Adriana- she sells footwear.
Arsenio- he sells chiles and seeds.
Daniel- works as a tailor.
Patricia- shoe sales.

They are very happy and grateful to Fundación for being a part of their achievements in getting ahead and making their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy auto repair equipment

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta D. pupusas y ropa,  vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 16, 18 y 23 años D. edad, ella administra en su vivienda una tienda, por las tardes venD. pupusas y además sale a ofrecer ropa en los pueblos cercanos.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. ropa, también productos para el negocio como aceite,  frijoles, chicharron y quesillo, estos materiales le ayudaran para mantener surtido el negocio y atender la demanda D. los clientes.
El objetivo D. María, es que su negocio tenga la capacidad para atender las necesidades D. los clientes y pueD. tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria sells Salvadoran-style stuffed tortillas and also, clothing. She lives with her husband and 3 children, aged 16, 18, and 23, and operates a general store in her house. In the afternoon, she sells stuffed tortillas and, in addition, goes out to sell clothing in nearby towns.

Now, Maria is requesting a loan to buy clothing and also, products for her business, such as cooking oil, beans, pork cracklings, and tortillas with cream cheese. These supplies will assist her in maintaining her business and supplying customer demand.

Maria's objectives are for her business to have the capacity to proviD. what customers want and to increase her earnings.

loans.use: buy cooking oil, beans, pork cracklings, and tortillas stuffed with cream cheese to make 'pupusas', and to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a 52-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is 13.

Merlyn is a farmer working in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice and corn crops for almost 25 years. Merlyn said she sells her harvest to rice traders in her town. She earns about 4,500 PHP per month farming.

Merlyn is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to gain more profit from her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a loving and hardworking mother of four school-aged children. She is 42 years old and is married. Margarita’s husband is a farmer and is her partner in managing their rice farming business.

From every harvest, Margarita’s income was not still enough to finance her farm for the next crop. Her income was used to pay her children's school fees, meet their daily needs, and repay her borrowed loan from the traders --  private lenders who finance their needs in farming. 

Margarita wanted to borrow a loan of P25,000 to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and herbicides for farming.  She thinks that the loan will be a big help for her so she will no longer need to borrow from the traders.

loans.use: buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Komsuor

texts.en:
Komsuor (in the photo) is a widow with one son and two daughters. She lives in a village near the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Komsuor sells silk and cotton fabric and scarves. She buys them from the weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other places away from her house such as Kampong Speu, Kampong Cham, Kampong Chhnang, etc. 

Komsuor hopes to expand her business by buying additional silk and cotton fabric and scarves to sell, so she is asking for a loan to provide her capital.

loans.use: To purchase additional silk and cotton fabric and scarves to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 40-year-old married woman with 6 children. The oldest is 22 years old. 

Leonila and her husband are farmers and till land in Trinidad, Bohol.  Rice is the main crop that they grow and sell.  She does her best to provide for their needs and to send her children to school.  She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. 

Leonila hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de Jesus tiene 48 años de edad, vive en la aldea el cerro de marcovia, ahi vive con su esposo y un hijo, tiene la ayuda de su esposo en todas las responsabilidades del hogar.
Teresa es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio, que es una chiclera y venta de golosinas, dicha  actividad la realiza hace 2 años en la escuela publica de su comunidad. 
Teresa utilizara el credito para la compra de alimentos para la preparacion de sus golosinas, las cuales son: tacos, pastelitos, enchiladas, baleadas, burritas, todo el esfuerzo que Teresa hace es para salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús, 48, lives in the village of El Cerro de Marcovia with her husband and a son.  Her husband helps her with all the household responsibilities.

Teresa is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business which is gum and snacks sales.  She’s had the business for two years and it’s located at a local public school.

Teresa will use the loan to buy food to prepare her snacks which are: tacos, cakes, enchiladas, “baleadas” [flour tortilla which is folded and filled with refried beans, quesillo cheese or Parmesan cheese and sour cream; roast meat or scrambled eggs can be added if desired], burritos.  All of Teresa’s efforts are to get ahead and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn tortillas, flour tortillas, beans, cheese, eggs, butter, rice, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Vaituutuu

texts.en:
Vaituutuu is a 38 year old married woman with three children. Vaituutuu sells baked goods in the local community.  She has 4 years of experience in this business. 

Vaituutuu needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 Talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2010, Vaituutuu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Vaituutuu's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda, tiene 39 años de edad, esta acompañada con cuatro hijos.

Yolanda es una mujer muy emprendedora, que se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para damas, caballeros, como: faldas, camisas, pantalones y ropa interior, al por menor desde hace 2 años. Ella lo aprendió de una tía,  que la incentivo a establecer su propio negocio, anteriormente se dedicaba a realizar los oficios de la casa

La mercadería la compra en la capital del país, por que aquí la compra mas barato y encuentra una gran variedad de mercadería para todos los gustos, viaja dos veces por semana. Se levanta muy temprano para abordar el autobús, en la tarde regresa a preparar la mercadería que saldrá a vender el siguiente día a pie casa por casa y también vende en la casa, por que hay clientes que llegan a buscarla. 

El préstamo será invertido en la compra, de más cantidad de prendas de vestir, para tener variedad para ofrecer y poder vender más y que los clientes se sientan satisfechos. 

Al mismo tiempo ella recibirá mayores ingresos y mejorara su calidad de vida para ella y su familia. Yolanda desea tener un negocio estable, y ofrecer la mayor variedad de mercadería para todas las edades.
texts.en:
Sra. Yolanda is 39 years old and accompanied by her four children. She is an enterprising woman who buys and sells clothing for women, men, and children such as skirts, shirts, trousers, and undergarments. Yolanda has been in the retail business for two years and learned this trade from her aunt, who convinced her to start her own business. She previously devoted herself to housework.

Yolanda buys her merchandise in the capital because the prices are cheaper and there is a greater variety of products to satisfy all tastes. She travels twice a week and must wake up very early to board a bus. When she returns in the afternoon, Yolanda prepares the merchandise that she will sell the following day. She goes from house to house, but she also sell from her home because she has customers who come to her in search of merchandise.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of a large quantity of clothes so that she will have more variety to offer. This will enable her to sell more and keep her customers satisfied. At the same time, she will be able to generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. Yolanda desires to have a stable business so that she can offer a wider variety of products for all ages.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes.

loans.name: Farid

texts.en: Farid is a 26 year old married man. For the past 4 years he has been in the business of cattle breeding and milk selling. He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them, and then sells them at a profit.  His wife helps him to run the business, from which he gets a monthly profit of 200 AZN. This is the only source of income in his family. Farid has applied for a 1000 AZN loan in order to purchase one milking cow and one calf.

loans.use: to purchase one milking cow and one calf.

loans.name: 030812-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa, age 31, raises poultry and cattle. She has been engaged in this business for six years. Her primary business challenge is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and to sell in future. 

Mrs Hoa is the leader of a four-member group, the 030812-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her husband and two children.

In 2010, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to roads and sell

loans.name: Marcela Group

texts.en:
Marcela is 52 years old and lives in Trigos, Ozamiz City. She is widowed with one school-aged and six adult-aged children. 

To earn a living, Marcela has a business selling snacks like hot cakes. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Marcela has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc.

Marcela has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Marcela would like to expand her business in the neighboring area of Ozamiz.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc,

loans.name: Fatouimata

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Madame Fatoumata est âgée de 36 ans et vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans la  ville de Koutiala ( région de Sikasso ). 
Pour des raisons sociales, elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer les études primaires elle s’est vite intéressée  aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis le bas âge auprès de sa mère. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se lancer dans la vente des fruits et légumes il y a 10 ans. Fatoumata  trouve que cette activité lui procure assez de revenus, puisque les fruits et légumes sont des desserts qu’on a tous besoin pour le bien être.  
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle  en quantité, augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 7 ans.  Après  13 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe)  tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son 2eme prêt individuel dont le premier a été correctement payé.  
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter, des différents fruits et légumes à Sikasso et dans les villages environnants de Koutiala, elle effectue sa vente au grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle  de femmes et d’hommes  au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus. 
Elle compte sur les financements  de Soro  Yiriwaso pour l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
Married with three children, Mrs. Fatoumata is 36 years old and lives with her ​​husband and their children in the town of Koutiala (in the Sikasso region).

For social reasons, she was not given the opportunity to continue primary school. She quickly became interested in income-generating activities she learned at her mother's side from early childhood.

After conducting several unsuccessful activities, she finally got involved in selling fruit and vegetables some 10 years ago. Fatoumata finds that this activity provides her with sufficient income, since fruit and vegetables are needed by all to stay healthy.

To satisfy her numerous customers and expand her business, she decided to approach of the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution seven years ago. After 13 solidarity loans (group loans) all correctly reimbursed, this is her second individual loan, the first having been repaid in full.

With this loan she intends to purchase various fruit and vegetables from Sikasso and from villages surrounding Koutiala. She sells retail at the general market in Koutiala to a base of women and men customers, for cash or credit.

She expects an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA she plans to use for Soro interest payments, participation in daily family expenses, and invest the remainder in other income-generating activities. She relies on funding from Soro Yiriwaso for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: Buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a 44-year-old, married man. He and his wife have ten children, and they live in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Rodrigo is a farmer; specifically, he plants, harvests, and sells bananas. Rodrigo has been doing this for eight years, and he earns approximately 10,000 PHP every month from this work.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. In 2010, Rodrigo joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, he was better able to engage in business activities and to improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Rodrigo hopes to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Relation dynamique, Pauline est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la fabrication et la vente de friandise pour enfant. Il s'agit entre autres des m'amuses gueules arisanales sucrées appelées au Bénin ''TOFFI au lait, councada,  etc''. Pour mieux l'arromatiser, elle y ajoute du lait de coco. Après cuisson au feu doux, elle vend le Toofi" à des grossite et à des détaillants qui les vendent dans les grands marchés et devant les écoless. Elle rassemble sa famille très souvent pour l'aider. En vue d'accroître sa productivité et  de satisfaire  la demande de sa clientèle, elle fait  recours à Finadev afin de renforcer son stock et d'en tirer d'énorme profit pour le bien- être de la famille.
texts.en: Pauline is happily married and has three children. Her main business is the creation and sale of friande. Often her family helps her in this business. With the aim to improve productivity and to satisfy her customers demands, she has turned to Finadev to strengthen her supplies and make a great profit to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: 10 cartons de lait concentré,  achat de 3 sacs de coco

loans.name: Onofrio

texts.es: Onofrio, de 47 años de edad; está casado con Zenaida de 48 años de edad y tienen 05 hijos y viven muy felices en su propia casa  situada en el distrito de San Francisco. Onofrio, es una de las personas con mucho ahínco que lucha por el mejor bienestar de su familia.
