El Sr. Onofrio, se dedica al transporte fluvial en surcar los ríos con su bote, que sirve para transbordar personas e mercaderías. Viene trabajando 20 años como motorista emergiendo su bote bajo las inmensas aguas del Río Apurímac. En la travesía lo acompaña un ayudante quien se encarga de medir con un asta la profundidad del agua. No se queja de su trabajo al contrario se siente  feliz  por el servicio que presta. Gracias a su trabajo paga la escolaridad de sus hijos y a la vez compró tierras para  cultivar. Los planes que tiene para su negocio es adquirir otra canoa y poder alquilarlo y así obtener mayor ingreso económico. Este será su crédito número 15  con MFP, por lo que se compromete en seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está contento con su banco comunal, ya que el apoyo que le brindan es reciprocó. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará repuestos para el motor.
texts.en:
Onofrio, age 47, is married to Zenaida, age 48, and they have five children. They live very happily in their own home located in the district of San Francisco. Onofrio is the type of person that works diligently for the well-being of his family. 

Onofrio works in transportation by water - crossing the rivers with his boat - and transfers people and merchandise. He has been working for 20 years as a driver, taking his boat on the immense waters of the River Apurímac. In the crossing he is joined by an assistant who is in charge of measuring the depth of the water with a pole. 

He doesn't grumble about the work; on the contrary, Onofrio is happy with the service he provides. Thanks to his job he is able to pay for his children's education, and at the same time bought land for cultivation. For his business he plans to acquire a canoe and rent it, thereby obtaining another economic source of income. 

This will be his 15th loan with MFP, for which he pledges to continue fulfilling his payment plan. Furthermore he is happy with the community bank, and the support they offer is reciprocated. With the 1,500 nuevos soles (PEN), he will buy spare engine parts.

loans.use: to buy spare engine parts.

loans.name: Savina

texts.en:
Savina is a 69-year-old married woman. She has 10 children with ages ranging from 28 years to 52 years. She describes herself to be ambitious, polite and kind. 

Savina operates a retail stall where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a competitive green area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. 

Savina will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more maize for selling. Her business goal is to be selling other types of cereals such as beans, black beans, etc. within 5 years.

loans.use: buy maie

loans.name: Bety Aracely

texts.es:
La Señora Bety, tiene 31 años de edad tiene 2 hijos, y cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja en los gastos familiares, Su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería) y golosinas tiene 4 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, Bety esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de producto como ser: Arroz, manteca, jabón, azúcar, refrescos, carnes, embutidos y otros productos para la buena atención de sus clientes, Bety es una persona muy trabajadora y su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, contando con toda la clientela de la zona donde ella habita, negocio que le a ayudado a salir adelante ya que ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Bety, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Bety sueña con tener ella  mejor negocio de la zona, tener una caseta y surtirla con todo lo necesario para atender mejor sus clientes.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de Arroz, manteca, jabón, azúcar, refrescos, carnes, embutidos y otros productos para su negocio

loans.name: Aromo

texts.en:
Aromo A. is a 27 years old Ugandan and Acholi by tribe she comes from the northern town of Kitgum District. She is married with three children and her most occupation is local farming. She came to Kampala in 2000 as the result of war in northern Uganda. Since 2000, she has been settled at Banda Zone One, Nakawa Division. Both her and her husband, have been doing hard work like stone quarry and pottery work like carrying water from the well to the area where needed.

When A. joined Life in Africa, she begun experiencing an easier life because instead of over working, she could just do little work and get some money out of the beads she is making both at nome and as the group production at the WE center Kampala, she says she has actually acchieved alot from the activities at the center. She met many friends in such a short time and acquired so many skills that has enabled her to start developmental ideas.

A. feels that if she puts more money into the stone quarry that her husband is still continuing with, she believes that she will be able to go very far, she infact intends to build a house of her own after getting more money from the business that she is planning to do. she would like to boost her husband with more money so that they can achieve more from the quarry business and he too gets a bit of relief while involving more people to help him and hence creating jobs for more people.

She therefore seeks a loan of 500,000/= to acomplish her plans. she will be able to pay the loan back in 12 months.

Below is her Budget in full :
Buying quarry site ---------------- 150,000/=
Digging stones from pit ---------- 100,000/=
Removing from pit -------------- 50,000/=
Cracking stones --------------- 200,000/=
TOTAL --------------- 500,000/=

loans.use: Employing more people at the rock quarry

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Able is married with eight children, two of whom have finished their primary schooling. He has received some driver's training. He successfully repaid his first loan from PEMCI. That loan helped him create enough business to buy a small piece of land, a bicycle, and some domesticated animals like goats and cattle. He requests a second loan for $300 to continue to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia G. runs a restaurant out of her home in the small town of La Pacuala. This loan of $450 allows her to purchase a freezer so she can store meat and other perishable foods as well as keep desserts and beverages cold. This will help Claudia save money by purchasing in bulk now that she can store food over a longer period of time and she won’t have to travel to the markets as freqently to restock her kitchen.

She is a single mother of three: Francisco (24), Jazmín (22) and Antonio (19). Claudia has received three previous loans from Esperanza to start up her restaurant, purchase supplies and receive business training.

Claudia says her life is different now that she has opened up her own business because she can stay at her store now rather than having to walk the streets looking for money. An average of eight to ten people eat at her store for lunch every day.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer and some beverages for her restaurant.

loans.name: Oishahon

texts.ru:
Oishahon K. sells perfumes and other goods; she has been in business since 2001. Before she was working as a seamstress in a sewing factory. After she was laid off, she decided to start her own business. She started her business by selling colognes and perfumes. Currently in addition to colognes and perfumes she also sells different creams and hairspray. Oishahon is married, and her husband delivers the goods which she sells from Dushanbe (the capital of Tajikistan). Her son studies in school, and she wants him to go to university after he graduates. In the future, she wants to increase the assortment of goods and increase her business’ profit.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Кадырова Ойшахон – продает парфюмерию и другие товары галантерии, этим бизнесом занимается с 2001 года. Раньше работала на швейной фабрике портнихой. После сокращения она решила заниматься бизнесом. Бизнес начинала с продажами одеколонов и духов. Сейчас у неё кроме одеколонов и духов есть разные кремы и лаки для волос. Она замужем, муж ездит за товаром в Душанбе (столица Таджикистана) а она продает. Сын у неё учится в школе, она хочет, чтобы сын после школы учился в университет на факультете таможни. В будущем она хочет расширить ассортимент своих товаров и увеличить доход от бизнеса.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality commodities

loans.name: Miriam Hilda

texts.es:
Miriam and her husband contribute to the family income in a very creative way. They now live only with their youngest son because the older one has started his own family. It was Miriam’s ability to relate to lots of people that caused one of her friends to suggest to her that she sell a brand of cosmetics that is well-known in their country and for which good demand existed. Her friend told her about the good benefits and incentives the company offered and she decided to get involved in the business. She began with a close circle of friends, which opened the door to many more customers. Her friendly manner made her into one of the most popular cosmetics salespeople and it was thanks to this work that she was able to improve her family’s situation.

Miriam would like to increase her capital so that she can acquire a larger quantity of products, in order to be able to offer them to her clients in the moment when they need them, without any difficulties. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $400.00, which she is committed to repaying in a period of 6 months, so she can make her wish into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Miriam y su esposo contribuyen con el ingreso familiar de manera muy ingeniosa y ahora sólo cuentan con la compañía de su hijo menor porque el mayor a adquirido obligaciones propias luego de constituir su propia familia.La habilidad que posee Miriam para relacionarse con muchas personas hizo que una de sus amigas le propusiera la posibilidad de incursionar en la venta de cosméticos de una marca muy conocida y requerida en su país, se informó sobre los beneficios e incentivos que le otorgaba esta empresa y decidió formar parte de este negocio primero con su círculo más íntimo que poco a poco se fue abriendo e incorporando a muchas personas más ; la amabilidad y prestancia la convirtió en una de las más solicitadas y gracias a este trabajo ha ido incrementando su nivel de vida familiar.La inquietud de Miriam radica en el incremento de su capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de productos para poder ofrecérselos a cada una de sus clientas cuando lo necesitan y en el momento que lo requieran sin dificultad; por ello solicita un préstamo de 400 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses para hacer de su deseo un hecho real.

loans.use: To buy a stock of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma M. is a 67-year-old mother of six who lives in Vituka in Dar Es Salaam city. She runs a grocery in the area, a business that she has been doing for the past thirty years. She is in need of $575 to help expand and sustain her business.

loans.use: Expand grocery business

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: Matluba N. lives in Khujand; she is married. She works in the Joint-Stock Company, Navbakhor, in the commercial industry of the national lady’s dresses and fancy works. She has been the client of MicroInvest since 2006, and she works with MicroInvest because she trusts their loan procedure. Now Matluba N. requires a loan for the computer-machine purchase that will make the work more effective and increase the quality of the goods.

loans.use: A computer-driven machine.

loans.name: Lidia's Group

texts.en:
Lidia, Rosalia, and Deysi are part of the community bank “Prosperidad”. The first two have been members for one year, while Deysi has been a member for seven. In their bank they have learned to save, to be responsible, and to be united. They mentioned that when someone is sick or is in need of anything, all of the associates help out.

Deysi is 25 years old and lives with her partner and son. She sells meat in the Nery Garcia market. She has had her business for two years. Deysi learned this traD. from her grandmother. She travels to the markets around Ayacucho to buy animals and then butchers them.

Rosalia is 22 and also lives with her partner and one son. She was born in the town of Viscapalpa. She brings cheese from her old hometown to sell in different stores and to friends and neighbors.

Lidia is 68 years old. She is a widow and has eight children. Lidia sells grains and root vegetables from a cart in the Santa Clara market, and has done this for 50 years. Deysi, Rosalia, and Lidia need loans of 275, 150, and 200 dollars, which they will invest in sheep, pigs, cheese, corn, wheat, and flowers. They plan to use their savings to start a new business and save some for emergencies.

Deysi dreams of opening an auto parts store and improving her house. Rosalia dreams of having her own house and opening a store that sells windows and other types of glass products. Lidia’s dream is to have good health and, failing that, the money to pay for medical care.

loans.use: To buy sheep, pigs, cheese, corn, wheat, and flowers.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie G. is 50 years old and has 5 children. She is married and lives in Benin City. She has been in business for 28 years. She sells bread. She needs the loan amount of $850 to enable her buy more bread for sale. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Witness

texts.en:
Witness is 29 years old and is married woman with 1 child, age 6 years old. Witness owns a small pharmacy, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more medicine for her business.

loans.use: To buy more medicine and an air conditioner for the pharmacy

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan H., age 31, stays at home with her older sister and her two cousins. She has not married yet.

To meet her daily expenses, she would like a loan from Kiva to purchase stone to make a small grinding mill for 2 kg to 5 kg use. Before this, she stayed at home and made no profit. Every day she was given some money to spend on food. With this money, she can make a profit to help purchase food.

loans.use: To purchase stone to make a small grinding mill.

loans.name: Khean

texts.en:
Khean T. is 19 years old and lives in Khneas Village, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. T. makes about $0.60 per day farming, making wine, and designing small bamboo baskets. Her husband, Mr. Meach Mao, makes about $1 per day farming and charging customers to use his CD player. They have three children, all of whom are young so that they cannot earn income for the family.

To increase her income, she needs to expand her business. T. is seeking a loan of $300 to purchase small pigs to breed. This loan will help her to improve her income and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs to breed

loans.name: Tausoa

texts.en: Tausoa M., 36, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the village people and public market 4 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Tausoa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will also help her with her many family obligations. Her husband also helps out with the business.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides, machetes, boots, etc

loans.name: Koeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Koeurn M. is a subsistence farmer in Suo Sdey (Hello) Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a 39-year-old widow with two children, both of whom are employed in a garment factory. Although the family members have different business activities, they still live in poor conditions. Thus, Mrs. Koeurn M. decided to ask for a loan to add to her profit to start a cow breeding business so that she can improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to start a cow breeding business

loans.name: Fajardo Group

texts.es:
The Community Bank of Fajardo is maD. up of 16 clients from the Huancapi community, which is in the capital of the Huancapi district in the Ayacucho department. This community is primarily employed in farming cereals and alfalfa.

Raida H. has a small store where she sells office supplies, drinks, fruits, and photocopies. She also has a trout farm and she raises guinea pigs in her home. At the moment Raida has 200 guinea pigs, and the business is going well. At the Community Bank Raida has learned to save, to love herself, and to value herself as a person. She also receives loans easily, and she relaxed with the knowledge gained during the Bank's training sessions. Raida dreams of improving her guinea pig business and sending her daughters to school, even though they are also entrepreneurs. Raida would like to save money to open a poultry shop with her daughters.

Felipa G. sells groceries and hardware. She also buys cereals to sell in Ayacucho. Felipa raises guinea pigs and grows tomatoes and other vegetables to sell. Felipa says that she’s never had the opportunity to save or to take out loans, but in the Community Bank she learned to value herself, to work hard, and to get ahead with her family. Felipa’s dream is to improve her business and buy a car. Her son is graduating from the police academy and with her savings she’d like to send her other children to school.

Lucia Eudosia P. D. Fernández has a small grocery store. She also plants vegetables, and buys tara and suckling pig. At her Community Bank Lucia has learned to treat her customers well, value herself as a woman that has everything. Lucia says that while she is healthy she’ll do everything that she can to achieve her dreams. Her only dream is to save for when she and her husband reach old age, as they are older and their children are fully grown. Lucia would like to have savings available for when she needs them, especially for medical care.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El Bancomunal Fajardo esta formado por 16 clientas, pertenece a la comunidad D. HUANCAPI, esta ubicado en el capital D. distrito D. Huancapi, en el departamento D. Ayacucho, esta comunidad mayormente se dedica a la producción D. cereales y cultivo D. alfalfa, y la mayoría D. la gente se dedica al negocio.

Raida H., tiene una pequeña bodega, venD. útiles D. escritorio, bebidas, frutas, también cuenta con una fotocopiadora. Tiene su granja D. truchas y se dedica a criar cuyes en casa hasta ahora tiene 200 cuyes y va bien el negocio. En el bancomunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona, también recibe préstamos con mucha facilidad, se relajo con lo que les enseñan en las capacitaciones. El sueño D. Raida es mejorar su negocio y tener su granja D. cuyes, hacer estudiar a sus hijas aunque ellas también ya tienen su negocio. Raida, quisiera abrir una pollería con sus hijas y para eso quiere ahorrar.

Felipa G. , venD. abarrotes y cosas D. ferretería, también se dedica a comprar cereales y llevarlos a Ayacucho. Felipa cría cuyes y siembra tomates y coles para comercializar. Felipa dice que nunca tuvo la oportunidad D. ahorrar y sacar prestamos, en el Bancomunal aprendió a darse valor, fuerza y salir adelante por sus hijos junto a su esposo. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y comprarse un carro. Su hijo esta graduándose D. policía y con sus ahorros quiere que sus demás hijos también estudien.

Lucia Eudosia P. D. Fernández, venD. abarrotes en una tiendita, se dedica a sembrar hortalizas, comprar tara y cochilla. En su bancomunal ha aprendido a tratar bien a sus clientes, valorarse como mujer que tiene todo, ella dice: “mientras la salud me acompañe haré todo el esfuerzo para poder cumplir mis sueños”. Su único sueño es ahorrar para su vejez y la D. su esposo, ya son ancianos y sus hijos todos son mayores. Lucia quiere que sus ahorros estén disponibles para cuando lo necesite, para su salud y otros.

loans.use: The partners need different loan amounts. Some need 600 soles, some need 1000 soles, for a total of 13,800 soles for the Community Bank.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 40 years old. She is a widow with 3 children aged 23, 16, and 12 years old. She has been a fish and clothes (bedsheets and khanga--traditional Tanzanian wraps) seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

In the past, Fatma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Fatma now seeks a loan to expand her business by adding more fish and clothes for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish and clothes for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel A. A. is called "Sammy" by most people in his community. He is 46 years old and married, with four children who are currently in school. Samuel is a dealer in hardware like assorted paints, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, PVC pipes etc. at Nankese in Koforidua, a town where he lives with his family. He buys his supplies from importers in Accra, the capital of Ghana, at wholesale prices and sells them to his customers at retail prices. He requests a loan to enable him to procure increased stock to accelerate business progress. With the loan, he hopes to increase savings so he can expand his shop to include the sale of cement. He would be very grateful for your support. He is a member of the trust group called "Biako ye" (meaning It is good to come together) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and assist themselves to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to expand his hardware business.

loans.name: Flor De Amancay Group

texts.es:
La asociación “flor de Amancay” pertenece al centro focal de Villa Adela y trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace más de un año.
Casadas en su mayoría tienen un promedio de cinco hijos cada una, en muchos casos sus parejas las abandonaron teniendo que hacerse cargo ellas solas de sus familias, es por ello que emprendieron pequeños negocios, con el fin de conseguir recursos para sus hogares.
La asociación “Flor de Amancay” se dedica al comercio en general, diversos productos son vendidos en diferentes mercados y calles de la ciudad; material escolar, plasticos, maletines, accesorios para el cabello, y otros, estos son adquiridos de mayoristas para luego ser vendidos al por menor. Este grupo necesita mayores créditos para comprar mercadería al por mayor de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias y por ende les permita generar ingresos suficientes para sustentar sus hogares.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Amancay” [Amancae Flower] Association is located in the Villa Adela neighborhood and has worked with Pro-Mujer for more than a year.

Most members are married and each has an average of five children; in many cases their spouses have abandoned them, leaving them solely responsible for their families. It is because of this that they started small businesses with the goal of obtaining household income.

The Flor de Amancay Association works in different markets and streets of the city selling diverse products such as school supplies, plastics, purses and bags, hair accessories, and other items. These products are obtained from wholesalers to then be retailed. This group needs increased credit in order to buy wholesale merchandise in greater quantities and in this way have greater earnings and sufficient income to maintain their households.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased credit in order to buy wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres Con Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres con fe y esperanza" is the name of a group which is looking to receive their first loan. Each member is living in extreme poverty and does not have a source of consistent income. Fortunately, the group members learned about Kiva and the assistance being provided through Kiva to aspiring entrepreneurs. Accordingly, each member took part in many meetings and workshops to develop their respective business plans.

Casilda is the representative of this group. She plans on operating a small business in her neighborhood where she will sell clothing, but she hopes to have her own store someday. She notes that she has always been a good seamstress, and that she has made clothing for her children. As a result, she will utilize these skills to create a successful business because she feels that she can truly excel in this field. She is a very hard-working woman, and she is extremely excited about this opportunity. She dreams of sending her children to college, and she wants nothing more than to give her children a chance to break out of poverty. Indeed, she wants to give her children every opportunity possible: this is the first step in reaching that dream, and she is ready to take the step!

loans.use: To start a clothing business by purchasing materials in order to make clothing

loans.name: Mrs. Pom Mai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The seventeen members live in Damrei Chhlang village in Kandal province. Each will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. Pom M. is a village bank president and is the group leader. She is 35 years old and the mother of three children, who all attend the local school. She owns 1 hectare farm on which she cultivates rice for a living. This season, she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to for this purpose. The loan will also allow her to purchase a water pump, which will increase her crop yield. Her husband, Mr. Sen Sun, constructs houses for a living.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main loan type. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Borrowers can repay portions of the principal earlier than the end of the term if they are financially able, which most clients tend to do. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds

loans.name: Judy Lee

texts.en:
Judy Lee P. grows pigs for a living. Now that she is 38 year old, she is thinking of some other possibilities to stretch their limited budget. She has two children who are less than five years old. She is dreaming that someday her children will be able to graduate with a college degree. In this way, life will be easier for them when they grow up. Her husband is a farmer. She and her husband both work very hard to sustain their family and to provide for the needs of their children. 

Judy started with only one piglet in their backyard. After that one, she tried raising more pigs and selling them directly to a buyer from Davao. She is asking for a loan from CEVI to purchase more piglets. In this way, she believes she will earn a bigger profit and she will be able to send both her children to school. Specifically, she will use the loan to expand her business.

CEVI is an organization that helps people achieve their dreams in life. With the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage CEVI gives its clients, more and more people are able to grow and sustain their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio S. está muy agradecido con todos ustedes por el gran apoyo que recibió en le préstamo anterior. Su negocio a crecido bastante a podido comprar dos puestos mas que están ubicados en el centro de la ciudad. También ha podido darles trabajo a dos personas más. 
  Está solicitando su cooperación para comprar mercancía y acondicionar un puesto que acaba de adquirir. Su deseo es seguir desarrollándose en las  ventas de comida.
texts.en:
Mr. José Antonio S. thanks you for the great support he received from the last loan. His business has grown a lot, and he's been able to buy two more locales in the city's downtown area. He has also been able to provide employment to two more people. He is requesting your cooperation to buy merchandise and to equip a recently-purchased locale. His goal is to continue developing his food sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply merchandise and equip a new locale

loans.name: Ulfat Ghulam Rasool Group

texts.en:
Ulfat baji is a wife of G. R. who has a cold drink corner in the community for the past 5 years. Ulfat baji is the mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. All of her kids are getting an education from a school located near their house. Ulfat baji is a seamstress. She sews clothes, taking orders from her neighbors. She uses her income to pay the school fees of her kids. She is applying for a loan to buy cold drinks for her husband’s cold drink corner.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Latifan baji wants a loan to buy dried fruits to sell. Naziran baji wants a loan to change the body of her family's auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Haseena baji wants a loan to buy shoes for her shoe-selling business. Another Haseena baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cold drinks for cold drink corner

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace T. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Grace sells food supplies and fish. She buys the fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale in Abura, which she has done since 2005. Grace uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Grace will use this loan to increase her capital to buy food supplies and fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. Grace plans to reinvest her profits back into her business and expand it further.

loans.use: To buy food supplies and fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Monsieur Modou B. est un commerçant qui sollicite son premier crédit auprès de l’IMCEC.  Il gérait une cantine a Dakar de 2000 a 2005 eu marche.  Depuis 2005, il fait la navette entre Touba Tivaoune et Thies.  Son activité consiste à vendre de diverses marchandises comme d’arachide, patte d’arachide, pain de singe (le fruit de Baobab), et café.  Avec ce prêt, il envisage renforcer son activité et aussi faire la toiture de la chambre de sa mère.  Monsieur B. est célibataire et il habite au quartier Cité Lamy à Thiès, une ville de 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.
texts.en:
Mr Modou B. is a merchant who's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, IMEC. He used to run a small shop in Dakar from 2000 to 2005. Since 2005, he's been traveling back and forth between Touba Tivaoune and Thiès. His business consists in selling various products such as peanuts, peanut butter, "monkey bread" (baobab tree fruit), and coffee. With this loan, he intends to bolster his business, and also to put a new roof on his mother's bedroom. Mr. B. is unmarried and lives in the Cité Lamy neighborhood in Thiès, a city located 70 kilometers from Dakar, the capital of Senegal.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for his food selling business, and to repair his house

loans.name: Omary

texts.en:
Omari Debagula is a Tanzanian teacher. He runs a kindergarten school in the Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. There are 50 schoolchildren in his school. He also teaches some primary-school classes. He has employed two teachers who assist him in his school.

He plans to purchase plots of land where he intends to construct his own classrooms. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 toward this end.

loans.use: To buy sites for building school facilities.

loans.name: Nazrvi

texts.ru: Хомидова Назрви проживает в районе Пяндж. Возраст 55 лет , замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Занимается торговлей. Торгует обувью на рынке района. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже около 12 лет. Доход в месяц составляет около 800 сомони.Этих денег хватает только для того , чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет увеличить ассортимент товара и таким образом привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
H. Nazrvi lives in the Pyandj region. She is 55 years old, is married and has one child. She works in sales. She sells shoes at the regional market. She has been in this business for around 12 years. Her monthly income is around 800 somoni. This money is only enough to provide for her family. She plans to take out a loan in order to increase her turnover. This will help her to increase her product assortment and to attract new customers this way.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse A. is from the village of Unidos. She is 31 years old,  is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jesse owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products to the local community. Jesse has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jesse joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesse has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jesse is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Jesse from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Yawo K. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. il arrive à nourrir difficilement sa famille étant donné que sa moto est vieille et lui cause régulièrement des dépenses pour la réparation. Avec ce crédit, Yawo souhaite acheter une nouvelle moto afin de mieux exercer son métier et gagner plus d’argent. Cette activité est devenue la principale activité source  de revenus de la jeunesse.
texts.en:
Yawo K. is 35 years old, married, and the father of three. He manages to feed his family with difficulty, given that his motorbike is old and regularly costs him to repair it. With this loan, he wishes to buy a new motorbike in order to work at his trade and to earn more money. This trade has become the principal business and source of revenue for young people.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Mayra Luisa

texts.es: Mayra Luisa tiene 46 años y es madre de 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella y que están estudiando. La ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda, por lo que ha sido difícil salir adelante con esta situación que enfrentamos y además hacerse cargo de los pagos de la escuela de sus hijos, pero Mayra es una mujer muy responsable y sobre todo muy emprendedora y a pesar de esto ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para dedicarse a los quehaceres del hogar y además atender su negocio. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, jabón y golosinas en general. Su deseo es preparar a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien para la vida.
texts.en:
Mayra Luisa is 46 years old and is a mother of two children that are students and still dependents. The location of her business is in a modest dwelling, which has made it difficult to get ahead in this situation that we are facing and additionally be in charge of paying for her children's schooling. However, Mayra is a very responsible and, above all, enterprising woman and in spite of these difficulties she has known how to keep her family going. Every day she gets up very early to do household chores and to tend to her business too. The money that she is requesting is for working capital in order to buy staple grains, detergents, soap and sweets. Her desire is to prepare her children to be good people.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy staple grains, detergents, soap and sweets.

loans.name: José Jeremías

texts.es: Don José Y. tiene 21 años de edad, es Casado de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su Esposa, él y su Esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 3 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Pajucbalicaj, de la Aldea Nimasac del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José Y. is 21 and married. He is a weaver, and he makes women’s typical skirts. He has a shop with two looms. He lives with his wife. They both do the same work, and they have two employees that help them. They have been making typical skirts in their home for three years. They live in the Pajucbalicaj Caserío, in the Aldea Nimasac, in the Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently, customer demand has grown. However, his economic condition is not sufficient to be able to increase his capital. That is why he has come to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. He will use the loan to buy raw material. That way he will be able to increase his sales. He is also hoping to help his family get ahead so that they have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts      (buy raw materials)

loans.name: Иброхим

texts.ru: Иброгим , мужчина продолжает свою деятельность. Он торгует на базаре Панчшанбе продуктами питания. Товар он закупает на оптовом рынке Афган-базар. Период кредитования он увеличил товарооборот и у него стало много покупателей.Так как Иброгим работает в средней школе  преподавателем в бизнесе ему помогает сын. На следующий займ он планирует закупить детское питание, несколько коробок жвачек, припав.

loans.use: На закупку детского питания, несколько коробок жвачек, припавы

loans.name: Zainab Group

texts.en:
Zainab is the group leader of the Zainab Group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants a loan to improve and enlarge their businesses, so they are requested a group loan of 20000 Afghani. 

Zainab wants a loan for her husband who has a watch shop. Farshta wants a loan for her tailoring business. Karema wants a loan for her embroidery business of embroidery. Habeba wants a loan for her carpet weaving business. 

They are very thankful that Kiva lenders can support all poor people.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Yanapasiñani Group

texts.es: ”Yanapasiñani” en lengua aymará significa “ Ayudémonos entre nosotros”, es la denominación que adoptan dieciséis mujeres, que trabajan hace siete años junto a Pro-Mujer. Esta asociación  se dedica principalmente al comercio y en algunos casos la preparación de comida, por ejemplo Pastora tiene una pensión donde ofrece almuerzos y cenas, Juana vende frutas, Maria vende muñecos de peluche, Angélica que es una de las fundadoras se dedica hace seis años a la venta de ropa, Sofía vende ropa interior, Esta asociación afirman que precisan capital para poder reactivar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Yanapasiñani, an Aymara word, means Let Us Help One Another. The name was chosen by these sixteen women, who have been working the last seven years with the support of Pro-Mujer. The association engages primarily in commercial ventures, including food preparation and sales. For example, Pastora owns a boarding house where she serves lunch and dinner, Juana sells fruit, Maria sells stuffed toys, founding member Angelica has sold clothing for the past six years, Sofia sells underwear. The association needs capital to improve the members’ individual businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Maruja es casada, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Maruja viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende pescado, pollo y de las ferias compra quesos, animales menores que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso y cerdo.
Los sueños de Maruja son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the Musuq Rumi, which in Quechua means New Rock, Communal Bank. Maruja is 34, married, and has three children. Maruja travels to different regional fairs where she sells fish and chicken. At the fairs she buys cheese and small animals, which she sells in the city of Ayacucho. Maruja needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy cheese and pork. Maruja’s dreams are that her children become professionals and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese and pork

loans.name: Ecitel

texts.pt:
Nb. Não foi possível a foto no local do negocio porque faz em regime ambulatório e por encomenda.

Ecitel Fernando M. nasceu em Maputo, tem 31 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 02 filhos de 15 e 5 anos de idade, todos vão à escola, estudou ate 8ªclasse parou de estudar quando ficou grávida, pois foi obrigada a cuidar do filho uma vez que o namorado negou de assumir as responsabilidades. Vive na casa própria e para alem dos filhos sustenta 02 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Maputo para Namaacha (distrito localizado ao sul da cidade de Maputo e que faz fronteira com Suazilândia) quando a sua mãe se separa do seu pai. 
É negociante ambulante de potes a mais de oito anos, aprendeu a fazer o negocio sozinha depois de ter tentado vender refrigerantes. O seu rendimento mensal varia de 6.000,00MT a 7.000,00MT, com este rendimento consegue sustentar a família e poupar algum para melhorar a sua habitação.

Nunca trabalhou com outras instituições de credito e este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000,00MT, com o qual pretende comprar potes de alumínio para poder responderem à demanda e consequentemente os seus rendimentos vão melhorar. O primeiro foi de 10.000,00MT destinado à mesma actividade. 

Pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra e investir cada vez mais no seu negocio.
texts.en:
Ecitel Fernando M. is from Maputo, Mozambique. She is 31, single, and has two kids ages 5 and 15, both students. She finished 8th grade but had to drop school because she got pregnant. The kid's son never helped her. She lives in her own house and in the top of her two sons, she also supports two nephews who live with her. She is a house to house seller of pots and has been doing it for 8 years. She previously worked selling sodas but that didn't work out. Her monthly income varies between 6.000,00MT and 7.000,00MT (U$140 to U$160). With this money she supports her family and tries to save some to improve her living conditions. She is asking for a U$525 loan in order to buy aluminum pots, as there's demand for those and she thinks it'll improve her profits.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of aluminum pots

loans.name: Kambua

texts.en:
Kambua is a 36 year-old, married mother of three children. She has been running a business as a butcher, in Nairobi, for three years. Kambua was able to open the butcher business thanks to a loan from Faulu. She is now requesting a loan of KES 60,000 to renovate the business, purchase a weighing machine, and open a fashion and design shop in the market. She describes herself as stable and hopes to open another butcher shop in the future.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Renovate business & to purchase a weighing machine.

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en: Mamuna is a 20-year-old young lady. She is married and the mother of one child. She is currently in school and is a very hard-working trader. She enjoys selling and cosmetics sales has been her major source of livelihood for the past three years. She says selling of cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers and market acceptance. She does not have a shop at the moment, so she sells on top of a table in the community market and sometimes through hawking. She believes that with the loan, she would be more resourced to purchase more stock of cosmetics to increase her inventory, and income for that matter.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetic products

loans.name: Zoulfikar

texts.en: Zoulfikar is single and lives at home with his six sibilings. He is a very hard worker, and in 2007 decided to open a bakery where he makes delicious breads and other products. He has applied for a loan for $1,200 to buy additional tools and appliances for his bakery.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and appliances

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed M. runs the Arusha Dishes restaurant where he has sold cooked food like french fries, rice and chapatis, among others, to frequent customers and walk-ins during the last 10 years.  His business challenge is fluctuating and unpredictable demand.  He plans to use the proceeds of a KES20,000 loan to add more chairs and renovate the restaurant.  His life goal is to run a hotel.  Mohamed is married and has two children.  He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy chairs and renovate the restaurant.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca P. is from the village of Sto. Niño in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 65 years old. Rebecca is married. To make a living, Rebecca sells clothing in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to expand business. This will be Rebecca's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr: T. Léa est née en 1953 et vit depuis 40 ans au quartier Xwlacodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AMOUSSOU Joseph, Léa est mère de deux enfants. En plus de ses deux enfants, Léa a deux autres enfants à sa charge. Léa n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais certains de ses enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Xwlacodji. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour assurer les différentes charges qui lui incombent, Léa a une boutique size dans son quartier, où elle vend divers produits (produits de toilette et de beauté, liqueurs, etc.). Léa mène comme activité secondaire la vente de tissus, ce qui lui permet d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenu. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Léa s’approvisionne. Il y a près de 30 ans que Léa mène cette activité. Léa a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. La clientèle de Léa s’accroit de jour en jour, et Léa n’arrive plus à satisfaire toutes leurs demandes compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose. Afin d’augmenter son niveau d’activité et de mieux faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle, Léa sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
T. Léa was born in 1953 and has been living for 40 years in the Xwlacodji district in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Married to AMOUSSOU Joseph, Léa is the mother of two children. Besides these two children, Léa is responsible for two other children.

Léa did not attend school, but certain of her children attend school. The family live together in Xwlacodji. The couple are jointly responsible for supporting the family. To earn her living, Léa has a little shop located in her district, where she sells various products (toiletries, cosmetics, liqueurs, etc.) As a secondary business, she sells cloth, which allows her to have several income sources. She gets her merchandise at Dantokpa, international market of Bénin.

Léa has been in this business for almost 30 years. She has already received and correctly reimbursed two loans from ALIDé. Her clientele is growing by leaps and bounds and Léa is not able to satisfy demand, in view of the meager financial means at her disposal. In order to bolster her little businesses and better satisfy the needs of her customers, Léa is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of toiletries and cosmetics and liqueurs

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma A. is married and has two children. She has a junior high school education.  

She sells onions in large quantities at Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now.  Emma uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and bills.  

Emma will use the loan to purchase more bags of onions to sell. She plans to save her new profits to reinvest into her expanded business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of onions to sell.

loans.name: Rubenia De Jesus

texts.es: Rubenia De Jesús tiene 50 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería pues tiene más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues sus inicios fueron muy difíciles porque no tenía el capital de trabajo suficiente para ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos, pues ella tiene muchos clientes que son sus vecinos además la atención que reciben es algo que les atrae mucho. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento con el fin de mantener a sus clientes ya que lo necesita para la compra de materia prima como detergentes, pan, productos para el hogar entre otras cosas. Sueña con transformar su negocio en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Rubenia De Jesús is 50 years old. Her economic activity is a general store she has been working in for 30 years. Staring her business was difficult because she didn't have enough funds to offer a wide variety of products. She has many clients who are neighbors and the attention she offers attracts them. She is requesting a loan to keep her clients that rely on her, buy products such as detergents, bread, and household products, etc. She dreams of transforming her business into a wholesale store.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more products

loans.name: Israel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Israel Antonio M. E., es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como vigilante, es casado tiene tres hijos todos dependen de él. 

El señor Israel M. E., además de trabajar en  la Alcaldía se dedica a la agricultura, pues la comarca donde vive es buena para la siembra, el señor M. E. solicito el crédito para reparar un poco su casa ya que no está bien cerrada.
texts.en:
Israel works as a security guard in the Chinandega city hall. He also farms. The area where he lives is good for farming. He is requesting this loan in order to make some repairs to his home which is not very secure.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks.

loans.name: Antoliano

texts.es:
El señor Antoliano tiene 68 años, es separado, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, independientes y profesionales.
Posee una despensa en su domicilio, con una antigüedad de 19 años aproximadamente, se inicio a esta actividad poco antes de su retiro de la milicia,  de a poco cargó un pequeño kiosko que  fue creciendo, actualmente tiene buena clientela y  buen inventario de mercaderias.
Solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderias tales como: azucar, yerba, fideos, panificados y bebidas en general.
texts.en:
Antoliano is 68 years old. He is separated and has two grown children. They are independent, and they are professionals. He has had a grocery store in his house for approximately 19 years. He started this business a little bit after retiring from the military. He gradually set up a small kiosk, and it was growing. He currently has good customers and a good inventory of merchandise. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like sugar, herbs, noodles, baked goods, and beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like sugar, herbs, noodles, baked goods, and beverages

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun S. (shown in the photo), 52, and her husband, Mr. Nat Ou, 57, have been married since 1979 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home, and another one is a construction worker. They are living along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Savoeun has been selling fruit for thirty years. Her husband has been a construction worker for twenty years. She hopes to create another new business raising pigs. She will be able to get extra income from selling pigs when they grow big enough. So, she is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina B. is from Gingoog City. She is 31 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Gina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Gina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Malinche Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Malince lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Rosa Amanda Montiel  quien tiene una pequeña venta donde comercializa granos básicos, café, gaseosas, frescos, helados y chiverías. Ella con el préstamo comprar los productos para su venta por ejemplo la gaseosa cada tres días hace se facturan.

Asimismo esta señora de 55 años quien tiene nueve hijos de los cuales tres son menores de edad sueña con componer su casa especialmente tener un espacio adecuado para el negocio y que no se encuentre en la sala de su hogar sino en una caseta aparte por lo menos este año tratara de hacer el arranque. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Rosalina de Jesús  R. Vázquez se dedica a la venta de hisopa lo cual se utiliza para caliar las cunetas y María Virginia Joaquín Martín quien vende ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Malinche group is made up of three women workers. One of them, Rosa Amanda, has a small store where she sells basic grains, coffee, soft drinks, ice cream and Chivería products [yogurt, milk etc]. She plans to use the loan to buy merchandise for her store. She is billed every three days for the soft drinks. Rosa is 55 years old. She has nine kids, three of which are minors. She dreams of being able to make improvements in her home. Specifically, she would like to have adequate space for her business; preferably, not attached to a room of her home but rather,n in a separate structure. She hopes to open shop at least by the end of the year. Her group partners are Rosalina de Jesús and María Virgina. Rosalina works selling paintbrushes which are used for whitewashing roadside drainage channels and María sells clothing and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, soft drinks, dairy products etc.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidas lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas originarias de Masaya, ciudad de las flores. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Lidia V. quien tiene una tortillería. La tortilla es el bastimento por excelencia de los y las nicaragüenses y no falta en el desayuno, almuerzo y cena.
 V. inicio con este negocio en el 2003 con la compra de un quintal de maíz, medio flete de leña (la mitad de una carreta de leña) y un comal, actualmente el negocio ha ido creciendo que no se daba abasto ella sola echando tortillas.

Mientras las otras integrantes del grupo Yolanda B. y Vilma M. se dedican al comercio de cosméticos por catalogo y desean que sus negocios crezcan.
texts.en:
The group "Unidas" ("Together") is composed of three hard-working, entrepreneurial, strong women from Masaya, the city of flowers. The group's coordinator is Lidia V., who owns a tortillería or tortilla shop. Tortillas are a Nicaraguan staple, eaten at breakfast, lunch, and dinner. V. began her business in 2003 with the purchase of 46kg of corn, half a cart of firewood, and a metal hotplate used for cooking. Currently, her business has been growing so much that she is unable to make all the tortillas herself. Meanwhile, the other members of the group Yolanda B. and Vilma M. sell mail-order cosmetics. They want their businesses to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Primary materials for business

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al Banco comunal Sarita y durante el tiempo que esta en su Banco aprendió a ahorrar además que los prestamos le ayudan en su negocio.
Maria es viuda y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Maria vende loceria de manera ambulante en el mercado Nery García, también viaja a las ferias y reparte de casa en casa, su mayor sueño es tener un puesto estable como un kiosco para vender sus productos. Además Maria por campañas vende otros productos como mochilas en época escolar. Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de ollas, platos, tazas.
Maria tiene proyectado comprar una mototaxi para que su hijo trabaje.
texts.en:
María is a member of Sarita communal bank. While a member she has learned how to save and that loans are a help to her business. María is a widow and has four children who are students. She sells kitchenware ambling though Nery García market. She also goes to the various other markets and also sells door-to-door. Her greatest wish is to have a stable stand, like a kiosk, to sell her products. During certain sales periods, like back-to-school, she also sells appropriate articles like backpacks, for example. She needs a 1000 sol loan to buy pots, dishes and cups. María plans to buy a mototaxi (three wheel vehicle used to provide passenger and cargo transportation services) so that her son can work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots, dishes and cups.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
El Señor Ronald Sánchez Mejía es una persona que desde muy joven se fue de su hogar, en busca de trabajo, el llego a Ivirgarzama donde contó con la ayuda de su hermana mayor, es soltero y no tiene hijos.

Actualmente el trabaja en el sindicato de moto taxis “2 de Agosto” es muy responsable en la labor que desempeña, se levanta a muy tempranas horas por la mañana para brindar sus servicios con el apoyo de su sindicato ya que ellos les otorgan turnos en las diferentes paradas que actualmente cuenta el sindicato.

El señor Ronald Sánchez Mejía se apersono a CIDRE por el comentario de sus compañeros del sindicato  para poder saber algo de créditos y si es que podía solicitar uno para la compra de un vehículo (motocicleta) para así poder facilitar la vida que lleva, y así poder tener más ingresos para su bienestar propio y así en un fututo poder formar una familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Ronald Sánchez Mejía Leith left his home in search of work when he was very young. He arrived in Ivirgarzama, where he got help from his older sister. He is single and has no children. He currently works with the “2 de Agosto” moto taxi union, and is very responsible about his work. He rises at very early hours every morning to provide his services, and receives help from the union. The union assigns turns to the different stops that it controls. Mr. Ronald Sánchez Mejía came to CIDRE, after hearing from his coworkers, to learn about loans and to see if he could request one to buy a vehicle (motorcycle) that would help simplify his life. This would allow him to earn a greater income for his own well being, which would allow him to start a family in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle

loans.name: Anju

texts.en: This is 28-year-old Anju N.. She is married and has one child aged 12. In 1998, she established her tailoring business and, working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. Anju has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW. She used this most recent loan to purchase raw materials for her tailoring business. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailors’ stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, Patan BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase their production and profitability. About Patan BPW: This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner in Nepal: micro-finance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. It operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower N. women within the home and community.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús R. E. es un seño de 64 años de edad, vive con su esposa y está a cargo de dos nietos  menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar gracias al enorme esfuerzo de Manuel, su residencia se ubica en Soyapango. Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa ambulante que comercializa con su esposa, en la calles de San Salvador, este es un negocio muy difícil pero es su única entrada de dinero lo cual ayuda a la pareja a saldar su deudas, por lo que se esfuerzan mucho día con día,  el préstamo ha sido solicitado para poder invertir más en la ropa que ellos compran, y poder ayudarse para tener un pequeño lugar en el que sea más fácil la comercialización del producto.
texts.en:
64-year old Manuel de Jesús R. E. lives with his wife and is responsible for two young grandchildren who attend school thanks to his efforts. His home is in Soyapango. He and his wife earn their living selling clothing on the streets of San Salvador. It’s a very difficult job, but it is the only income they have to pay their debts so they work hard every day. The loan that Manuel is seeking will be used to buy more clothing and eventually to obtain a stall from which it would be easier to sell their products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena P. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 39 years old. Elena is married. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. Elena is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es el Sr. Eufemia;  La socia tiene 43 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia  trabaja en el mercado como comerciante minorista ella compra y vende verduras en el mercado central de Urubamba la socia compra al por mayor de los mayoristas las verduras, ella luego los vende en su stand. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner belongs to the "SR. DE TANTAMARCA" communal bank.  This bank is in the Chicon district of the Urubamba province and the administrative district of Cuzco.

Her name is Eufemia.  She is 43 years old, is married, and has 3 children.  She works as a small retailer buying and selling produce in the central market of Urubamba.  She buys produce in bulk from the wholesalers and then sells it in her stand.  She is seeking a loan to buy bulk produce.

Eufemia is grateful for and appreciates the loan received through this channel and, at the same time, commits to making her repayments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: To buy produce in bulk

loans.name: Mercedes De Jesús

texts.es:
Mercedes G. vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de León. Cabe señalar que ella es una dama muy trabajadora y con gran espíritu de superación por lo que ha sabido mantener su hogar llevando el sustento a su mesa.

Actualmente requiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para ello está solicitando el crédito para lac omrpad e zinc y madera para llevar a cabo la mejora en dicha vivienda ya que lo requiere a lo inmediato y de esta manera contribuye al bienestar de su amada familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes De Jesús G. Castillo lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa Del Peñón, León department, one and a half blocks south of the René Pulido Health Center.  She has a life partner and is employed by the Santa Rosa del Peñón Ministry of Health as an Expeditor.  She has worked for this institution for 26 years.

She owns a house that she wants to improve.  The loan will be used to buy zinc metal sheeting and lumber to repair the home.  This will allow her to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting and lumber.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy, de 27 años, es un hombre soltero, que cuida de su mamá Ida, de 48 años y de su padre, Marino, de 50 años, con los que vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Santa clara. A pesar de las diversas dificultades que encontró en la actividad agrícola, le gusta mucho sembrar papa, esa es su principal actividad. Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas, donde cuida con esmero sus cultivos de las constantes enfermedades, que sufren producto del clima de la zona. Hace 8 años que se dedica a ello, tiempo suficiente para conocer las temporadas de mayor venta, en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de “Tarma”, por ello le molesta mucho, cuando insisten en bajar los precios. En adelante tiene pensado comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, con ello está seguro que podrá obtener más ingresos. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y está contento de poder ahorrar con su banco comunal, “siempre tenemos que tener dinero para cualquier imprevisto”, menciona. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará remedios para purificar su cultivo de papa, de las variedades, “canchay”, “yungay” y “andina”, los que sembró en sus 5 terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en: Fredy is 27 years old.  He is single and looks after his mother Ida who is 48 and his father Marino who is 50.  They all live together in their own home in the town of Santa Clara.  In spite of the difficulties which he has faced in his farming business, Fredy really enjoys sowing potatoes which is his main business.  Every morning he heads for his plots of land where he looks after his crops with great care, fighting against the constant diseases which they suffer as a result of the region's climate.  He has been doing this for 8 years, time enough to get to know the best sales seasons in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  For this reason, he gets really annoyed when they insist on lowering prices.  In the future he would like to buy his own land as he is sure that this would help him to make better profits.  This is his eighth loan with MFP and he is happy to be able to save with his community bank.  “We must always have money for any unexpected events” he mentions.  With his loan he will buy remedies to protect his potato crop.  He grows 'canchay', 'yungay' and 'andina' potato varieties which he sows in his 5 plots of land.

loans.use: To buy remedies to protect his potato crops which he sows in 5 plots of land

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
Wilberto de 27 años de edad es casado, labora como tornero para el Taller del Sr. Bismarck Campos desde hace 10 años. 

Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de legalizar el terreno que le dio su papá y al mismo tiempo comenzar los arranques para comenzar la construccion de su casita para brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener su casa con las condiciones necesarias para su familia.
texts.en: Wilberto, 27, is married and has worked as a lathe operator for the Sr. Bismarck Campos Workshop for 10 years. He is asking for his third loan in order to legalize the land his father gave him and also to begin construction on his house and bring greater comfort to his family. His dream is to be able to have a home that is well-equipped for his family.

loans.use: legalize land and begin construction on his home

loans.name: Dany

texts.es: Dany, de 18 años, vive con su papá Luis, de 59 años y su mamá Rosa, de 45 años. A los que quiere y cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Esté emprendedor joven, hace 2 años que viene dedicándose a la agricultura. El tiempo que le resta después de estudiar, lo dedica al cuidado de las plantaciones de café de sus padres. Pero ahora, hace tan solo 1 año adquirió 4 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, donde por fin pudo sembrar sus propios cultivos de café y plátano. El plátano según cuenta cada 15 días los comercializa en el mercado de su localidad, pero la cosecha de café, los vende en la cooperativa de la ciudad de Perene, donde acopian el café para procesarlo. Pero el deseo de Dany, es poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía, con el cual piensa apoyar a los agricultores de su localidad. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y agradece por el apoyo de su banco comunal, donde le dieron fuerzas para salir adelante, sobre todo la oportunidad de ser un hombre independiente y trabajador. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 4 mil plantas de café, con los que renovará sus plantaciones de café, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Dany, 18, lives with his father, Luis, 59, and his mother, Rosa, 45.  He loves and cares for them in their own house located in Sanchirio (Peruvian central jungle).

This enterprising young man has been farming for the last two years.  On his free time when he finishes with his studies he takes care of his parents’ coffee plants.

But now, just a year ago he acquired four hectares of farmland where he was finally able to plant his own coffee and banana plants.  According to him, he sells bananas every two weeks at his local market but he sells the coffee crop to a cooperative in the city of Perene where coffee is amassed for processing.  Dany’s wish, however, is to study the professional career of Agronomy that he hopes to use to help local farmers.

This is his third loan with MFP and he is grateful for the support from his communal bank where they gave him the strength to get ahead, above all the opportunity to be an independent, working man.

If he were to get the requested loan, he will use it to buy 4000 coffee plants with which to renew his coffee plantations. If there is money left over, he will use it to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: To buy 4000 coffee plants and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Begaiym's Group

texts.en:
Begaiym O., 40, is the leader of this group. She is a widow, and she is bringing up a fourteen year old son, who studies at school. Six years ago, in order to cover family expenses, and with the initial investment of 20,000 KGS, Begaiym started to sell fruits and vegetables in the local market. Now she makes about $153 per month.  With money received from the loan, Begaiym wants to expand her business and purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.  In the future she dreams of building a store near her house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 40-year-old man from Rafah city in Rafah refugee camp. Raed lives with his wife and is a NationA. Palestinian Authority employee. Raed's wife doesn't work which makes his salary the only source of income. Raed took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a new fridge to replace the old one he has in his house. The old one was a secondhand fridge which needed a lot of maintenance. 

Raed appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase a home fridge

loans.name: Reina Marisel

texts.es:
Reina, de 35 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vive con su hijo Marco Antonio de 16 años de edad, es madre soltera y alquila vivienda, ella se dedica a la venta de pan dulce, este negocio consiste en trabajar para una panadería y vender el pan en un punto de comercio además vende refrescos y prendas de fantasía desde hace 15 años.
Ella quiere surtir el negocio de fantasía (prendas bañadas en oro) y bebidas refrescantes con la intención de mantenerse activa en el negocio aunque para llevarlo a cabo solicita un préstamo que le ayude a comprar toda la mercadería necesaria para fortalecer el negocio.
