Su sueño es tener el negocio grande y con suficiente mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes, en la búsqueda de ingresos estables para poder algún día tener casa propia donde pueda vivir con su hijo en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Reina is 35 years old; she lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the department of Morazan. She lives with her son Marco Antonio who is 16 years old. She is a single mother and she rents their home. She sells pastries, a business that is involved in working in a bakery and selling the products. She also sells soft drinks and costume jewelry, a business she has had for 15 years. 

She would like to supply her inventory of costume jewelry (gold plated items) and to purchase refreshing soft drinks with the goal of keeping up an active business. She requests a loan to purchase the merchandise she needs to strengthen her business. 

Her dream is to have a large business with plenty of items to offer her clients. Her goal is to have a steady income in order to have a house of her own where she can live together with her son, in greater comfort.

loans.use: Compra de prendas Joyeria

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James T. is a divorced man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

James has run his shop for the past three years, selling at retail to his neighbors and passersby. In addition, he also operates a poultry business that contributes as his other source of income. James faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in his business.

James decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business. With a 40,000 KES loan he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of sugar and paraffin oil. He hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of sugar and paraffin oil

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  Two of his children are currently in school.  David has a piggery, which he has had for two years.

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more pigs for resale.  With the help of the loan, David hopes to generate greater profits and cover school fees and basic needs at home.  In the future, David hopes to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs for resale

loans.name: Afi  Béatrice

texts.fr: Madame  Béatrice est mariée avec  4 enfants  à charge.  Elle est âgée de  43 ans.  Elle  fait  la  vente  de céréales. Elle a commencé cette  activité  en 1989   et  s’approvisionne  à  Atakpamé,  Bassar et à  Sotouboua.  Elle  revend   ensuite   les  céréales  à la devanture   de  sa  maison.  Elle  sollicite un prêt pour acheter  10 sacs de maïs,  6  sacs  d’haricots  et  2 sacs  de  mil.
texts.en:
Mrs. Beatrice is married and has four children. She is 43 years old. 
She sells cereals. She started this activity in 1989 and gets her supplies in Atakpame, Bassar and in Sotouboua. She then sells the cereals in front of her home.

She is requesting a loan to buy 10 bags of corn, 6 bags of beans and 2 bags of millet.

loans.use: Cereal purchase

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: La señora Jacqueline tiene como actividad la venta de cosméticos desde hace 2 años atrás, actualmente es una de las directoras de venta y maneja un grupo de vendedoras, recién instalo su oficina en el centro de la ciudad  de la Paz, donde ofrecerá todo tipo de  cosméticos,  que queda a cuatro cuadras de la plaza san Francisco. El crédito que solicito fue para la equipar la oficina con estantes  y mostradores  y así poder exponer mejor los productos además de tener un lugar para poder  capacitar a las nuevas  vendedoras. La señora vive en la zona de Miraflores en la casa de su madre junto a sus 2 hijos quienes aun están estudiando en colegio, la señora Jacqueline ayuda con los gastos de la casa, su deseo de la señora es el de comprar su propia casa y que sus hijos  obtengan el titulo profesional, es una persona dinámica,  Emprendedora con muchas ganas de superación, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Jacqueline's work, which she started 2 years ago, is selling cosmetics. She is currently one of the sales directors, and she manages a group of salespeople. She recently set up an office in the downtown area of La Paz, where she will offer all types of cosmetics. Her office is four blocks from the San Francisco Plaza. The loan she is requesting is to equip her office with shelves and showcases, so that she can display her products more effectively, in addition to having a place where she can train new salespeople. Jacqueline lives in her mother's house in the Miraflores neighborhood, together with her 2 children, who are still in school. Jacqueline helps with the household expenses, and her desire is to buy her own house and to see her children earn professional degrees. She is a dynamic and enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead. She is grateful to the institution for the support provided to her.

loans.use: to buy showcases to equip her office

loans.name: Victoria Monica

texts.es:
Victoria de 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora que empezó hace 20 años en la venta de lácteos como queso, leche, huevos en diferentes pueblos. Junto un capital y se instaló una pequeña tienda. Es separada tiene tres hijos de 27 ,17 y 10

En la actualidad trabaja diariamente de 6:00 am hasta la noche. Lo que le afecta en su negocio es la delincuencia ya que un día asaltaron a un repartidor de cola y cada vez está más peligroso por su sector. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mercadería para su negocio y así aumentar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere mejorar se vivienda y que sus dos últimos hijos terminen la universidad y sean unos profesionales
texts.en:
Victoria is 44 years old and is a hardworking woman who started to sell dairy products like cheese, milk and eggs 20 years ago in different towns. She saved money and set up a small store. She is separated and has three children who are 27, 17, and 10 years old.

She now works daily from 6am until the evening. What affects her business is the delinquency, as a soda delivery man was assaulted one day and her area is increasingly more dangerous. With the loan, she wants to buy merchandise for her business and increase her profits. In the future, she wants to make housing improvements and for her children to finish college and be professionals.

loans.use: to buy display cases, candy, and vegetables

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 31  años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa propia en el caserío Lagunas ubicado a 25  minutos  de la ciudad de Morrope en el norte de Perú. Su comunidad es rural y pequeña con un aproximado de 300  familias. Se gana la vida desde hace 10  años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. El suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuenta con ingresos adicionales de la preparación y venta de chicha, una bebida típica de Perú hecha de harina de maíz. Sara desea invertir en la compra de aves menores para engorde y alimento balanceado para sus animales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).
texts.en: Sara is 31 years old, single, and she does not have children. She lives in a house that she owns in the community of Lagunas, located at 25 minutes from the city of Morrope in Peru's north. Her community is a small rural community consisting of approximately 300 families. She has earned a living for the past 10 years by raising and selling small livestock from the rear section of her house. She raises pigs, sheep, turkeys, and ducks. When they have reached a good level of development she sells them to the merchants who always visit the region where she lives. She learned this business from her parents, that is to say that she is an expert in the field. She has an additional source of income by preparing and selling chicha, a traditional drink in Peru made of corn flour. She wants to invest her loan in the purchase of small livestock to raise and to purchase balanced feed for them. For this reason she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is a 46-year-old man who lives in Paynesville. He is married with three children between the ages of 12-23. One of them attends school.
Johnny started his business selling cement five years ago and makes a lot of profit during the dry season.

He’s requesting a loan to purchase more bags of cement for his business. He plans to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of cement for his business.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Foday.  He is single, and has no children.  In 2001, in the outskirts of Freetown city, he established his slippers business because he realized his need to be independent and self-employed. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day he earns about SLL 800,000 per month. 

Foday needs a loan of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy more bags of different kinds of plastic slippers for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 200,000.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of different kinds of plastic slippers for his business.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is married and 57 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells both food and daily use products such as soap and shampoo to the people in her community. She has had this business for five years.

Rosie is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more retail items such as detergents, canned goods, and soft drinks.

In the future, Rosie hopes to see her small store grow into a big one and be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as detergents, canned goods, and softdrinks

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef comes from village Meore Sviri, West Georgia. He lives in the village with his wife Marina and three children – 15- and 14-year-old daughters and a 12-year-old son. All three children go to school. 

Josef and Marina run agricultural business of the family, which is their only source of income. They have two milk cows and sell approximately 15 kg of cheese per week on the local open market. Also the family has 0.8 ha of vineyard with 1000 grape vines. Harvested grapes are sold on the local open market by Josef. Along with the above-mentioned, Josef and Marina grow cucumbers and potatoes on their own plot of land. Vegetables are sold on the local open market as well. 

With the requested credit Josef will hire a tractor for tilling part of the plot. He will sow greens, which are highly demanded on the local market. Sales of greens will increase the income of the family. They plan to reinvest the full amount of the received profit from greens in the same business. The development of the greens business will increase the income of the family over the long term.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for the tractor and seeds for greens.

loans.name: Thade

texts.en:
Thade is a father of five children who ages range from 10 to 22 years old. He is 56 years old and very hardworking. Thade works with his wife selling secondhand clothes. He has been running this business for 20 years and it's doing well. It has enabled Thade and his wife to educate their children, feed the family and buy an exotic breed of cow which provides them with milk.

Thade needs a loan to purchase more clothes and make more profits. He bought a piece of land which he partially paid for, and plans to pay the balance in installments. Thade will use the profits to help pay for the land.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 29 years old and is married with a newborn son. He lives in Vanadzor with his young family and his parents. Six years ago, Arman and his father set up a butcher shop. They buy beef, pork, mutton, and lamb from Lori region villages and sell it at a rented stall at the Vanadzor food market. The market is always crowded and Arman never lacks customers. Thanks to profit from his business Arman is able to support his family. 

Arman is requesting an 800,000 AMD loan to buy calves to raise and butcher to sell their meat at his stall.

loans.use: to buy calves to raise and butcher

loans.name: Cumbre De Las Americas Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento entrando a su segundo ciclo conformado por 11 integrantes que viven en la zona del km 14 urb. Cumbre de las américas de ahí el nombre para el grupo,  cuentan con negocio y actividad propias, La presidenta es la Sra. Yanina de edad de 28 años oriunda de la localidad de la Guardia, Su actividad es la venta de comida  hace 4 años que tiene esta actividad, vende variedad de platillos es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que la Sra. prepara riquísimos platillos, el dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra de abarrotes como fideos, arroz, y aceite e insumos para la elaboracion de sus platillos. Su estado civil es casada con el sr. Saturnino el cual es albañil y tienen 1 hijo a su cargo que se encuentra en edad escolar, ambos trabajan por el bienestar de su familia, la Sra. Yanina  es una alegre y dinámica por su responsabilidad y solidaridad con sus compañeras fue elegida presidenta de este banco.                                                                                                Los señores están muy agradecidos con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en ellos y brindarles un apoyo para poder crecer en su negocios y actividades.
texts.en:
This community bank is entering its second loan cycle with 11 members.  The bank's members all live in 'km 14 urb. Cumbre de las Américas' sector, hence the group name.  They all have their own business activities. 

The group's president is 28 year-old Yanina who is from the town of La Guardia.  Her business activity is selling food and she has been in this business for four years.  She sells a variety of dishes and is very well known by her customers as she makes delicious meals.  She will use her loan money to buy groceries such as noodles, rice and oil, and supplies for making her meals.  Yanina is married to Saturnino who is a construction worker.  They have one school-age son in their care.  Both Yanina and her husband work for the well-being of their family.

Yanina is a cheerful and dynamic woman.  Owing to her responsibility and the support she shows to her fellow bank members, she was elected president of her community bank.

The members of this bank are very grateful to our institution for having placed our trust in them and provided them with the support they need to grow in their businesses and activities.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as noodles, rice and oil, and supplies for making her dishes

loans.name: Joseph Albert

texts.es: Joseph Albert, tiene la edad 24 de  años, está soltero y vive con su conyugue e hija. El pretende con el crédito invertir en una  plantación de almacigo de café. El cuenta con un café sembrado en almacigo e invertirá en comprar insumos como fungicidas, abonos y materiales para obtener un buen almacigo. El quiere lograr que el almacigo de café sea bueno para vender un café listo para su siembra y de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su conyugue e hija, logrando así  crecer con el proyecto de la producción de almacigo de café de calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Joseph Albert, 24, is single living with his spouse and daughter.  He intends to use the loan for his coffee seedlings.  He has a field planted with coffee seedlings and he will buy supplies like fungicide, manure and other supplies to obtain good seedlings to transplant.  He wants his coffee seedlings to be good so that he can sell quality coffee plants that are ready to be planted.  He wants to generate higher profits for the wellbeing of his spouse and daughter attaining thereby growth in his coffee seedling business too.

This is his first loan from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur has offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fungicide, manure and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is 32 years old married to a housewife. He has four children aged 11 to 6 months living in his own house in Hioma, Uganda. His goal is to  develop his family. 

He has a business of a guest house and has been running it for 12 years. He has no challenges so far, and he hopes to build more guest houses in the future. 

Ismail needs a loan to buy a pool table and mattresses for the guest house.

loans.use: To buy pool table and mattresses for his guest house.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Lourdes has a shop that sells canned goods, breads, eggs, & dried fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages. 

Lourdes joined HSPFI this year. In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 31 years old with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a divorced from her husband who is a soldier. She has a business selling tea in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. She earns some additional income from selling beans and sugar at home.

Victoria requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a kettle and glasses for tea

loans.name: Nichalika

texts.en:
Nichalika is a widow with four school-going children. She has a house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees for her children and the electricity bill.

She has operated a fish selling business for the past ten years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. She dreams of establishing another fish shop on the other side of Kwale town.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase another freezer and add more fish to her business inventory. She decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of different loan products.

loans.use: To purchase another freezer and add more fish to sell.

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es:
Juan de 20 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Juan maneja su propia mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace un año aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, a pesar de la competencia en el mismo trabajo, él trata en lo posible, desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así pueda tener mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades personales.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi, al tenerla en buen estado podrá brindar un buen servicio,permitiendole pagar su préstamo otorgado.  Juan es una persona responsable y trabajadora que lo único que desea es que su familia tenga lo necesario para salir adelante.
texts.en: Juan is 20, single and lives with his parents.  Their home has running water and electricity, and is located in the district of Olmos, Lambayeque.  This region is known for its agriculture and cattle.  Juan drives a "mototaxi" (a vehicle used for short distance transport which holds 3 people maximum), and has done so for about one year.   He operates the taxi in his neighborhood from the early morning, seeking to transport as many people as possible to increase his income for personal expenses.  Juan seeks a credit from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,500 soles to improve his mototaxi, and to provide better service to clients.  Juan is responsible and hardworking, and hopes to provide for his family.

loans.use: for maintenance and spare parts for a motorized taxi

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva D. 70 años D. edad, es viuda, vive en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo D. luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Elva es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras D. cultivo donD. siembra limón, una vez que realiza su cosecha sus productos los ofrece a los diferentes mercados D. Piura y así pueD. obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos D. su casa.  También cuenta con algunos animales D. corral los cuales cría y luego comercializa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 500 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y alimento balanceado para sus animales, con la finalidad que con su cosecha obtenga mejoras económicas para ella.  Elva a pesar D. su edad sigue trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para seguir mejorando en la vida.
texts.en:
Elva, 70, is a widow.  She lives in her own home, which has only electricity, located in a rural area of the district of TambogranD., in the department of Piura.  The area is known for agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

Elva works in agriculture.  She has her own croplands where she grows lemons.  Once her crop is harvested, she offers her products in different markets in Piura so she can get earnings to cover her household expenses.  She also has several yard animals that she raises and then sells.

Elva has requested a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizers to improve her land and her product, and balanced feed for her animals.  Her goal is to obtain economic improvement with her crops.

In spite of her age, Elva continues working with great effort to continue improving her life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve her land and her product, and balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Paul

texts.es: Paúl de 30 años de edad está casado con Hida de 31 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos de 12, 9, 5 y 3 años de edad. Los 6 viven en la comunidad de Pumpuriani en una casa propia. Paúl cuenta con 5 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. En 4 de ellas tiene sembrado café, divididas en dos partes, una de éstas está lista para cosechar en noviembre y la otra para abril. Paúl es un hombre que sabe distribuir sus terrenos y su tiempo. “Había días difíciles, en que el café no rendía y sólo botaba de 10 a 15 sacos y lo normal era que bote 70 sacos, eso pasaba por que las tierras necesitaban abonarse aún más”, comenta. Por estas razones, más adelante, Paúl comprará otros terrenos con buenas tierras, calculando que invertirá 15000 soles. Cree conveniente la decisión por que así ahorrará dinero en comprar abono por un buen tiempo, mientras tanto seguirá trabajando y ahorrando. Así mismo espera con paciencia que sus hijos sigan creciendo para inculcarlos en las labores agrícolas y cooperen en la producción. Por su parte, Hida está presente cuando él la necesita, ya sea para limpiar los sembríos y cosechar. Ambos no descuidan ningún aspecto de sus vidas, pues la armonía y confianza habitan en su hogar. Paúl estaría muy agradecido si mediante su ayuda el puede seguir entregándose a su familia y terrenos, ya que sería su crédito número 6 de MFP. “Me siento contento con MFP por las facilidades y con mi banco comunal por la confianza que encuentro en él”. Comprará con el dinero sacos de abono de 120 soles cada uno, necesitando 7 sacos por hectárea; lo que complementará con sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Paúl, 30, is married to Hida, 31; together they have four children, ages 12, 9, 5, and 3.  The six of them live in the community of Pumpuriani in their own home.

Paúl has five hectares of farmland.  On four of them he has planted coffee divided into two parts, one of which is ready to harvest in November, the other in April.

Paúl is a man who knows how to divide his land and his time.  "There were hard days when the coffee didn't bear fruit and gave only 10-15 bags, and 70 bags was normal.  This happened because the land needed to be fertilized even more," he comments.  Because of this, later Paúl will buy other properties with good land, calculating that he will invest 15000 PEN.  He believes the decision is advisable because in that way he will save money buying fertilizer for a good time, and meanwhile continue working and saving.

He also hopes patiently that his children keep on growing, to teach them how to do agricultural work and help with the production.  For her part, Hida is available when he needs her, whether to clear the sown fields and harvest.  They don't neglect any aspect of their lives, since harmony and trust live in their home.

Paúl would be very happy if, through your help, he can continue devoting himself to his family and his land, since the loan would be his sixth with MFP.  "I am happy about MFP because of the credit, and with my communal bank for the trust I find there."

With the money he will buy bags of fertilizer at 120 PEN each.  He needs seven bags per hectare, and will supplement with his savings.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Helene

texts.en: Helene is 36 years, with 6 children who are between 3 and 14 years. She married to a commissioner. She sells clothes and she has been in the business for 2 years. She wants to add more bitenge (type of fabrics for ladies) clothes in her business with the loans she hopes to get. With the profits from the business, she expects to buy her own residential house.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for sell

loans.name: Nonvignon2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON2 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Rufine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rufine est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Rufine n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Rufine est mariée à un boucher du nom de Olivier. Le couple à deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Rufine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Afin de contribuer aux charges de la famille, Rufine vend depuis cinq ans, de l’huile végétale et des conserves dans un quartier du Bénin. Rufine s’approvisionne dans un marché au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu,  Rufine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON2, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The NONVIGNON2 group is made up of three people who live in the same quarter. This is the third time that the group has sought a loan from ALIDé in order to boost business. The group's leader, Rufine, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 32 years old and lives in the Benin. Rufine has never attended school. She is married to a butcher called Olivier with whom she has two children who attend school. Rufine lives with her husband and children, and the couple work together to see to their family's needs. In order to see to the family's needs, Rufine has sold vegetable oil and canned foods from a quarter in the Benin for the past five years. She sources her goods from the market in the Benin. In order to meet her customers' needs and to boost business Rufine and the other members of the NONVIGNON2 group are seeking a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans have been successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase canned foods and cans of vegetable oil

loans.name: Shahriniso

texts.ru: Шахринисо жительница города Душанбе. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое сыновей. Шахринисо имеет среднее образование. Она занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном она продает женские национальные свадебные платья и ткани с вышивками. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Shahriniso is a resident of Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan. She is 45 years old, married and has two sons. Shahriniso has a high school degree and manages a market stall. The main focus of her store are traditional wedding dresses and embroidered fabrics. She is taking out this loan to increase inventory turnover.

loans.use: to increase inventory turnover

loans.name: Lazaro Alberto

texts.es:
Lázaro, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, él se dedica a compra de cerdos y venta de carne, también hace canastas artesanales el destazo lo atiende los sábados desde las tres de la mañana, las canastas las prepara en sus momentos libres para venderlas a los vecinos o en el mercado.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar cerdos para el destazo, también comprara más materiales para preparar las canastas, éste inversión de ayudar a para mejorar sus dos negocios y poder tener el dinero necesario para realizar las compras necesarias.
Su aspiración es seguir creciendo trabajando de la mano con préstamos con la esperanza de mejorar futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lázaro lives with his wife and two children who are 8 and 3 years old.  He buys pigs and sells meat.  He also makes artisanal baskets.  He tends to the butchering on Saturdays starting at 3am and makes the baskets in his free time to sell to neighbors or in the market.

He requests a loan to buy pigs to butcher and also to buy the supplies to make the baskets.  This investment will help him improve both businesses and to have the money needed for his necessary purchases.  His aim is to continue growing in work alongside the loans with the hope of improving his children’s future.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Toun

texts.en:
Toun is a 49-year-old, married man. He resides with his wife and their two children in Takeo province, Cambodia.

To earn a living, he and his wife are vegetable vendors. His two children are garment workers.

Toun is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to raise capital for his business so that he can purchase more vegetables to resell to his customers. In the future, he would like to expand his business and to build a kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables for resale purposes

loans.name: Luz De La Esperanza Group

texts.es: Sindy es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Luz de la Esperanza” la cual está conformado por 08 socios entusiastas comprometidos con el Programa- Prosperidad. Sindy es una joven de 23 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, aún dependientes.  Con los deseos de superarse Sindy empezó a estudiar la carrera técnica de  cosmetología,  es así como  inicia su propio  negocio,  pues actualmente cuenta con un salon de belleza donde brinda sus servicios de pintado de cabello, tratamientos capilares y cortes, este negocio le ha permitido ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. El  deseo de Sindy es de comprar su propio local, ya que por el momento solo lo alquila. Ella solicito el crédito a Edaprospo  para la compra de tintes, peines, tijeras y ropas para sus hijos. La Alcancía Comunal “Luz de la Esperanza” agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso.  Adjuntamos la fotografía de Dademia.
texts.en:
Sindy is a member of the Alcancía Communal Bank called Light of Hope which has eight enthusiastic members committed to the Prosperity Program.

Sindy is a young, 23 year old woman, living in a common-law marriage, and she has two children who are dependent on her. 

With the goal to succeed, Sindy began to study to be a cosmetologist, and this is how she began her own business. Currently she has a beauty salon where she offers her services of hair coloring, hair treatments and cuts. This business has permitted her to help her partner with the household expenses. Sindy’s dream is to buy her own facility, as at the moment she is renting. She is asking for a loan from Edaprospo in order to buy dyes, combs, scissors, and clothing for her children. 

The Alcancía Communal Bank Light of Hope is grateful for the loans you provide that make their progress possible. 

Attached to the group photograph, is a picture of Dademia.

loans.use: to buy dyes, combs, scissors and clothes

loans.name: La Unión Es Progreso - Cajas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Cesarina es casada y tiene 6 hijos, siempre carismática y emprendedora. Actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal “UNION ES PROGRESO” de la localidad de San Agustín de Cajas, grupo conformado por 09 personas. 
Cesarina  se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de comida cerca a su casa, labor que la realiza por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas  con su esposo se dedican a la agricultura cultivando productos en su propia chacra cerca a su localidad. 
El préstamo lo invertira en la compra al por mayor de los insumos que necesita para preparar la comida que vende tales como: arroz, azucar, aceite, entere otros. En un futuro cercano ella piensa acondicionar una parte de su casa como restaurante. Gracias a los ingresos de su  pequeño negocio educa a 03 de sus hijos que aun están en el colegio.
En la fotografía que podemos apreciar, Cesarina es la segunda socia de la izquierda , ella se encuentra de pie vestida con una chompa verde y blusa blanca.
*En la parte superior derecha de la fotografía se encuentra la Sra. Beatriz.
texts.en:
Cesarina is married and has six children.  She is a charismatic and enterprising member of the Union Es Progreso communal bank.  The bank is located in San Agustín de Cajas, and it is comprised of nine people.

Cesarina sells food in an itinerant manner close to her house.  She does this in the afternoons.  In the mornings she works with her husband cultivating products on her own farm, which is close to where she lives.

The loan she is requesting is to increase capital for her business.  She is planning on setting up a space in her in her house to open a small restaurant.  

Thanks to the income from her small business, her three minor, who are still in school, are getting an education.

In the photograph Cesarina is the second member to the left.  She is wearing a green sweater and a white blouse.

Sra. Beatriz is located in the upper right hand corner of the photo

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Juana Benita

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 34 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Juana no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y solventar sus gastos, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Juana trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por la calidad de sus productos y por las facilidades de pago que les brinda a sus clientes.
Juana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio, tales como prendas de vestir de la estación de verano, sandalias, entre otros; así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propi y espera convertirse en una empresaria de éxito.
texts.en:
Juana is a 34 year old single woman who lives in Chincha.  She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enterprising person with a great desire to succeed.  Unfortunately Juana was not able to study for a professional career because she had to go to work when she was very young in order to help her parents financially.  She would have liked to have liked to study.  She likes to watch television in her spare time and on occasion likes to cook a delicious rice and duck dish to share with her family.

Juana works in her small clothing sales business with great enthusiasm.  She sells clothing and shoes for men, women, and children and works daily from early morning for up to eight hours.  She feels comfortable doing her work and believes that things are going well for her because of the quality of the products she and ease of payment she offers her customers.  

Juana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy merchandise, such as summer seasonal clothing, sandals, and other things to stock her business.  She will continue to work hard to get ahead and achieve her dream of having a home of her own and having a successful business.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Dimo

texts.en: Dimo P. is 22 years old. He is a second year law student in University. Although his dream is to be a lawer Dimo is familiar wit agriculture since he was a little boy. His family has always have an agriculture business and he knows almost everything about it. So two years ago Dimo decides to start own business. So he builds a greenhouse in the yard of his house and starts growing vegetables, especially cucumbers. The money that he earns of this business Dimo spends to pay his university fees. Dimo P. applies for $ 1 000 loan which he will use to supply seedings and fertilizers for his vegetable growing business.

loans.use: To supply seedings and fertilizers

loans.name: Yolanda Patricia

texts.en:
Yolanda is 32 years of age, is married and has a young son attending primary school. Her husband works as a bus driver and his salary is not enough to support his family. Two years ago Yolanda started her business selling used clothing to help her husband with the family's expenses and their son's education.

With your generosity and support this family can have a better life. Yolanda needs a loan of $300 that she will put towards the purchase of clothing for her business so that she may offer a wider variety for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Yolanda tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo que asiste a la primaria, su esposo trabaja como chofer de un autobús y el salario que recibe es muy poco para el sustento de su familia. Desde hace dos años Yolanda empezó su negocio de venta de ropa seminueva para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares y así sacar adelante a su familia y la educación de su hijo.

Tu generosidad y apoyo puede lograr que esta familia tenga una mejor vida, Yolanda necesita un préstamo de $300 dólares que utilizará para la compra de ropa para continuar con su negocio y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.en:
Ponciano is a very optimistic and hard-working man. He is married and has six children. Five are already married. His youngest daughter lives with him, as does one of his sons and his family. Ponciano grew up in a family of meager resources but has managed to support himself through hard work at various jobs. Three years ago he decided to sell corn-on-the-cob, which has gone well for him. He now has many customers. In order to grow his business, Ponciano is seeking a loan of $550 to buy a cart with which he will be able to go where his customers are and increase his sales. He promises to repay the loan in 6-12 months. This is the time to help him. Ponciano wants to continue working and with your support he will be able to. Thank you.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

El señor Ponciano es una persona muy optimista y responsable, es casado, tiene seis hijos, de los cuales cinco ya están casados y con él vive su hija más pequeña y uno de sus hijos y su familia. Ponciano viene de una familia de muy bajos recursos y ha logrado salir adelante con base en mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, realizando diversas actividades, hace tres años decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de elotes y afortunadamente le ha ido bien, ahora tiene muchos clientes.

Para poder crecer con su negocio, Ponciano requiere de un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que invertirá en la compra de un carrito para poder transportar sus productos, acercarlo a sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Ponciano solo quiere continuar trabajando y con tu ayuda lo logrará, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To buy a cart.

loans.name: Daysi Damaris

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Daysi Damaris. I am an entrepreneur. I own a small business selling new clothing, which is located in my home in the center of my neighborhood. I have 2 daughters who are in school. Thanks to my income, I am able to contribute to the family expenses and I can pay my providers. At this moment, I need to stock my store better because customer demand has risen and I don't have enough capital to satisfy my customers.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

Hola Mi nombre es Daysi Damaris, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva ubicado en mi casa de habitación en el centro de mi colonia, tengo 2 hijas las que estan en la escuela, gracias a los ingresos que persivo puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con proveedores, actualmente nesecito surtir un poco mas mi negocio ya que la demanda de cliente a crecido y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer a mis clientes.

loans.use: To buy shoes, blouses, men's shirts, jeans, sneakers, girls shoes, perfumes, skirts, and sandals.

loans.name: Ingilab

texts.en: Ingilab is a 35-year-old resident of Saatli town. He is married and has two children. He is engaged in cattle breeding. Cattle breeding is traditional in the region and Ingilab has been in this business since 2002. He has a shed in his yard. He raises cattle and sells them alive in the local market or delivers them to butchers. Now he has two adult cows and wants to buy two more calves to raise them, as well. He is applying for a loan of $500 for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Irene Gálvez

texts.en:
Irene is fond of saying that “the responsibility drives the will.” She believes that where there's a will there's a way. She says that no matter what happens in your life, if you have your dreams as motivation you’ll succeed in life.

She is 25 years old, and has two handsome and loved boys (five and four years old). Her husband is a lieutenant. Irene has always dreamt of graduating from a good university and working in a profession. However, after her first pregnancy, she had to stay in home to take care of her baby. Shortly after, she had her second son, and she had to find a job or do something to help her husband with the household expenses.

She obtained a loan from our organization and started to sell natural medicines by catalog. She also sells natural hair care and skin care products in addition to natural remedies. Her business is very profitable. Her sales volume has gone up during the last two months, and now she makes a weekly profit of USD 50.00. Irene has requested a new loan to acquire more products in order to increase her sales volume. She says that additional money will help her continue her university studies, dropped a long time ago. The entrepreneur has a very positive attitude and thinks that she will have the opportunity to reach her goals and prove that it’s never late to succeed in life.

loans.use: To buy natural medicines for resale

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam lives in the region of Aley. She has two children and is working to provide her family with a decent living. Wissam does crochet work and handicrafts. She needs a loan of $300 in order to buy the needed material for her crochet and handicraft work.

loans.use: Wissam would like to buy the needed material for her crochet and handicraft work.

loans.name: Mirtalia

texts.es:
For 15 years the lady Mirtalia M. has worked selling clothes of all sizes and for all ages in the Israel Lewites market of the city of Managua. She has her own section at the market which she has invested a lot in. Being a single mother with two small children to support, she has managed to supply greater quantities of clothes for her business.

The business began 15 years ago, when she sold by walking in all the markets, being exposed to the sun and to the physical wear produced by walking a lot. Little by little she began to invest in order to pay for a location in the market until she finally obtained it.

Since her achievement of obtaining the section in the market three years ago, she has completed 8 loans with Ceprodel that have greatly impacted her business by allowing her to buy greater quantities of clothes to offer. In addition she has been able to maintain the nucleus of her home, being a single mother, and she has been able to offer an education to her two small children that today more that ever need their mother.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 15 años en la ciudad de Managua en el mercado Israel Lewites, la señora Mirtalia M. se dedica a la venta de ropa de todos tamaños y para todas las edades. Posee un tramo propio el cual le ha costado mucha inversión y por ser una madre soltera y con dos hijos pequeños a que mantener ha logrado surtir de mayores cantidades de ropa su negocio.

El negocio lo comienza hace 15 años vendiendo ambulante en todo el mercado, exponiéndose al sol y al desgaste físico de producidos por el caminar mucho. Poco a poco comenzó a invertir para pagar un local interno en el mercado hasta que lo obtuvo.

Desde que logro obtener el tramo en el mercado hace tres años, ha realizado 8 créditos en Ceprodel que le han impactado grandemente por el hecho de que ha comprado mayores volúmenes de ropa para ofrecer y además ha podido sostener el núcleo de su hogar por ser madre soltera y brindarle la educación a sus dos pequeños que hoy mas que nunca necesitan de su madre.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Busei A South B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hasifa N.. She is currently in the business of cattle and poultry and is requesting a loan to buy another cow for business. Hasifa is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man dealing in cattle and poultry for work. She has 10 children ranging from age 5 months to 14 years and her children go to school. Each week, Hasifa makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Hasifa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy poultry chicks, and the loan was paid back on time.

Hasifa is joined in her small group by Madina M., Deborah M., Mariam B., and Fatuma W.. Madina M. has a poultry business and wants to buy more chicks. Deborah M. is currently operating a business in tailoring and wants a loan to trade more cloth materials. Mariam B. operates a business of selling used clothes and wants to start selling new clothes. Fatuma W. is currently in the business of selling produce and is requesting a loan to trade a bigger variety of produce.

loans.use: To add in poultry business

loans.name: Zaina's Imani Group

texts.en:
Zaina is 38 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 18, 11, 8, 6, and 4 years old. Zaina owns a small charcoal store, which she started many years ago. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal  for her business

loans.name: Iva A Centre - Group 4

texts.en:
For these 2 women of Iva on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They both undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account ,and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Samoana S., 43, is married with no children. Her husband is both a farmer and a fisherman. Her loan will be used to buy equipment to support starting businesses in both of these fields. She will purchase pesticides, a knife, goggles, a spear and a wheelbarrow.

Seulata A., 47, is married with 4 children. She is starting a business selling taro, yams, bananas and other produce. Her loan will be used to purchase weed killer, pesticides, and a wheelbarrow. Her family has been growing vegetables for years, so it will not be a difficult business to start.

loans.use: Purchase weed killer, pesticides, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Bine

texts.en: Bine A. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 60 years old and married with 7 children. She sells local gin and kerosene. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more local gin and kerosene for sale. Bine has been borrowing from LAPO micro finance for the past 2 years. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more local gin and kerosene

loans.name: Aufaatasi

texts.en: Aufaatasi J., 56, is widowed with 5 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the taro and taamu business. She sells to the public and villagers 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Aufaatasi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She also uses loans for improving her flea market where she sells fruits, vegetables and chips.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Ajdar

texts.en: Ajdar is a therapeutist. He was born in 1954. This kind man lives in the Khachmaz region. He is married and has 3 children. He has been as therapeutist for 10 years. He enjoys his business, because he helps people to be in good health. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy an apparatus for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy an apparatus for improving his business.

loans.name: Manuel Martín

texts.es:
Martin is only 39 years old. He lives with his wife Carol, with whom he has two marvelous children, who are in school and are his reason for striving onward. He is the owner of a motorcycle transport, which he has managed for the past 3 years with the same driver. He is multifaceted in the work he does, since he also raises turkeys and has his own popular dance hall. His daily activities of managing his transport service, his dance hall, and care of his birds is a routine that requires the whole day, but he does not get tired of his work, since he has visions of business for the future. He likes his activities because they keep him busy and with his charisma it enables him to be a decisive and proactive man. He wants to repair his motorcycle, as well as remodel some aspects of his dance hall, which is why he is requesting this loan. In the future Martin hopes to rent a space to open a business where he can sell turkey.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Martín cuenta en la actualidad con 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa Carol, con quien tienen dos maravillosos hijos, los cuales estudian y son su razón de seguir adelante. Es propietario de un motocarro, el mismo que lo hace trabajar desde hace 3 años con un chofer particular, él es muy polifacético laboralmente ya que también se dedica a la crianza de pavos y cuenta también con un local de baile muy concurrido. Sus actividades diarias de administrar su motocarro, su local y cuidar sus aves es rutina de todo el día, con lo que no se siente cansado ya que tiene muchas visiones de negocio para el futuro. Le gustan sus actividades ya que lo mantienen activo y el gran carisma con el que cuenta hacen de él un hombre decidido y pro activo. Quiere mandar a reparar su motocarro, así como también, remodelar algunas aspectos de su local de baile, para lo que solicita este préstamo, posteriormente quiere alquilar un local para poner su negocio de venta de carne de pavo.

loans.use: Repairs for his motorcycle and remodeling of his dance hall.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is in retail because she has always had a penchant for it and because she does not like to rely 100% on her husband’s income. Furthermore, she wanted to help him out with the family expenses. For this reason, she sells American clothing.

She needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase clothing in bulk. With your support, she will be able to achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina se dedica a las ventas ya que siempre le han llamado la atención y no le gusta depender 100 % del sueldo de su esposo, además de querer ayudarlo con el gasto familiar. Es por eso que se dedica a la venta de ropa americana.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar unas pacas de ropa. Con tu apoyo podrá lograrlo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther I. is a long time restaurant owner that sells cooked foods like rice, beans, yams, etc. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She buys her foodstuffs from the local market in her community. Her restaurant is open everyday at 8:am and closes by 7:pm. She is requesting a loan of $600 to buy more foodstuffs for cooking to sell to her customers. Esther is 60 years old and is married with 9 children.  Her eldest child is 30 years old and her youngest child is 16 years old. She thanks Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking to sell at the restaurant

loans.name: Uy

texts.en:
Mr. Uy S. M. lives in Tuol Daoung Kaing village in Kandal province and has a hectare of land for cultivating rice. In this agriculture, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to plant rice, so he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.  He will also buy fertilizers to support his field and produce a better crop. 

His wife, Mrs. Sien Seang, helps him on the plantation.  Mr. Uy S. M. is 53 years old and the father of seven children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while three others are attending the local school.  The youngest one is too young to study or work because that child is only four years old.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers to support his field and produce a better crop.

loans.name: Gloria Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en el PSJ. San Martín Mz. 154 Lt. 24, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 60 años de edad, es viuda, madre de 7 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega. Viendo grandes resultados en sus ganancias decide ampliar más su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, 15 kilos de menestra, etc.   

Gloria manifiesta que recibe apoyo de Manuela Ramos. Se sienta contenta y feliz con todo lo que ha logrado en la vida.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the "Paradise" Community Bank, located at PSJ. San Martín Mz. 154 Lt. 24 in the district of Yarinacocha in the province of Cronel Portillo in the suburb of Ucayali. She is 60 years old, a widow, and the mother of 7 children who are now grown up. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, Gloria decided to begin selling groceries. She has been working with the community bank for 2 years. Currently, she relies on her store as a source of income. After realizing how profitable her store had become, she decided to expand it. With this loan of 2,000 Soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, Gloria will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, 15 kg. of vegetable broth, etc. It is clear that Gloria receives the support of Manuela Ramos, and she feels content and happy with everything she has achieved in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, and 15 kg. of vegetable broth,

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị T. tham gia quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Qua 4 năm tham gia Quỹ  chị T. luôn hoàn trả vốn đúng hạn và thực hiện tốt các Quy định của Quỹ. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi hai vợ chồng chị T. còn  làm thêm nghề đan thúng để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Ngoài ra hàng tháng hai con của chị đều hỗ trợ thêm cho bố mẹ nên thu nhập của gia đình chị T. rất ổn định. 
Vòng vốn tới chị T. mong muốn được vay thêm 7.000.000đ, một phần chị sử dụng để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để đầu tư cho con gái làm may.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi T. has been with TYM Fund since 2004. In the past four years with the fund, she has always paid back her loans on time and follow the fund's rules well. Currently, in addition to raising livestock, Mrs. Pham and her husband work as basket weavers to increase the family's income. Her two children also help the couple out financially each month, so the family's income is very stable. She would like to borrow 7,000,000 VND to partly invest in raising livestock and to invest in her daughter's tailor business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene L. married very early. This hindered her from finishing her college education as BS-Secretariat. However, she never regrets her decision to marry. She is happy today raising her three children who are already in high school. Her husband is a rice grower, Everyday he tills the land and plows the field to prepare the soil for the planting season. Her husband  works diligently in their 1-hectare farm, which she inherited from her parents. She considers herself lucky because he married a man who is willing to provide for all their needs.
 
Arlene is asking for a loan from CEVI to purchase fertilizer, rice seeds, and chemicals for their farm. Through this loan, she will be able to help her husband triple his harvest. She will use the loan to sustain their farm business. In this way, she believes that she will have enough food for her family and extra harvest to sell in the market. She is also considering some other possible income areas to augment their income.

CEVI believes that the poor are bankable. Through the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage services that they provide to all their clients, they make a lasting impact and improve people's lives.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
LA FAMILIA DE ANTONIO ESTA CONFORMADA POR SEIS PERSONAS, LA ESPOSA SUS CUATRO HIJOS DE 16, 14,11 Y 7 AÑOS Y ÉL. ANTONIO VIVE JUNTO A SU FAMILIA EN UNA CASA QUE ES PROPIA. ES EMPLEADO FIJO DE LA INDUSTRIA DE ACEITE FINO CON MUCHOS AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA, ADICIONALMENTE CUENTAN CON LOS INGRESOS POR TRANSPORTES DE SU MOTO TAXI. LA COMPETENCIA EN SUS ACTIVIDADES ES MEDIA  YA QUE EN LA ZONA  EXISTEN OTRAS PERSONAS QUE SE DESEMPEÑAN EN EL MISMO RUBRO. EL CREDITO SERA DESTINADO PARA LA COMPRA DE UNA NUEVA MOTO TAXI.       
EL SOLICITANTE ES EXCELENTE CLIENTE DE LA INSTITUCION  ESTA  ES SU CUARTA OPERACION.
texts.en:
Antonio’s family is made up of six people: his wife, his four children ages 16, 14, 11 and 7, and himself. Antonio lives with his family in their own home. He is a full-time employee in the cooking oil industry with many years of experience. His family also depends on the income generated by his motorcycle taxi. There is some competition in the motorcycle taxi business because there are several other people in the area who provide the same service. The loan will be used to purchase a new motorcycle taxi. The applicant is an excellent client of the Kiva field partner. This is his fourth loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Motorcycle Taxi

loans.name: Fatima Akhtar Hussain Group

texts.en:
Fatima baji, the wife of A. H., has lived in Riwind, Pakistan for the past 12 years. She is the mother of two sons who are in kindergarten. Faima baji’s husband runs a barber shop where he cuts hair and shaves. Fatima baji is applying for a loan to buy razors and scissors for her husband’s barber shop. 

She is a the leader of a group of women in her locality. Khursheeda baji and Nasira baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk-selling businesses. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a barber shop

loans.name: Eufrin

texts.es: El señor Eufrín C. Calderón ingresó a nuestra institución el día 9 de octubre del año 2006 solicitando un crédito para su apoyar su actividad de la venta de calzados. Desde ese momento él ha trabajado con créditos individuales donde ha demostrado ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Él junto a su esposa, la señora Saturnina Alborta Vera, mantienen su hogar y crían a su pequeño hijo con mucha dedicación y esmero. Ellos viven en la zona Villa Mercedes, lugar que se encuentra a una gran distancia de su negocio, pero ese no es un impedimento para que ellos sigan trabajando y esforzándose por mejorar su vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Señor Eufrín C. Calderón became a client of this communal bank on the 9th of October, 2006. His first loan was used to develop his shoe selling business. Ever since then, he has received a number of loans and has always been very responsible with making his payments. He and his wife, Señora Saturnina Alborta Vera, run their household and raise their little son with a great deal of dedication and care. They live in Villa Mercedes which is quite a distance from where they work but of course, this does not stop them from working hard and pushing themselves so that they can better both their own lives and that of their son.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise: shoes

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor Z. and his wife live in Kahovka, Kherson region. His kids are grown and live separately. Igor runs a small mobile business selling construction and remodeling supplies in marketplaces in the Kherson region. He has been working in this niche of trade for 14 years. Currently he has 73,000 Hryvnia in working capital.

Igor is focused and determined. His experience working in the construction and remodeling spheres helps him to be very organized and efficient in his business. Igor is hoping to see the number of construction sites in the Ukraine increase which would subsequently stimulate development of his venture. He is seeking a loan of 6,350 Hryvnia to purchase additional construction supplies for retail sale.

We believe this client has a great potential and the current loan will only add to the success of his growing business.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction supplies to sell.

loans.name: Mahida

texts.en:
Mahida is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa region with her husband and their eight children. Mahida has been selling clothes from her house since 2002. Mahida has requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her business. This is her third loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

Mahida feels that she is special in her business because she knows how to treat her clients and because she sells nice clothes. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Mahida decided on beginning her business because she wants to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her business by purchasing a shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her clothes business.

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en:
Khasan U. is a very courageous man who is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising livestock. He's the father of four children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need.

In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, Khasan has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of animals to breed on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family.

It's for this reason that Khasan comes to AqroInvest Credit Union a second time for a loan for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them. He has a successful loan history and the reputation of good client.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en:
Taiwo is 40 years old and married with three children. She has a shop where she sells gift items and wedding accessories.

She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more gift items and wedding accessories to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gift items and wedding accessories to sell

loans.name: Pout

texts.en:
Pout S. is an older, widowed mother of two children who are married and are still living with her in the family home. One, her daughter, owns a small shop in the market that provides a beauty salon service.

Pout S., 57, makes a living by selling Khmer noodles to her villagers, which earns her an average of $5 profit a day. She will be using this loan to support her daughter’s beauty salon by buying extra hairdressing tools and perfumes for the business.

loans.use: To buy extra hairdressing tools and perfumes for her daughter's beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks  for her business

loans.name: Rosario Cristina

texts.es: Doña Rosario C. tiene 24 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos”, habita junto  a su esposo e hija, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de laborar en tejidos   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Xerachochac del  Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Doña Rosario C. is 24 years old, married, and has one daughter. She is a craftswoman who makes traditional fabrics. She and her husband work in the same shop with their two employees. They have been operating their weaving business for 6 years from home in Paraje Xerachochac in the Poxlajuj sector, Totonicapán District, Guatemala.

Now that customer demand has increased, they are not in a financial position to increase their capital. For this reason, they have approached Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. They intend to buy raw materials needed to increase their sales. Doña Rosario hopes that her family will get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ma. Fatima

texts.en:
Ma. Fatima B. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old, and is married with one infant-aged child. To make a living, Ma. Fatima is into retail business of which she has a variety store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling variety of products like vinegar, tomato sauce, soy sauce and others. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities. She is sometimes into another type of business wherein she makes snacks and other delicacies and peddles it to the local community.

In 2009, Ma. Fatima joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Fatima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Ma. Fatima is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Bendila

texts.en:
Bendila B., a 30-year-old mother of six children and married to a clerk in the United Nations Mission in Sudan (UNMIS), has a business selling foodstuffs at a restaurant.  She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to be cooked for sale in the restaurant.  In the future, Bendila intends to build a wholesale shop at Jebel Kujur market. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more food materials in the restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the size of her business.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Marisol es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Marisol tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir a pedido, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de personal, además sus prendas los vende en las ferias.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Marisol son construir su casa y tener un taller mas grande.

loans.use: Para la compra de telas.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and has two grown kids. She is an entrepreneur from Pavlograd.

Ludmila sells children’s clothing and footwear in the central marketplace of her home town and has been in this trade for three years. Presently, her turnover amounts to 50,000 Grivnyas and her net profit is about 5,500-7,500 Grivnyas a month. 

Ludmila is seeking a loan of 8,200 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise, i.e. jackets, jumpers and assorted footwear for children. She wants to stock her kiosk with good quality inventory that will sell well and bring her a good income

Ludmila seeks to keep her business running and thriving as it’s the only source of income for her family. She believes this loan will be very beneficial for further growth of her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S. is a villager in Prey Meas village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who has a 2 hectare field to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Duong Chhum, is a village chief.

Since the work place is far from their house, Mrs. Mom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work in order to reduce the distances. Mrs. Mom S. has four children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, el caballero José María A. se dedica a laborar con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar y suplir las necesidades de su casa y familia compuesta por su esposa e hijos. 

Es importante destacar que él tiene mucho conocimiento en el ramo de las computadoras y trabaja fuertemente porque necesita realizar compras de electrodomésticos para su hogar porque los necesita para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y así suplir todas las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
José María A. lives in the department of León and works very hard in order to provide sustenance to his home and meet the needs of his home and family, made up of his wife and children. It is important to stress that he has very good computer skills and works hard to buy needed home appliances to provide better living conditions for his family and thus meet his home's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home appliances.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky G. is from Rizal, Santiago City. She is 41 years old, married, and has three school-aged children.

Vicky owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector managing a direct selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling cosmetics and apparel products of AVON,Natasha,MSE and Sundance. Vicky has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Vicky joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which she will used to purchase more items to sell. This loan will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Beveline

texts.en:
Beveline R. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Beveline is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Beveline owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Beveline is just starting this business.

In 2009, Beveline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beveline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Beveline's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Kebiri A Katuma Kadija Group

texts.en:
K. Kadija is a businesswoman, thirty-two years old. She is married with five children of whom four are schooling. She is also looking after one dependent.

Kadija deals in shoes which has been her business for over five years. She is using the loan in her business of selling shoes: that is to say, shoes for children, women and men.

Kadija is encouraging, hardworking and so active. Her dream is to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for her business

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reyna Isabel O., tiene 40 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida en el Barrio Laureles Sur, el señor trabaja como Guarda de Seguridad y es el principal sostén económico de la casa, con ellos vive su hija de 16 años que trabaja como mesera en una cafetería, ellos son una familia humilde pero trabajadora y honrada, la señora Reyna realiza trabajos domésticos en casas particulares, en el barrio donde la familia habita dentro de las mejoras primordiales que se necesitan están el reconstruir la pared del frente de su casa esto le dará mayor seguridad a la familia y le permitirá poco a poco el mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna Isabel O. is 40 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laurles Sur. Her live-in partner works as a security guard and is the main breadwinner of their household. They have a 16 year old daughter who works as a waitress at a café. Reyna and her family are modest, hardworking, and honorable people. She performs domestic work at private homes in the neighborhood where she lives.
