Reyna’s home is in need of major improvements, including the reconstruction of a wall in front of her house. This will provide greater security for her family and will help them gradually improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reconstruct a security wall in front of her house

loans.name: Ndèye Awa

texts.fr: Ndèye Awa F. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA-SUD depuis 2 ans et a bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a régulièrement remboursés. Elle développe un petit commerce de fruits et légumes comme activité principale et fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Ndèye Awa F., 47, is single and has no children. She has been a member of the Village Bank SANTHIABA-SUD for two years and has received four loans that she has reimbursed in a regular fashion. She is working at expanding a little fruit and vegetable sales business as her primary activity and does processing and sale of peanut oil. Her goal is participating in supporting her family and adding to her savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
Maria Nicolasa A. C. tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, y vive con sus padres.  Tiene un hijo de 5 años y una hija de 2 años.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria es agricultora y siembra mora.  Vende el producto en la comunidad cuando vienen los comerciantes.  También cuenta con otros cultivos de maiz y papas y pollos para consumir.  Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos y liquidos para la mora.  Dice que la mora es dificil cultivar por el mantenimiento.

Su sueño es darles los estudios a sus hijos.  En sus tiempos libres, le gusta coser y ver tele.
texts.en:
Maria Nicolasa A. C. is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She has a five year old son and a two year old daughter.

Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Nan”, which means “New Road” in Quechua. The group consists of 18 women who work in agriculture. They live in the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. All of them have a great desire to work with credit so that they can get ahead in life.

Maria is a blackberry farmer. She sells her product in the community whenever the traders pass through town. Maria also grows other crops, such as corn and potatoes, and raises chickens for personal consumption. She is requesting a loan to buy composts and liquid fertilizers for her blackberry crop. According to Maria, this crop is difficult to cultivate because it requires significant maintenance.

Her dream is to provide her children with an education. In her spare time, she enjoys sewing and watching television.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & liquid fertilizers for her blackberry crop

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en: Silvester is a 31 year old single man who has been running an electronic shop for eight years. He has one employee to assist him in the business. He also practices farming to increase his earnings. He hopes to expand his business by opening other business outlets in the near future. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to borrow one loan of KES 20,000. He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy electronic equipment for his shop.

loans.use: To buy electronic equipment.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Ramón M., es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como vigilante habita en el barrio Carlos Fonseca, es acompañado y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.

El Juan Ramón M. , solicito el crédito para realizar unas reparaciones en su casa ya que poco a poco la ha hecho de concreto.
texts.en:
Juan works as a security guard at the Chinandega city hall in the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood. He is married and has a school-aged son. He is requesting this loan in order to be able to make some repairs to his home, which he has been doing little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Nenita's Group

texts.en:
Nenita B. is 52 years old and from the town of Malitao Echague. She is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nenita B.'s group.

Nenita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 20,000 PHP will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the ninth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more provisions for her shop

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov B. is 38 years old and his wife, Mrs. Kolab Choeng, is 35 years old. They have been married since 1990 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Three of the children have full-time employment while the other two are still young, live in the family home and attend school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Pov was not available when the photograph was taken so his wife is shown instead.
Pov has been working on construction sites for four years. His children’s work is far from their house so they sometimes have to ride with their relatives or take a motor taxi, which is very expensive. It’s difficult for them to get to work, therefore Pov is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie U. is from the village of Malalinta. She is 45 years old. Vergie is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Vergie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Vergie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately PHP 3,500 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Vergie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergie has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 13,000 from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Vergie is requesting a new loan of PHP 10,000 which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Vergie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam R. has been spending her life cultivating vegetables. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. Also, she cuts and sells the crops to the market retailer when they come to maturity. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. 

She is married and has two kids; both are no longer in school and are employed. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. The coming rainfall is good for growing, however, Sam R. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So, Sam R. is looking for a loan to use toward purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting. She wishes to repair her old house by using the remaining money from the loan.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting

loans.name: Elphas

texts.en:
Elphas is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. He has been doing mixed farming for over 15 years, producing milk, bananas, eggs, maize, beans and vegetables which he sells locally. He is also engaged in the cereal business.

He is 43 years old and married with 6 children between the ages of 1 and 16. Four of the children are currently attending school. His biggest challenge in farming has been high competition and lack of a market for his products.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of KES.62,400 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with this loan the family will have access to enough milk and the proceeds from the sale of milk will be directed to the education of his children.

In 5 years' time, he hopes to have 5 quality dairy cows, two greenhouses and a poultry farm. He acknowledges Juhudi for giving people loans, though he says Juhudi should diversify their products.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Amar Azul Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Amar Azul” es una asociación que solicita crédito por séptima vez, es parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho mujeres, tienen como presidenta a la señora Miriam Mejía. 

La señora Miriam desde hace ocho años que tiene el negocio de elaboración de chamarras y deportivos, los mismos que se distinguen por los bordados, que son su especialidad.

La venta es realizada en su tienda de la avenida Kollasuyo en la ciudad de La Paz.

Este crédito es por Bs.2000.-, el que servirá para la compra de materia prima, debido al invierno, la demanda de chamarras es mayor.
 
En el caso de las  integrantes de la asociación comunal, tienen negocios como venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, producción de buzos de lana, venta de Batidos, pensión y confección de ropa.
texts.en:
The Amar Azul Community Association is seeking its seventh loan. It is part of the central office of Los Andes, and is made up of eight women. The president is Sra. Miriam Mejía. Miriam has been making jackets and sportswear for eight years. Her products are distinguished by their embroidery which is Miriam’s specialty. She sells the clothing from her store in Kollasuyo Avenue in La Paz. The loan of Bs.2000 will be used to buy supplies. Because it is winter, the demand for jackets is higher. The members of the Association have businesses such as a clothes stall, neighbourhood store, food sales, making woolen sweaters, milk shake stall, guesthouse, and making clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric, fasteners, and thread

loans.name: Yolanda Beatriz

texts.es:
Yolanda Beatriz S. C. tiene 25 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. 

Yolanda es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Yolanda se dedica a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para seguir su agricultura y sembrar cacao. El préstamo lo ayudara en mejorar su situación economico. Su sueno es tener un propio terreno. 

En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda Beatriz S. C. is 25 years old. She is married, and she lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. Yolanda is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all, and most of them are farmers. Yolanda grows corn and rice. She makes her purchases and sells her products in the Ventanas canton. She is requesting this loan to continue farming and to plant cacao. The loan will help her improve her economic situation. Her dream is to have her own land. In her free time she likes to play with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To continue farming and to plant cacao

loans.name: Essi

texts.en: Madame Essi K. is 41 years old and lives in her birthplace, Lome, Togo. She sells 'argile', a kind of clay used for construction. Madame K. purchases her merchandise across the border in Ghana to sell near her home in Lome. She has requested a loan of 500,000 CFA in order to purchase 50 more sacks of the clay. She is the mother and sole caregiver of two children. This loan will hopefully provide her with a more stable and increased income in order to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase 50 sacks of construction clay

loans.name: Sabrine

texts.en:
Sabrine Muhammad R. and her husband, Asaad, own a grocery store in Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza Strip. They have four sons and one daughter who are school students and under 18. Sabrine shares working in the store with her husband and sometimes their children help when they don't have homework.

Sabrine took a $1,500 loan from FATEN to purchase a display fridge for the frozen goods they sell and also to  purchase more goods as people consume more food during the holy month of Ramadan.

Sabrine's husband appears in the photo as Sabrine doesn't like to be photographed.

loans.use: To purchase a display fridge and more stock

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Tan T. N. is 46 years old with two children who are in college. She has a shop that sells the fresh meat of pigs. Her shop has been open in the local market since 2005 – one year after she received a loan from SEDA.

She used her previous loan of 5,450,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) very successfully for running the shop. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy pigs as fresh products for her shop.

loans.use: To buy pigs as fresh products for her shop

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 62 años, tiene un taller de costura y confección vive en una zona periurbana llamada Duran de Guayaquil. Su esposo es sastre y le ayude en ocasiones en el negocio. 

Desde pequeña ella comenzó a practicar en el ambiente de costura y confección cuando se decidió realmente a estudiar costura fue cuando empezó a trabajar y tener practicas en esta profesión. Ahora ella tiene su propio taller trabaja desde muy temprano. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas para hacer mas confecciones y poderlas vender y exhibir como su propia ropa. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor is 62 years old and has a tailor shop where she sews and makes clothes.  The shop is located in a suburb called Duran de Guayaquil.  Her husband is a tailor and helps her with the business from time to time.

She began sewing and making clothes when she was a little girl.  It was when she began to seriously study the art of sewing that she began working and practicing this profession.  Now she has her own shop.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fabrics to make more items and be able to sell and show them as her own line of clothing.  In the future she wants to finish building her house and expand her business.

loans.use: Fabric

loans.name: Miguel Santiago

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel Santiago C. G.  el es Trabajador activo de la Alcaldía Municipal de San Rafael del Sur  desempeñándose como responsable de trasporte tiene dos años de trabajar en esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de Repuesto y mantenimiento de su moto taxi ya que el brinda el servicio de moto taxi en la localidad, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Miguel Santiago C. G. is a worker in the town of San Rafael del Sur working in transportation.  He has been working in this area for two years, he is married, and he has a child in school.  He has had four loans from CEPRODEL and has been used to replace or maintain parts of his moto taxi so that he can offer moto taxi service in his town.  The loans from CEPRODEL have greatly benefited him as he has been able to improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: Repairs and Maintenance of Moto-Taxi

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
MONICA B. C.
Mónica es socia del banco comunal Las caseritas,  distrito de manatay departamento Ucayali, es casada y su esposo es trabajador independiente, tiene una hija menor de edad  y la  ilusión de progresar en su negocio.
Mónica lleva año y medio trabajando con los prestamos que Manuela Ramos realiza, el cual le ha servido para implementar la bodega que tiene en su casa. 
Su ultimo préstamo  de s/. 1,200 soles lo invertirán todo en su bodega para surtir con algunos productos que son muy consumidos este fin de año como son: 3 cajas de  chocolate en barra, 4 cajas de paneton,  2 cajas de leche,  1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz y 2 cajas de champan,  
Mónica  da las gracias a Manuela Ramos, por el apoyo que brinda a las mujeres que lo solicitan para iniciar sus proyectos, pequeños pero que los hacen con mucha ilusión y con todas las ganas de hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Caseritas”, which is located in the District of Manatay, Department of Ucayali. Her husband works independently. She has a young daughter and dreams of advancing her business.

Mónica has worked with loans from Manuela Ramos for a year and a half. She used the funds to establish the grocery store she manages in her home. This latest loan in the amount of 1200 PEN will be invested entirely in her store. Mónica will restock her business with a few products that are widely consumed toward the end of the year such as three cases of chocolate bars, four cases of panettones, one sack of sugar, one sack of rice, and two cases of champagne.

Mónica thanks Manuela Ramos for the support it provides to the women who ask for it so that they can start projects and small businesses. She is very excited and looks forward to making her business grow.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis alberto es un padre de familia que reside junto a su esposa y a su pequeña hija en el caserío San Isidro del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ovejas, el cría estos animales en algunos ambientes ubicados cerca a su domicilio y las alimenta de pastos naturales. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona y a sus propios vecinos. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar limón.

Luis desea adquirir mas ovejas y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. Luis es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien trabajador y honesto.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a father, living with his wife and small daughter in the San Isidro housing development, Tambogrande district.  This is a farming area located in the Piura province, Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

He raises and sells sheep, keeping the animals in places located near his home, and feeding them with natural grasses.  When the sheep are well developed, he offers them for sale to traders who visit that area, and to his own neighbors.  He also farms, and has a small plot where he usually plants lemon.

Luis wants to have more sheep and balanced feed to expand his business and bring in more money, and for this reason he has found it advantageous to request a loan of 1,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Luis is a calm, reliable person.  Those who know him consider him to be hard-working and honest.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and balanced feed to expand his business (raising and selling sheep).

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a married lady with two children. To earn a living, she operates a medical clinic, which she opened four years ago. Her clinic serves mainly the people in her local area. So far, she has managed to employ one person. She also does poultry farming to supplement her family’s income. She dreams of expanding her clinic in five years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy medicine and an Hb machine.

loans.use: To buy medicine and an Hb machine

loans.name: Islombek

texts.en:
K. Islombek is 33 years old and lives in Shahrituz. He is married and has 4 children. Islombek is the only breadwinner in the family and he is a hard-worker.  For many years Islombek has managed his own café where he serves his clients and also takes orders for meal preparation without home delivery. Islombek is trying to have fresh foodstuff and tasty meals in his café and to ensure his clients have the possibility to eat, to have a rest and make their necessary purchases. Islombek wants to increase the number of his clients, so he decided to increase the size of his café. Now he needs $3000 USD to build a new roof on his café.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Expanding his business in order to earn more money.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos de 32 años de edad, reside en San Miguel departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de ropa, vive con su esposa, aun no tienen hijos, el negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, venden todos los días de la semana, de 6:00am a 5:00pm, de forma ambulante, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de comercio.
Por el momento quiere compra más ropa para ofrecer a los clientes, por lo que solicita un préstamo para llevar a cabo la inversión, este préstamo ayudara a incrementar el inventario, a desarrollarse como comerciante, atender mejor a los clientes ofreciendo variedad de prendas de vestir.
Su sueño es mantener vivo el negocio a largo plazo, obtener un puesto estable donde ofrecer su mercadería, atraer a clientes para que sus prendas puedan ser vendidas y generar ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 32 years old and lives in San Miguel, in San Miguel department.  His business is selling clothes.  He lives with his wife but doesn't yet have any children.

Juan Carlos' business came about through his own initiative.  He makes his sales every day of the week, from 6.00am to 5.00pm.  He makes his sales as an itinerant street vendor and has been in this line of business for 4 years.  Right now, he would like to buy more clothes to offer to his customers.  He is requesting a loan so that he can make this investment.  The loan will help him to increase his inventory, develop as a salesman and better serve his customers, offering them a wider range of clothes.

Juan Carlos' dream is to keep his business going in the long term, to obtain a stable sales location where he can sell his merchandise and to attract customers so that he can sell more of his clothes and make more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. Alice has a business selling fruits and vegetables, which she has run for less than a year.
To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase fruits and vegetables. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Alice hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Alice hopes to own a house. Alice is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by showing her the benefits of being helpful to one another.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables
